title: Market Research Virtual Assistant (U.S. Real Estate – Data Analysis & Local Market Research)
description:
About the Role



We are looking for a highly detail-oriented Virtual Assistant to conduct structured market research on small towns and cities in Texas, USA.



Your primary responsibility will be identifying communities that show stable population trends, strong economic stability, and limited competition in specific industries (primarily self-storage real estate).



This is research-heavy work that requires independent thinking, strong data gathering skills, and excellent organization.



Main Responsibilities

 • Research towns and cities within a 90-minute drive of Frisco, Texas

 • Collect and analyze population trends (recent and historical)

 • Identify local economic activity and major employers

 • Review school district enrollment trends and expansion activity

 • Evaluate housing market activity (permits, development, home sales)

 • Identify and analyze existing self-storage facilities in each town

 • Determine if new storage construction has occurred or is planned

 • Gather information from local government and public data sources

 • Organize findings into structured spreadsheets

 • Write short summary reports explaining key insights and risks



?



Required Skills

 • Strong internet research skills

 • Advanced attention to detail

 • Proficient in Excel or Google Sheets

 • Ability to follow structured research criteria

 • Strong written English communication

 • Ability to verify information from multiple sources

 • Organized and dependable



?



Preferred (but not required)

 • Real estate research experience

 • Market research or data analysis background

 • Experience using government or public data sources

 • Familiarity with demographics or economic development research

title: Long-Form YouTube Editor (Educational / Authority Style)
description:
EXAMPLE OF EXACTLY WHAT I WANT FOR THIS 1ST VIDEO: 
 and 





We are hiring a long-form YouTube editor for an elite sports training brand focused on developing defensive backs (DBs) for Division 1 football.



This is NOT a 
-style editing job.



We create structured, educational, authority-driven content. Each video is 18–25 minutes and designed to feel premium, clean, and intentional — like a masterclass, not a vlog.



You will be editing videos that include:



• Talking head footage

• Miro board walkthroughs

• Frame-by-frame football film breakdowns

• Athlete highlights

• Offer screenshots and stats graphics

• Clean proof integration



The goal of each video is to:



• Build authority

• Maintain strong retention

• Explain a structured system clearly

• Drive qualified applications



Editing Style Requirements



The final product should feel:



• Clean and structured

• Minimal but engaging

• Professional and premium

• Educational (not flashy)

• Cinematic but subtle



We do NOT want:



• Overused sound effects

• 
 edits

• Excessive animations

• Distracting graphics



Clean cuts. Clean motion. Clean pacing.



Responsibilities



• Tight jump cuts (every 4–6 seconds when needed)

• Light zoom-ins for emphasis

• Clean transitions between talking head, Miro board, and film clips

• Highlighting key text during explanations

• Simple motion graphics (pillars, timelines, breakdowns)

• Integrating screenshots and proof professionally

• Basic color correction

• Audio cleanup and leveling

• Subtle background music integration



Ideal Candidate



You:



• Have edited long-form YouTube content before

• Understand pacing and retention for 20+ minute videos

• Are detail-oriented

• Can follow structured creative direction

• Are comfortable editing sports footage

• Prefer minimal, premium editing over flashy edits



Bonus if you’ve worked on:



• Educational channels

• Coaching content

• Sports breakdown videos

• Authority-based brands



Output Expectations



• 1 long-form video per week (18–25 minutes)

• Turnaround time: 3–4 days

• Open to revisions and feedback



We are building long-term. This is not a one-time project.

title: Geotechnical Engineer
description:
We are an Australian-based professional services business seeking a reliable, long-term Geotechnical Engineer based in the Philippines to support our growing geotechnical team. This is a remote role offering ongoing work and close collaboration with Australian project engineers.



Role Overview:

The Geotechnical Engineer will primarily support the team through geotechnical assessments, technical report preparation, and design support for Australian projects. The role suits someone with strong technical fundamentals, excellent reporting skills, and familiarity (or willingness to learn) Australian Standards.



Key Responsibilities

1. Geotechnical Assessment & Reporting

Site investigation findings

Engineering analysis

Clear, practical recommendations

Provide engineering input for:

Foundation design

Excavations and ground support

Pavement and subgrade assessments

Ensure reports comply with relevant Australian Standards and project specifications

Collaborate remotely with Australian-based engineers and stakeholders

Support ongoing geotechnical tasks as directed by the project lead



2. Geotechnical Assessment & Design Support

Assess soil and rock conditions for proposed developments

Provide engineering recommendations for:

Foundation systems

Earthworks and site preparation

Pavement subgrade conditions

Excavation and ground support requirements



About You

Degree in Geotechnical Engineering, Civil Engineering, or related discipline

Experience in geotechnical reporting and interpretation of investigation data

Strong written English skills, particularly for technical reports

Familiarity with Australian Standards is highly regarded (training can be provided)

Detail-oriented, reliable, and comfortable working remotely

Looking for a long-term role with a stable Australian business



What We Offer

Long-term, ongoing remote work

Exposure to Australian engineering projects and standards

Supportive team environment with clear guidance

Competitive compensation based on experience

title: Virtual Tax Accountant / Personal Finance Systems Pro
description:
Virtual Tax Accountant / Personal Finance Systems Pro



Contract | Remote | Growth Opportunity



Why you’ll love this job: You’ll work with a smart, kind, and fun client who values excellence, plans ahead, and believes accounting systems should make life easier—not harder.



The Mission



Make my 2025 taxes painless and build simple, durable systems so 2026 and beyond are a breeze.



I’m a former CEO and magazine publisher seeking a sharp, proactive virtual tax accountant who gets things right the first time, anticipates next steps, and builds clean systems that actually stick. This role is light and predictable long-term; the real lift is upfront—organizing and systematizing in time for the April 15, 2025 deadline.



What You’ll Do



2025 Tax Prep (Immediate Priority)



Prepare and/or coordinate filing of personal taxes and two rental properties



Organize and reconcile 2024–2025 data efficiently



Identify deductions, risks, and opportunities early (no last-minute surprises)



Ask smart questions upfront and communicate clearly throughout



Ongoing Accounting & Monthly Oversight



Provide light monthly reporting so year-end is turnkey



Oversee accounting for two rental properties

(Property manager already provides P&Ls—you’ll integrate and oversee, not recreate)



Maintain simple tracking for personal finances



Keep everything clean, current, and tax-ready at all times



Systems & Workflow



Design a secure, low-friction workflow for expense and revenue tracking

(Preference for methods that do not require sharing bank logins)



Recommend and implement practical tools—simple, secure, and sustainable



Create clarity without overengineering



Who You Are



A true go-getter who anticipates needs and follows through



Precise, organized, and calm under deadlines



Proactive communicator—responsive and reliable



Comfortable working with high-performing, professional clients



Strong judgment around security, privacy, and controls



Fluent in modern accounting tools and best practices (and English)



You take pride in making complex things feel simple—and making your clients feel on top of their finances.



Requirements: 



Bachelor's Degree in Accounting

CPA or EA credentials

4+ years experience in tax accounting

Experience with rental properties

Background supporting executives, founders, or creatives



Structure & Growth



Fully remote / virtual

Contract role to start

Light monthly workload after ramp-up

Potential to grow into a broader advisory or financial oversight role if performance is strong



How to Apply



Send a brief note explaining:



Your experience with personal + rental property taxes



The tools/systems you prefer for secure, low-friction, confidential workflows



What the first 10 days would look like

title: MCA Underwriter | Full-Time EST
description:
Hours: Mon–Fri, EST business hours overlap required





About the Role

We're a merchant cash advance company looking for a skilled underwriter to join our team. You'll be responsible for reviewing MCA applications, analyzing merchant financials, assessing risk, and making funding recommendations. This is a high-volume, fast-paced role where speed and accuracy both matter. You'll work directly with our sales and funding teams to move deals through the pipeline efficiently.



What You'll Do



Review and analyze incoming MCA applications and supporting documents

Examine 3–6 months of business bank statements to evaluate cash flow, daily balances, and revenue trends

Identify red flags such as NSFs, negative balances, stacking, and undisclosed positions

Calculate key metrics including average daily balance, monthly revenue, and deposit consistency

Determine funding amounts, hold-back percentages, and terms based on risk assessment

Issue approvals, declines, or request additional documentation with clear reasoning

Communicate underwriting decisions to the sales team with turnaround expectations

Maintain accurate records and notes in the CRM/underwriting platform

Meet daily volume targets (typically 15–25+ applications per day)

Stay current on MCA industry trends, compliance requirements, and risk factors





Requirements

Must-haves:



2+ years of hands-on MCA or alternative lending underwriting experience

Strong ability to read and interpret business bank statements quickly

Understanding of MCA-specific risk factors — stacking, split funding, seasonal businesses, etc.

Experience calculating daily balances, average monthly revenue, and position exposure

High attention to detail with the ability to spot inconsistencies and fraud indicators

Comfortable working in a fast-paced, high-volume environment

Reliable internet connection and quiet workspace

Available during US business hours (at least 9 AM–5 PM EST)

Strong written English for internal communication and deal notes



Nice-to-haves:



Experience with underwriting tools like DecisionLogic, Plaid, Ocrolus, or LendingFront

Familiarity with CRMs such as Salesforce, HubSpot, or industry-specific platforms

Background in other alternative lending products (revenue-based financing, business lines of credit, equipment financing)

Experience training or mentoring junior underwriters

Knowledge of UCC filings and lien searches





What We Offer



Stable, long-term full-time position — not a short-term project

Clear underwriting guidelines and support — you won't be guessing

Opportunity to grow into a senior or lead underwriter role

A team that values speed, good judgment, and reliability

title: Amazon Account Coordinator
description:
Job Summary

The Account Coordinator works closely with the Account Management Team, provides essential support for their book of business by focusing on daily health checks, resolving Amazon Vendor and Seller Central support issues, and making routine updates to product listings within Amazon's backend systems. We are looking for an account coordinator who is skilled in managing product listings, optimizing product pages, and troubleshooting complex technical issues that arise within the Amazon platforms.



Key Responsibilities

* Maintain and update brand catalog on Amazon.

* Monitor brand health, account status, and listing performance.

* Ensure optimal account health and performance by resolving listing, inventory, and compliance issues.

* Troubleshoot and fix errors related to product listings, inventory, and content optimization.

* Initiate and manage cases with Amazon Support to resolve account-related challenges.

* Assist with product feed uploads and category mapping within Amazon’s backend.

* Track and report key account performance metrics to ensure compliance and growth.

* Set up FBA shipments.

* Having Walmart experience is a plus.



Qualifications

* C1-C2 English proficiency.

* At least two years of experience working with Amazon required.

* Advanced experience in Amazon catalog management, including bulk uploads and product feed troubleshooting.

* Strong understanding of Amazon’s policies, requirements, and listing guidelines.

* Proficient in MS Office and/or Google Suite.

* Ability to work independently and collaboratively within a team.

* Excellent verbal and written communication skills.

* Ability to manage multiple priorities and meet deadlines.

* Strong attention to detail and problem-solving skills.

* Results-oriented and self-motivated with outstanding attention to detail.

* Bachelor’s degree or comparable experience.

* Excited by the opportunity to work with a variety of clients across many industries.

* Ability to work both independently and as part of a team.

* A love for e-commerce - we talk and live e-commerce all day, every day!



Work Location / Setup

* Willing to work onsite in Cebu City, IT Park.

title: Founding Operations Partner / Future Chief of Staff (US Tech Startup)
description:
Please watch Loom about the project.





If link doesn't appear, manually enter: loom dot com / share / 3f0a09caa61845dc8e6a65598ef724b9



Hi, I'm Jack. I am a solo founder building a US-based technology startup called DearlySent. We are building a social relationship network designed to bridge the gap between digital intention and physical action. My goal over the next decade is to serve 100 million monthly active users and fundamentally change the way human beings show care and love to one another.



I personally work 12 hours a day, 6 days a week, and I absolutely love what I do. I am intensely driven, but I cannot scale this alone. I am looking for my right-hand partner. I am looking for someone with high fluid intelligence, deep empathy, and a builder’s mindset to join me on the ground floor.



**My Promise to You (The Anti-Micromanagement Guarantee):**



This is not a daycare. You are an adult, and you will be treated as a peer and a partner.



- I will **never** use Time Doctor, Hubstaff, or any screen-recording software.

    

- I will **never** force you to punch a clock.

    

- I do not want your mechanical hours; I want your mind, your heart, and your soul. We will work in symbiosis to build something incredible. I care about output, execution, and trust.

    



**The Trajectory & Compensation (The 4-Month Ramp):**



I do not pay hourly, because I do not want you to have "hours anxiety." If you build a system that saves us 10 hours a week, you should not be penalized with less pay. I pay a stable monthly salary for your output and ownership. We will scale your salary and your responsibilities together over the first four months:



- **Month 1 (The Foundation): $800 USD / month.** Expectation is roughly 20 hours of focused output a week. You will learn the DNA of the company, help with Ritz-Carlton level customer care, execute rigorous QA testing of our app, and build our initial operations tracking.

    

- **Month 2 (The Builder): $1,200 USD / month.** Expectation grows to ~30 hours a week. You take over affiliate outreach, competitor research, manage video creators, and build our Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs).

    

- **Month 3 (The Operator): $1,600 USD / month.** Nearing full-time. You take over daily operations so I can focus purely on engineering and marketing. You manage the digital fulfillment prep and own customer support.

    

- **Month 4+ (The Partner): $2,000 USD / month.** Full-time ownership. You are officially my Chief of Staff. You manage the systems, and when we are task-saturated and need to hire more people, _you_ will lead the interviews.

    



**Long-Term Respect & Benefits:**



- **13th Month Pay:** I proudly and proactively pay the 13th-month bonus every December.

    

- **Healthcare:** Once you reach Month 4 (Full Partner status), you will receive an additional $50/month stipend specifically for your local HMO.

    

- **Growth:** A guaranteed minimum 5% annual pay raise, with room for much higher performance-based increases as the company's revenue scales.

    



**Who You Are:**



- **Flawless English:** You will be communicating with our premium US customer base and directly with me.

    

- **Empathetic:** You actually care about people. Our company exists to remind people of their value.

    

- **A Systems Thinker:** You don't just solve a problem; you build a system so the problem never happens again.

    

- **Tech-Savvy:** You embrace AI (ChatGPT, Claude, Gemini) to make yourself faster and smarter.

    



---



### **How to Apply (The 3-Phase Hiring Process):**



To find the perfect partner, I do not read generic cover letters. We are breaking this process into three phases to ensure we are a perfect fit.



**PHASE 1: The Introduction**



Do not send a resume or a cover letter. Instead, record a 3-to-5 minute video (Loom, YouTube, etc.) answering these three exact questions:



1. Explain a complex technical or operational problem you solved in the past.

    

2. Tell me about a specific act of kindness you’ve done for someone recently, or something kind you would like to do for someone.

    

3. What is a piece of technology or software that you believe is perfectly engineered, and why?

    



Attention to Detail Check: Please make the subject line of your application message: "Generosity: [Your Name]" so I know you read this entire post).

Applications without videos will be immediately deleted and not reviewed.  



**PHASE 2: The Deep Dive**



I will review every single video. The top candidates will be invited to Round 2, where I will ask you to record a second video detailing your specific background, your career ambitions, and more personal details about who you are. 



**PHASE 3: The Paid Trial**



The top finalists will be paid $50 USD to complete a real-world practice project for our company and take a brief alignment/personality assessment. You will be actively encouraged to use AI to complete this project.



The final candidate will be offered the position immediately.



If you want to just clock in, do data entry, and clock out, please do not apply. If you want to build a unicorn startup, take ownership of a mission, and grow into a tech executive, send me your video. Let's build something incredible together.

title: Virtual Assistant - Amazon E-Commerce Business
description:
20 Hours/Week (w/ success Full-Time 40 hours possible) | Long-Term Role | Growth Opportunities



I run a fast-growing Amazon e-commerce business and am building a serious team, not hiring random freelancers. We are scaling aggressively, and this role is for someone who wants stable, long-term work, not side gigs.



If you are analytical, disciplined, and want to grow inside a real business — keep reading.



THIS IS NOT AN EASY JOB



This is a performance role. You will be trained, but results matter.



If you:

Need constant supervision

Guess instead of using data

Submit random products without analysis



This is not for you.



If you:

Think in numbers

Like research and data

Want stability and growth



You’ll do very well here.





YOUR MAIN RESPONSIBILITY



You will be finding profitable products to sell on Amazon using online stores and research tools.



This includes:

Product sourcing (Online Arbitrage & Wholesale when assigned)

Reading and analyzing Keepa charts

Using SellerAmp or similar tools



Checking:

Sales volume

Competition

Profit margins

ROI

Buy Box stability

Tracking all leads in spreadsheets

Following detailed SOPs



PERFORMANCE REQUIREMENTS



Your job is to submit QUALIFIED LEADS, not random links.



A product is considered qualified if it meets:

Estimated 50–200+ sales per month (higher is better)

Minimum $3.00 profit per unit

Minimum 30% ROI

Stable pricing history (no crashing)

No major Amazon risks (IP complaints, hazmat, etc.)

50 or less to Ungate or Already approved



Daily Target: 4-6 quality leads per day





TRAINING & GROWTH

You are required to improve.



Each week:

You will watch 1 training video

You will submit a short video showing you applying what you learned

This is a growth position. The better you get, the more valuable you become.



Meetings w/ Management monthly to review lead quality and areas of improvement



PAY

Trial Period Pay: $2.00/hour over 1-2 weeks



Once Hired:

Part Time: 20 hours per week (Opportunity to move to Full Time, 40 hours with Long Term Success)

Paid weekly



Performance Bonus:

+$1.00 for every lead that becomes a purchased product



IDEAL CANDIDATE

You are:

Detail-oriented

Comfortable with numbers and spreadsheets

Honest and reliable

Fast learner

Able to follow systems

Interested in long-term work and Growth

Experience with Amazon sourcing, Keepa, and/or SellerAmp is a HUGE advantage, but mindset matters more than experience.



IMPORTANT RULES



Work hours must overlap with PST

Strong internet connection required

Must be comfortable recording your screen when needed

This is a long-term role, not short-term freelance



HOW TO APPLY (REQUIRED)



To be considered, you must submit:

A 2–3 minute video introducing yourself

Your experience with Amazon or product research

What tools you have used (Keepa, SellerAmp, etc.)

Why you want a long-term role



Applications without video will be ignored.



WHO THIS JOB IS PERFECT FOR



Someone who wants:

Stable income

Long-term position

Growth inside an expanding business

To become highly skilled in Amazon sourcing 

Potential equity in a growing business



If that’s you — apply and prove it.

title: Accountant - Australian Accounts
description:
About the Role:



We are looking for a dedicated and skilled Tax Accountant with at a minimum of 5 years of experience working with Australian taxation. You will be responsible for processing tax returns and preparing financial statements for individuals, companies, and trusts. This permanent work-from-home opportunity offers a stable work environment with day-shift hours, following Australian business time.

Prepare financial statements in compliance with Australian accounting standards.

title: Operations Manager — Automation Agency
description:
Operations Manager Automation Agency |

Hours: Mon–Fri, EST business hours overlap required





Who We Are

We're a growing automation agency that builds custom n8n workflows, API integrations, and AI-powered systems for e-commerce and logistics companies. 



Who You Are

You're the person who walks into chaos and creates order — without being told how. You've managed operations at an agency or tech company before, you understand automation and APIs at a working level, and you don't need hand-holding to figure out what needs to happen next. You see a gap, you fill it. You see a fire, you put it out. You're the adult in the room.

This isn't a VA role. This is a right-hand operator position. You'll own the day-to-day operations so the founder can focus on selling and building.



What You'll Own



Client management — Be the main point of contact for active clients. Handle updates, requests, timelines, and expectations so the founder isn't in every Slack thread and
 chain.

Project management — Track all active builds across clients. Know what's on track, what's behind, and what's blocked — before anyone has to ask.

Scoping and QA — Review client requests, scope out what needs to be built, and QA completed n8n workflows and integrations before delivery. You don't need to be the best builder, but you need to understand what you're looking at.

Team management — Manage VAs and contractors. Assign tasks, review output, hold people accountable. Eventually, hire new tea
mbers as we grow.

Building systems — Create the SOPs, processes, and documentation that don't exist yet. Build the operating system for the agency from the ground up.

Light building — Handle simpler n8n workflows and automation builds independently, freeing the founder for complex architecture work.





Requirements



3+ years in operations, project management, or agency management

Working knowledge of automation tools — n8n, Make, or Zapier (you don't need to be an expert builder, but you need to understand workflows, APIs, and webhooks)

Experience managing remote teams (VAs, contractors, or developers)

Comfortable communicating directly with US-based clients via Slack,
, and occasional video calls

Highly organized with a track record of building processes where none existed

Self-directed — you figure out what needs to happen and do it without waiting for instructions

Strong written and spoken English



Apply Here:

title: LinkedIn Ghostwriter — AI & Automation Agency
description:
The Role

We're looking for someone to fully own and manage the founder's personal LinkedIn profile. The founder runs an automation agency serving e-commerce and logistics companies — so the content needs to reflect deep knowledge of AI, automation, and how businesses actually use these tools to grow. This isn't generic "5 tips for productivity" content. We need someone who understands the AI and automation space, follows the trends daily, and can turn that knowledge into scroll-stopping LinkedIn posts.



What You'll Do



Write and publish 4–5 LinkedIn posts per week in the founder's voice — a mix of insights, hot takes, case studies, and thought leadership around AI and automation

Stay on top of AI news and trends (new tools, use cases, industry shifts) and turn them into timely, relevant content

Engage daily on target prospects' and industry leaders' posts with thoughtful, value-adding comments — not generic fluff

Manage inbound DMs and send personalized outreach to potential clients and partners

Grow the founder's network strategically — connecting with e-commerce operators, logistics companies, agency owners, and tech decision-makers

Track key metrics weekly: follower growth, post impressions, engagement rate, DM response rate

Collaborate with the founder on content ideas — bring topics to the table, don't wait to be told what to write





Requirements



1+ year managing LinkedIn profiles (ghostwriting, personal branding, or agency experience)

Genuinely knowledgeable about AI and automation — you follow this space because you're interested, not because it's a job requirement

Can write in a natural, conversational, opinionated tone — not corporate, not ChatGPT-sounding

Understands the LinkedIn algorithm — what gets reach, what gets engagement, what gets ignored

Proactive and self-managing — you plan the content calendar, not the founder

Strong written English with the ability to match someone else's voice

Familiar with AI tools (ChatGPT, Claude, Midjourney, n8n, Make, etc.) — bonus if you actually use them



Apply here:

title: Photoshop Mockup Creator (PSD Smart Object Specialist)
description:
We are looking for a highly skilled Photoshop Mockup Creator to help us convert JPG and PNG images into realistic, high-quality PSD mockup files.



This is a project-based role to start. However, if the work meets our quality standards and instructions consistently, we are open to hiring you part-time as a Graphic Designer for ongoing work.



If you are detail-oriented, highly organized in Photoshop, and experienced with smart objects and professional mockup structuring — we want to hear from you.



Responsibilities

 • Convert JPG/PNG images into fully editable, realistic PSD mockup files

 • Create properly structured Smart Objects for easy editing

 • Organize layers in clean, clearly labeled folders

 • Use non-destructive editing techniques

 • Maintain realistic lighting, shadows, reflections, and perspective

 • Follow specific instructions and brand guidelines

 • Deliver high-resolution, professional-quality PSD files

 • Revise files when necessary to meet project standards



Required Skills

 • Advanced proficiency in Adobe Photoshop

 • Strong experience creating Smart Objects

 • Excellent layer organization and file structuring

 • Understanding of lighting, perspective, and realism

 • Experience creating product mockups (preferred)

 • Strong attention to detail

 • Ability to follow instructions precisely

 • Ability to meet deadlines consistently



Deliverables



Each PSD file must:

 • Include properly created Smart Objects

 • Be neatly layered and grouped

 • Have clearly labeled folders

 • Be easy for our team to edit

 • Be delivered in high resolution

 • Include all source files



Messy files or flattened layers will not be accepted.



Compensation

 • $1–$5 per PSD file (depending on complexity)

 • Higher rates possible for more complex mockups

 • Consistent work available for reliable performers

 • Opportunity to transition into a Part-Time Graphic Designer role



Ideal Candidate

 • Takes pride in clean, professional PSD files

 • Works efficiently without sacrificing quality

 • Communicates clearly

 • Is responsive and reliable

 • Wants long-term remote work



To Apply



Please include:

 1. Your Photoshop experience (how many years?)

 2. Portfolio of mockups you personally created (PSD samples preferred)

 3. A screenshot of a layered PSD file you structured

 4. Your expected turnaround time per mockup

 5. The word “SMARTMOCKUP” in your application subject line



Applications without portfolios will not be reviewed.

title: Influencer Outreach Specialist
description:
We’re excited to onboard you into the Affiliate Recruiting Program.

We’re officially rolling this out next week, and we’re bringing on as many affiliates as possible (1000–2000+) in a network-style structure. The goal is to make this simple, legitimate, and rewarding for everyone involved.



How This Works

We are providing every affiliate recruiter with a proprietary lead list built using:

• automated data pipelines

• compliant lead aggregation

• behavior-based filtering

• funnel-ready segmentation

This removes the hardest part for recruiters: finding high quality affiliate leads. We’re doing that work upfront and providing you with the list of pre-vetted creators that are in our industry and highly interested in and open to collaborating

Affiliate Requirements (to get paid)

To qualify for payouts, each affiliate must:

1. Post 2 videos that clearly promotes or positively mentions the program and express intention to continue in the future

2. Affiliate link is in Creator’s profile

3. Express genuine support / positivity toward the brand (this is for legitimacy)

4. Use their unique affiliate code (generated inside our portal)

A recruitment is defined as one posted video that incorporates the brand and the affiliate joined the affiliate portal to work with us (they will be compensated in their respective portal).



Compensation

• 1.5$/hour

• $25 per affiliate who posts 2 qualifying videos + $100 for every 10 signups

We want long-term relationships with our affiliates so sharing our brand values is encouraged.



Timeline

• Affiliate portal

• Official program start: 02/24/26

• Each affiliate will sign up via their affiliate URL/code portal



We’re building this so affiliates can focus on creating content while we handle:

• Affiliate onboarding

• Affiliate promotions

• The projects affiliates are working on



Benefits

Uncapped earnings — no limits on volume

We provide leads and curated prospect lists

Proven outreach scripts ready to use

Weekly meetings to strategize and hit targets

Full support of the Healsend family



We’re looking forward to working with you and expanding our affiliate network together.

title: Bookkeeper/Accountant
description:
We need someone that can do bookkeeping for an enterprise company.

Needs to be familiar with Quickbooks Desktop and Quickbooks Online. 

Must have experience in double entry bookkeeping and entering journal entries.

Should have experience with A/P, A/R, time entry, and payroll.



Part-time or Full-time.

Must exclusively work with our company. Not looking for someone who is working for multiple companies or have side-jobs.



Must be willing to daily overlap 6 hours with PST time. (9am-5pm)

Those willing to overlap more hours will be given preference.



Must be willing to install and use Time Doctor.

title: Operations Coordinator – Sales & Appointment Setting (Remote)
description:
Family-owned construction and remodeling company hiring for a remote, full-time sales and appointment-setting role.



Position Overview

• Handle phone-based pre-sales calls to qualify leads and book appointments

• Manage scheduling, confirmations, follow-ups, and lead tracking

• Serve as the first point of contact for potential customers

• Maintain accurate documentation and reporting

• Represent the company professionally on all phone calls

• Work from a quiet, phone-appropriate environment with excellent call quality



Requirements

• 3+ years of experience in construction pre-sales, dispatching, appointment setting, or sales support

• Background in construction or remodeling companies (required)

• Strong phone sales and appointment-setting experience

• Excellent spoken and written English

• Clear, neutral English with no heavy accent

• Comfortable speaking with U.S.-based clients

• Strong customer service and persuasion skills

• Highly organized and detail-oriented

• Ability to work independently with full accountability

• Comfortable handling high call volume

• Ability to work 10 hours per day, 6 days per week

• Option to work 7 days per week if needed

• Availability during U.S. business hours

• Fast response time and high availability

• Proficient in Microsoft Excel and Word

• Strong knowledge of Google Workspace (Gmail, Calendar, Sheets, Drive)

• Ability to work under pressure in a fast-paced environment

• Proactive, sales-driven mindset



Technical and Equipment Requirements (Mandatory)

• Strong, stable high-speed Wi-Fi with backup internet

• Clear phone line quality at all times

• Professional headset with microphone (noise-canceling preferred)

• Reliable desktop or laptop suitable for multitasking

• Backup power solution (UPS or generator)

• Quiet, noise-free workspace



Application Requirements (Mandatory)

• Intro video required

• CV

• Applications without an intro video will NOT be reviewed

• Video must briefly introduce experience, English fluency, and phone sales skills



Key Responsibilities – Pre-Sales and Appointment Setting

• Handle incoming, missed, follow-up, and past-client leads

• Conduct phone-based pre-sales calls

• Qualify prospects and book appointments

• Schedule, confirm, and send appointment reminders

• Follow up with unresponsive or und
 leads

• Maintain accurate records in CRM and Google systems

• Track and report performance metrics (calls, appointments, conversions)



Position Details

• Location: Remote

• Type: Full-time

• Schedule: 10 hours/day, 6 days/week (7 days optional)

• Compensation: Based on experience

• Growth potential: High, long-term role in a family-owned company

?? Warning: This role is very heavy, fast-paced, and high-pressure. If you are not comfortable managing multiple urgent tasks simultaneously, working evening/night hours, or receiving frequent constructive feedback, this role is not a fit.

Manage booking inquiries and coordinate appointments efficiently and quickly.



Respond to
s, messages, and client inquiries in a professional and timely manner.

Familiarity with social media platforms 
, Instagram, TikTok).

mber who books the showing that led to a closed deal gets a bonus for every closed deal. Bonuses increase as you hit more deals — $30 per deal at 6–10, $50 at 11–15, and $60 at 16+.

title: AI Artist (Ecommerce)
description:
We’re looking for a highly creative and technically skilled AI Artist to join our ecommerce team. In this role, you’ll use generative AI tools to create compelling visual content that drives engagement, conversions, and brand growth across our digital storefronts and marketing channels.



Join a fast-paced, high-growth Australian fashion brand where creativity moves quickly and your ideas actually make it to market. We operate on local Australian hours, collaborate with a driven (and genuinely cool) team, and give you real autonomy to own your work and make bold decisions. If you thrive in an energetic environment, love fashion, and want to grow with a brand that’s scaling rapidly, this is your chance to make a real impact—not just clock in and out.



You’ll collaborate with marketing, product, and design teams to produce high-quality visuals for product pages, ads,
 campaigns, social media, and more—leveraging cutting-edge AI tools like Midjourney, DALL·E, and Adobe Firefly.



Key Responsibilities



Generate high-quality AI-driven product imagery, lifestyle scenes, and branded visuals

Develop and refine prompts to achieve consistent, on-brand results

Edit and enhance AI-generated content using tools like Adobe Photoshop and Canva

Create optimized images for ecommerce platforms (Shopify, Amazon, Etsy, etc.)

Produce creative assets for paid ads (Meta, Google),
 marketing, and landing pages

Maintain visual consistency across product catalogs and marketing campaigns

Stay up to date with emerging AI art tools and ecommerce design trends

Assist with A/B testing creative variations to improve conversion rates



Requirements



Proven experience creating AI-generated visual content

Strong understanding of ecommerce visual standards and conversion-focused design

Advanced prompt engineering skills

Proficiency in image editing and post-production

Strong eye for composition, lighting, branding, and storytelling

Ability to manage multiple projects and meet deadlines



Portfolio showcasing AI-generated commercial work

Nice to Have

Experience with product mockups and 3D rendering

Knowledge of SEO image optimization

Familiarity with ecommerce platforms (Shopify, WooCommerce, Amazon Seller Central)

Basic video generation/editing skills

Understanding of performance marketing creatives



What We Offer



Competitive salary / project-based compensation

Local Hours

Team Support - highly motivated professional team

Flexible remote work

Opportunity to work with innovative AI tools & grow with the success of the business

Creative freedom and fast-moving ecommerce environment

Growth opportunities in AI-driven digital commerce



How to Apply



Please submit:

Your resume - PDF format

Portfolio (with AI-generated examples clearly labeled)

Brief explanation of your AI workflow and tools used

Optional: Before-and-after examples of prompt iterations

title: Proofreader / Publisher & Executive Assistant
description:
We move fast. We ship a lot. Excellence is the bare minimum.



We’re hiring a detail-obsessed Proofreader / Publisher & Executive Assistant to be the final set of eyes before anything goes live. Nothing ships without you.



You are the quality gate.



You are also operational glue for leadership.



What You’ll Do



You will proof, correct, and publish across:



• Website pages (no broken links, no placeholder text, no formatting issues)

• Meta and Google ads (correct location, targeting, compliance, copy)

• Social media posts (accurate captions, tags, formatting)

• Landing pages and automations in GoHighLevel

•
 campaigns and newsletters



If something isn’t finished, you send it back. If something is wrong, you fix it or flag it.



You will also:



• Organize and maintain ClickUp boards

• Track deliverables and ensure nothing slips

• Assist the executive team with high-level administrative tasks

• Help build internal systems that support growth

• Support hiring, documentation, and operational organization



What This Role Requires



• Extreme attention to detail

• Strong written English

• Comfort in WordPress, GHL, Meta Ads Manager, and Google platforms

• Ability to follow and improve QA checklists

• High ownership and accountability

• Calm execution under pressure

• Administrative precision and organizational strength



This is not a creative-first role. It’s a precision and operations role.



Compensation & Benefits



• Quarterly profit-sharing bonuses

• Three weeks of paid vacation

• The week between Christmas and New Year’s off

• All major U.S. holidays off



At Whoosh, we offer autonomy, high standards, and meaningful upside. That only works if the work is airtight.



If you want to be the reason things go out clean, polished, correct, and organized — we want to talk.

We are a growing US-based financial data company looking for a talented AI programmer to join our remote team. This is a long-term, stable position with room to grow.

You'll build and maintain AI-powered tools, automate data workflows, and support our data science initiatives. Projects will include working with financial datasets, building automation pipelines, developing machine learning models, and creating AI-driven prospecting tools to support our sales and business development efforts.

Respond to inbound leads 
, web-form, phone) and qualify prospects for production of apparel/signage/graphics.

title: Operations & Monetization Assistant (YouTube / Patreon Systems Owner)
description:
We run a growing YouTube-based media project featuring music, comedy, and science content, with a large existing video catalog and plans for expanded livestream broadcasting.



We are relaunching our Patreon membership and preparing additional revenue channels.



We need ONE highly organized assistant whose main responsibility is:



???? Build systems and manage execution so the founder is completely removed from clerical, publishing, and administrative tasks.



This is not a basic data-entry VA role.

You will help organize workflows, improve monetization connections, and ensure our publishing and promotion systems run smoothly without constant supervision.



This is a long-term position with room to grow as the project expands.



RESPONSIBILITIES

Operations & Workflow



Create and manage workflows for YouTube publishing and promotion



Organize templates for descriptions, pinned comments, and calls-to-action



Track uploads, thumbnails, and content status



Maintain organized records so publishing runs reliably



Monetization Support



Help improve Patreon structure and posting consistency



Ensure videos link properly to Patreon and offers



Help coordinate simple landing pages or launch materials when needed



Documentation & Delegation



Write clear step-by-step instructions for repetitive tasks



Help prepare systems that junior assistants can later follow



Success in this role means the founder no longer handles daily admin or clerical work.



REQUIREMENTS



Strong written English



Highly organized and detail-oriented



Proactive problem-solver who can design systems



Experience with YouTube Studio, Patreon, funnels, or online content operations preferred



Reliable internet and consistent availability



Comfortable taking ownership of operational tasks



HOURS & PAY



Start: 10–15 hours per week

Rate: $8–12/hr depending on experience and ability



Potential for increased hours and long-term role as systems grow.



TO APPLY



Please include:



A short introduction describing your experience organizing online content, workflows, or systems



Answer this question:



“If a busy creator wanted to stop handling daily publishing and admin work, how would you set up the workflow so everything runs without them?”



Applications without this answer will not be considered
salary: $6–10 USD per hour  Hours 10/15 to start

title: Account Manager/Sales/CSR  ( MUST SPEAK PERFECT ENGLISH ) with Printing Sublimation Knowledge

Phones never stop ringing so most of the job is to help answer calls and facilitate current clients and take orders but outbound calls are still a requirement.



We are only looking for motivated and ambitious people with great people skills. If you are looking for a stable company where you can both make a great living and grow professionally, we are the company for you.

Answer sales line and take orders. ( MUST SPEAK PERFECT ENGLISH AND SPANISH )

Make outbound calls to existing customer database.

Initiate contact and nurture relationships with new customer leads.

Follow up with customers on order satisfaction post sale.



Required Skills:

Minimum of 2 years prior inside or outside sales experience selling in a business-to-business environment or have heavy customer service experience.

Must be comfortable working in an inside sale only role, talking on the phone daily to customers and prospects and have the ability to close sales over the phone with the warm leads provided.

Excellent communication skills both verbal and written.

Proven track record of achieving goals and quotas.

Proven ability to thrive in a fast-paced team environment that requires multi-tasking and the ability to gain trust with customers very quickly.

Advanced proficiency with internet concepts and terminology, as well as MS Word & Excel.

Must be we extremely organized, detailed oriented and creative minded.

Knowledgeable in printing concepts and terminology.

Experience with Salesforce or comparable sales tools.



Additional Info:

Our benefits include Paid time off. Be prepared to work hard, but also be prepared to have fun. When applying please let us know why you think you would be a good candidate for this position.

title: Digital Marketing Rockstar Wanted! - Digital Marketing Genius / Guru / Specialist

Join a Fast-Growing Multi-Million-Dollar Printing & Apparel Company



We’ve been a powerhouse in the commercial printing industry for over 20 years, and we’re just getting started. What began as a printing shop has evolved into a full-service production hub — offering commercial printing, signage, wraps, screen printing, and sublimation manufacturing. As we celebrate over two decades of success, we’re continuing to expand our reach and our team.



We’re proud to be the largest full-service printing company in our region, delivering high-end print materials and premium sublimated apparel to businesses across the U.S. and beyond. Not just a social media manager — a true digital marketer who understands the art and science of conversion. You know how to craft scroll-stopping videos, killer graphics, and dynamic ads that build brand love and generate sales.

Social Media (Meta, TikTok, Instagram, YouTube, etc.)



Paid Ad Campaigns



Website Visuals



 & SMS Marketing

Design web and
 marketing visuals — banners, promo layouts, product highlights, and more.

/SMS campaigns (Mailchimp, Klaviyo, or similar).

Strong skills in Canva, Adobe Photoshop/Illustrator, and video tools like CapCut, Premiere Pro, or similar.

title: Experienced California Real Estate Assistant and Transaction Coordinator
description:
We’re seeking a detail-oriented, ethical, and teachable Virtual Assistant to support a busy California (Los Angeles metro) real estate broker across residential and commercial transactions. This role covers transaction coordination, client follow-up, data entry, marketing support, and general operations to help the team run more efficiently. We are looking for someone interested in a career in Transaction Coordinating and Real Estate assisting, not a short term hire.



What you’ll do

- Manage end-to-end transaction coordination from contract to closing (residential and commercial)

- Track due diligence items, deadlines, and ensure compliance with laws and policies

- Handle data entry, CRM maintenance, and reporting (Follow Up Boss; excel/sheets)

- Support marketing efforts (Mailchimp campaigns, property listings, newsletters, social posts)

- Coordinate follow-up with clients, lenders, title companies, tenants, and vendors

- Collaborate with agents, admins, lenders, and property managers to keep deals moving

- Manage farm mailings & social media campaigns



What we’re looking for

- Experience as a real estate VA or transaction coordinator

- Strong data accuracy, attention to detail, and ability to manage multiple deals. Coordinate with escrow, title, and vendors

- Strong time management and organizational skills

- Excellent written and verbal communication; strong people skills

- Ethical, trustworthy, and able to handle confidential information

- Ability to learn quickly and continually improve

- Ability to work alone and within a team setting

- Proactive, teachable, and comfortable working in a remote, team-based environment



Must Have

- Experience with California residential real estate workflows (other US states are okay, but ideally California)

- Proficiency with ZipForm, MLS systems, Follow Up Boss, Open to Close, Excel, and Word 

- Ability to work during business hours 9am-5pm (Pacific Standard Time)

- Commitment to a full time position. No side work during business hours. No distractions in workspace. We need focused attention and commitment during the business hours.

- Stable professional home workspace with stable internet connection, VPN, and stable electricity





Nice to have

- Experience with California  commercial real estate workflows

- Familiarity with Loopnet & Crexi a huge plus

- Basic marketing creativity for
s, posts, flyers, and newsletters



Why join us

- Flexible, remote role with a collaborative team

- Opportunity to learn and grow with the team

- Competitive pay and potential for growth

- Long term work (after probation period)



How to apply

Submit a brief resume and a 200–300 word cover note outlining: (1) relevant experience in residential and/or commercial real estate, (2) proficiency with ZipForm/MLS/Follow up Boss/Open to Close/Excel/Word, (3) an example of a process improvement you’ve implemented, and (4) your availability. (5) past job references a plus

We are seeking a highly organized, reliable, and professional Healthcare Virtual Assistant for a long-term position. This is not a temporary job. We are looking for someone who wants stability, growth, and responsibility.

s professionally

title: AI Developer & Architect (Ecommerce)
description:
We’re hiring a highly technical AI Developer & Architect to design, build, and scale AI-powered systems that drive growth across our ecommerce ecosystem. This is a hands-on architecture role for someone who can both define the AI roadmap and execute it.



You’ll work at the intersection of data, automation, personalization, and conversion optimization—building intelligent systems that power marketing, customer experience, operations, and product discovery.



If you thrive in fast-moving environments and want real ownership inside a high-growth ecommerce brand, this role offers autonomy, impact, and the opportunity to shape the future of AI within the business.



Join a fast-paced, high-growth Australian fashion brand where creativity moves quickly and your ideas actually make it to market. We operate on local Australian hours, collaborate with a driven (and genuinely cool) team, and give you real autonomy to own your work and make bold decisions. If you thrive in an energetic environment, love cutting edge industry, and want to grow with a brand that’s scaling rapidly, this is your chance to make a real impact—not just clock in and out.



Key Responsibilities



Design and implement scalable AI architecture across ecommerce systems

Build and deploy LLM-powered tools using OpenAI API, LangChain, or similar frameworks

Develop AI-driven personalization engines (recommendations, search, segmentation)

Architect automation workflows for marketing, CX, and operations

Integrate AI systems into platforms like Shopify, headless commerce stacks, and internal tools

Design vector databases and retrieval systems for intelligent search and knowledge agents

Lead prompt engineering strategy and fine-tuning initiatives

Ensure scalability, security, and performance of AI services

Stay ahead of advancements in generative AI, agents, and ecommerce automation



Requirements



4+ years in software engineering with strong backend architecture experience



Proven experience building and deploying AI/ML or LLM-powered systems

Strong proficiency in Python (required)

Experience with APIs, microservices, and cloud infrastructure (AWS, GCP, or Azure)

Knowledge of vector databases and embeddings

Experience integrating AI into production environments

Strong understanding of data pipelines and system design

Ability to work autonomously and make high-impact technical decisions



Nice to Have



Ecommerce experience (Shopify, headless commerce, CRO tools)

Experience with recommendation systems or search optimization

Background in data engineering or ML Ops

Familiarity with fine-tuning, RAG pipelines, or AI agents

Startup or high-growth brand experience



What We Offer



High-impact role in a fast-scaling ecommerce brand

Autonomy to architect and lead AI initiatives

Flexible remote work (aligned to Australian business hours)

Competitive salary or contract package

Opportunity to build next-generation AI systems from the ground up



How to Apply



Submit:



Resume / LinkedIn

GitHub or technical portfolio

Brief summary of AI systems you’ve built and architected

Optional: Architecture diagram of a recent AI project

title: Marketing assistant
description:
About Us



Slimeatory is a fast-growing creative retail & entertainment brand with physical stores, an online shop, gaming apps, and a worldwide fan community. We’re known for our **DIY Slime Bar, slime parties, seasonal activations, and digital content**. Our marketing is the heartbeat of our brand—making sure every campaign, video, ad, and event connects with our audience.



We’re building a **world-class Marketing Department** and are hiring **Marketing Managers & Specialists across multiple roles**. Whether your strengths are in **in-store marketing, digital ads, social content, influencer partnerships, PR & events, or gaming apps**, we want to hear from you.



Open Tracks / Roles



Applicants may be considered for one or more of the following positions depending on skills & experience:



* **Physical Store Marketing Manager** – In-store promotions, signage, foot traffic, loyalty programs

* **Digital Marketing Manager** – Ads, SEO,
, SMS, website optimization

* **Social Media & Content Manager** – TikTok, YouTube, Instagram, content calendar, virality

* **Influencer & Partnerships Manager** – Creator collabs, affiliates, influencer campaigns

* **PR & Events Manager** – Media coverage, community events, press campaigns

* **Game App Marketing Manager** – Slimeatory app promotions, crossovers with stores & products



What You’ll Do



Depending on your track, responsibilities may include:



* Driving in-store traffic & customer engagement

* Managing paid ads, SEO,
, and SMS campaigns

* Growing our social media community with viral content

* Building influencer and affiliate relationships

* Coordinating PR, media, and community events

* Marketing and monetizing Slimeatory’s gaming apps



What We’re Looking For



* 2–5+ years experience in marketing (retail, digital, content, or related fields)

* Strong understanding of trends, customer engagement, and brand storytelling

* Creative eye + ability to execute quickly

* Organized, detail-oriented, and comfortable with deadlines

* Proficiency in tools such as Canva, Adobe Suite, Shopify, Klaviyo, Google Ads, Meta Ads, TikTok Ads, or similar (depending on role)



Why Join Us



* Be part of a **fast-growing, fun, and creative brand**

* Work across multiple channels: retail, digital, content, gaming, and influencer marketing

* Opportunity to **specialize in your strengths** while contributing to a bigger team vision

* Creative freedom and ownership over projects

* A supportive family-style culture with room to grow as the brand expands



How to Apply



Submit your **resume and portfolio (if applicable)**. Please highlight your strongest skills and experiences—whether that’s in digital, in-store, content, events, or influencer marketing. We’ll review applications and place candidates into the role(s) that best fit their strengths.

title: Duda Website Expert Wanted (Real Operator Only) | Full-Time
description:
???? No Portfolio. No Resume. No “Websites You Built.”

Duda Website Expert Wanted (Real Operator Only) | Full-Time



We are not hiring off screenshots.

We are not reviewing portfolios.

We are not impressed by links you claim you built.



Last time we hired for Duda, almost every applicant showed us websites they did not actually build.



So we are doing this differently.



We judge skill in real time.



? Required to Apply: Loom Proof (Must Be You)



To apply, you must send a Loom video showing it is actually you operating inside Duda.



In your Loom, do this in one recording:



Log into your Duda account



Open any site (new or existing)



Build a simple layout live (do not overthink it)



add 2–3 sections



adjust spacing + typography



show mobile edits



Add a Custom HTML section



drop in a basic HTML block (simple structure is fine)



add an H1 inside the HTML and style it



then explain what you expect Duda to do with that HTML and styling after it’s saved/published



This is not about perfection. It’s about proving you actually know Duda and how it behaves with custom code.



No Loom = not considered.



?? Quick Knowledge Check (Answer In Your Message)



In 3–6 sentences, answer:



What holds Duda back compared to other builders?



Is Duda strong for SEO, and why?



What happens when you add raw HTML into a Duda section?



Keep it simple and direct.



???? Live Build Test (Final Interview)



If your Loom looks legit, we will do a live test.



We will give you content and direction and you will build a page with 3 sections inside Duda. If you are truly skilled, this should take less than 20 minutes.



Full-Time Role



This is a full-time position for a real Duda operator. Pay depends on skill level and execution.

title: Project Manager & Quality Assurance Lead
description:
Role: Operations & Quality Assurance (QA) Lead

Compensation: $1,500 USD/Month ($1,200 Base + $300 KPI-Based Bonus)

Structure: Full-Time, Remote



We are a leading Shopify SEO & CRO agency seeking an Operations Manager & QA Lead for our CRO department to serve as the final point of accountability for all client deliverables, essentially our "Quality Firewall".



Your mission is simple: Zero Errors. You will sit between the production team (Design/Dev) and the Strategy/Client layer. You are responsible for ensuring every deliverable is 100% polished, on-time, and strategically sound. If a mistake reaches the client, it is your responsibility.



The Candidate Profile



We aren't looking for a "generalist." We are looking for an A-Player who sits at the intersection of these three specific domains:



1. The PM Stack (Operations & Accountability)



The Goal: 100% On-time delivery.

The Skill: You have experience (preferably 2-3+ years) managing technical or creative teams. You are great at resource allocation, managing team velocity, and maintaining project management suites (Notion, Linear, or ASANA). You don't just "check in"; you drive the timeline.



2. The QA Stack (Technical Precision)



The Goal: Zero defects.

The Skill: You are extremely detail-oriented. You notice the misalignments, logic flaws, or broken elements on a website that everyone else misses. Preferably, you also have an understanding of the technical logic behind what's happening on the website.



3. The Leadership Stack (High Agency & Communication)



The Goal: Strategic focus for the leadership.

The Skill: You are comfortable being the "bad guy" when standards aren't met. You value "Closing the Loop"; if an error occurs, you update the SOP so it never happens again. You are a professional, direct communicator who can proactively communicate with clients.



The Mindset



High Agency: You don't wait for permission to fix a broken process.

Intolerance of Mediocrity: You prioritize the end result.



Application Instructions



To apply, submit your CV, your motivations for applying, and a brief overview of your relevant experience.



Additionally, provide your tactical response to the following three scenarios:



1. It’s Friday, 4:00 PM. A developer tells you a critical Shopify landing page build will be "mostly ready" by EOD, but they need Monday morning to "clean up some minor mobile responsiveness issues." The client expects the launch on Monday at 9:00 AM. 



2. Our lead designer is brilliant, but consistently forgets to update changes across all pages in a project. You’ve mentioned it twice. Today, you found the same error again on a high-stakes project.



3. A client messages you directly on a Friday evening asking for a "small change" after designs are approved and development is underway. You aren't sure if this aligns with the original strategy.

Looking forward to hearing from you.

title: Personal Loan Assessor – Australian Experience Required
description:
Personal Loan Assessor – Australian Experience Required (Remote – Philippines Team)



We are an Australian-licensed fintech lender seeking an experienced Personal Loan Assessor with direct experience assessing Australian consumer loan applications.



This role is critical in supporting our growing loan volumes while maintaining strict compliance with Australian responsible lending laws.



We are specifically looking for someone who has worked within Australian lending frameworks and understands NCCP obligations, affordability assessments, and loan verification standards.



About the Role



You will be responsible for reviewing customer applications, verifying supporting documents, and assessing suitability in line with:



- National Consumer Credit Protection Act (NCCP)



- Responsible Lending obligations



- Internal credit and affordability policies



- Target Market Determinations (TMDs)



You must be confident assessing:



PAYG income verification



Bank statements (90-day review minimum)



Living expenses and liabilities



Credit reports (Equifax / Illion / Experian)



Serviceability calculations



Hardship indicators and red flags



Requirements



Prior experience assessing Australian personal loan applications



Strong understanding of responsible lending obligations



Experience reviewing Australian bank statements and credit reports



Excellent attention to detail



Clear written and spoken English



Reliable high-speed internet



Secure and private home workspace



Ability to document assessments clearly for audit and compliance purposes



Highly Desirable



When applying, please outline:



Which Australian lending platforms you have used and whether you have worked with:



- Automated decision engines



- Manual credit assessments



- Loan management systems (LMS)



Whether you have access to or can provide:



- Assessment manuals



- Process documentation



- SOPs used in prior Australian lending roles



- QA or compliance checklists



- Experience helping set up or manage offshore assessment teams.



- Your experience handling hardship, complaints, or vulnerable customers.



We are specifically building a Philippines-based assessment team to manage increased loan volume while maintaining Australian compliance standards. If you have experience helping structure offshore teams or implementing assessment processes, please highlight this.



What We’re Looking For:



We are not simply hiring a processor.



We are looking for someone who:



Understands Australian lending compliance deeply.



Can follow structured assessment guidelines.



Can help us build scalable, documented processes.



Thinks critically about borrower suitability.



Flags potential responsible lending risks.



How to Apply



Please submit:



Your resume (highlighting Australian loan assessment experience).



A brief overview of:



Platforms you have used.



Your experience with Australian compliance.



Whether you have access to manuals or SOPs from previous roles.



Your availability and expected salary (AUD or PHP).



Only applicants with direct Australian lending experience will be considered.

title: AI ECOM Creative Strategist & Scriptwriter
description:
We're an e-commerce brand in the book niche looking for a creative strategist who can own our ad output from concept to final cut.



What You'll Do



You'll lead a pod of 2 video editors. You write the briefs and scripts, hand them directly to your editors, and see the creative through to completion — including managing revisions and ensuring the final ad matches the vision. You're the bridge between strategy and execution.



You understand direct response. Stages of awareness, problem agitation, mass desires — you apply these naturally when building angles and scripts. You know how to research winning ads, spot what's working, and turn that into clear, actionable briefs your editors can execute without confusion.



You write scripts with Claude, know how to prompt it effectively, and are familiar with AI tools like Higgsfield, Nano Banana Pro, and Kling — enough to brief confidently and know what's possible.



We provide full training, brief templates, and creative direction. You build on that and own the output.



The Output



5-6 unique briefs and scripts delivered every day. You manage the full creative cycle — research, brief, editor handoff, revisions, final delivery.



Pay



$1,750/month + cash bonuses for every winning ad that scales.



To Apply



Start your message with "BRIEF" and include:



- Examples of scripts or creative briefs you've written

- How you approach ad research and finding winning creatives

- Tools you use (Claude, ad spy tools, AI platforms, etc.)

- Your understanding of direct response — be specific

- Confirmation you're available full-time long-term

title: Building & Construction Estimator
description:
Building & Construction Estimator – Independent Contractor (Remote)



We are an Australian building and property maintenance company seeking an experienced Building and Construction Estimator to provide remote estimating and job coordination support. This is an independent contractor role only and is not employment.



The role involves preparing estimates and take-offs from plans, photos, and scopes of work; managing and updating jobs in ServiceM8 (SM8) and Simpro; tracking costs, variations, and progress; assisting with contract administration; and liaising with clients, subcontractors, and our in-house bookkeeper. Experience with AutoCAD or similar drafting software is advantageous.



Applicants must have proven construction estimating experience, strong knowledge of building maintenance and small construction works, and hands-on experience using both Simpro and ServiceM8 (SM8). Formal qualifications in building construction are preferred. Strong written English, attention to detail, reliability, and the ability to work independently are essential. Reliable internet access is required.



Engagement is remote and task-based, paid at an agreed hourly or per-task rate (AUD). Contractors are responsible for their own tax, superannuation, insurance, equipment, and working arrangements. Availability during Australian business hours is preferred but flexible. Ongoing work may be offered following a short paid trial task.



To apply, please provide a brief summary of your experience, confirm Simpro and ServiceM8 experience, state your availability, and advise your preferred rate.

title: YouTube Long-Form Producer (Twitch VOD into 1 High-Quality Video / Week)
description:
Kamusta.



I’m a Filipino Canadian creator looking for one sharp, independent editor to become my long-form YouTube producer.



This is not a clip-cutting job.

This is not highlight reels or 
 edits.



You will take full 2–4 hour Twitch VODs and shape them into one strong, structured 8–15 minute YouTube video each week.



My content is calm, conversational, and idea-driven; focused on mindset, personal growth, community conversations, lessons learned, and navigating life honestly. The goal is clarity, retention, and strong narrative structure — not flashy effects.



This role is closer to a YouTube producer than a basic editor.



-----



Weekly Workflow:

• Watch a full VOD (2–4 hours)

• Identify one strong theme, struggle, or lesson worth expanding

• Send 2–3 timestamps + a 1-sentence hook for approval

• Edit a tight 8–15 minute long-form video

• Remove unnecessary dead air while preserving natural tone

• Shape pacing and structure for retention

• Create a clean, CTR-focused thumbnail

• Deliver via Drive (max 2 revision rounds)



Target: 1 high-quality video per week.



As trust builds and workflow tightens, video frequency can increase.



-----



What I’m Looking For:

• Experience editing long-form YouTube content (send links)

• Strong understanding of hooks and retention psychology

• Ability to commit to one clear thesis per video

• Someone who understands conversational content — not over-edited

• Good English reading comprehension

• Reliable internet + ability to work async

• Tools: Premiere Pro or DaVinci Resolve; Canva or Photoshop



Bonus if you understand livestream culture and community-driven content.



-----



What This Is NOT:

• Not short-form repurposing

• Not subtitle-heavy editing

• Not fast-turnaround quantity work

• Not effect-heavy montage style



Judgment and taste matter more than transitions.



-----



Pay:

• $50–75 CAD per long-form video (depending on experience and trial quality)

• 1 video per week to start

• Increased frequency available as consistency and autonomy are proven

• Paid trial video

• Performance bonuses for strong CTR & retention

• Long-term rate increases with results



I’m looking for a long-term collaboration, not short-term rotation.



-----



How to Apply:

– Send 2–3 long-form YouTube videos you’ve edited.

– In 2–3 sentences, explain what makes a calm, conversational video retain viewers.

– One sentence: Why are you the best fit for this role?



If your work and answers stand out, I will move you to a pre-screening stage, where you’ll receive a real Twitch VOD and be tested on your ability to create a strong thematic narrative suitable for YT videos.



Salamat, usap tayo.



Chris

title: Creative Execution & Brand Delivery Assistant (Design Studio)
description:
Kamusta!!

We are a boutique design studio led by a Filipina founder who built the business through heart, taste, and genuine care for her clients.



This is not a corporate agency.

This is a growing, family-led studio.



Clients work with us because they trust the founder’s creative direction, communication, and integrity. As the studio grows, we are looking for someone to join us long-term and become part of the team behind the scenes.



We offer services including:

• Branding & Rebrands

• Packaging Design

• Web Design

• Social Media Systems

• Brand Strategy

• Illustration & Visual Assets

• Creative Direction



The founder leads all client communication and high-level creative decisions.



We are hiring a Creative Execution & Delivery Assistant whose role is to take already-started projects and bring them to completion — clean, polished, and ready for handoff.



You will not be starting concepts from scratch.

You will be refining, expanding, and preparing approved work.



Your role includes:



Refining & Completing Design Work

• Expanding approved logos into full logo systems

• Polishing typography, spacing, and layout

• Applying branding to packaging dielines

• Preparing web assets for developer handoff

• Creating social templates from approved brand systems

• Finalizing illustrations or supporting graphics based on direction



Preparing Production-Ready Files

• Setting up packaging files with proper bleed and CMYK

• Exporting complete logo packages (AI, EPS, SVG, PNG, JPG, PDF)

• Preparing optimized web and social assets

• Organizing website imagery and brand files



Organizing & Packaging Final Deliverables

• Cleaning and organizing working files

• Following clear naming conventions

• Building structured folder systems

• Creating simple brand guideline PDFs from templates

• Preparing professional delivery folders for clients



You will NOT:

• Speak directly with clients

• Join discovery calls

• Lead creative strategy

• Override creative direction



You will be trusted to take projects from 80% to 100%.



We are looking for someone who:

• Is strong in Adobe Illustrator (required)

• Understands packaging and basic print production

• Has strong attention to detail

• Can follow direction precisely

• Takes pride in clean files and organized systems

• Is looking for a stable, respectful, long-term working relationship



This is a family-led business.

We value loyalty, consistency, and mutual respect.

If you grow with us, there is long-term opportunity.



To apply, include:

1. The word “Precision” at the top of your application

2. A short explanation of how you would prepare a logo package for delivery

3. A link to relevant portfolio work

4. Your internet speed



Salamat!!

About Us

We are a growing medical management organization seeking a highly skilled Collections Agent with strong experience in medical collections. The ideal candidate understands the full revenue cycle and is comfortable handling all phases of the collections process with professionalism and accuracy.



Job Summary



The Collections Agent will be responsible for managing and resolving outstanding medical accounts, working closely with insurance carriers, patients, and internal teams to ensure timely and accurate collections. Making phone calls and pursuing all avenues to resolution.



Key Responsibilities



Handle all phases of medical collections, including early-stage, follow-up, and advanced collections



Contact insurance companies and patients to resolve unpaid or underpaid claims



Review explanations of benefits (EOBs) and identify payment discrepancies



Follow up on denied or delayed claims and initiate appeals when necessary



Negotiate payment arrangements when appropriate



Maintain accurate documentation and notes in billing/collection systems



Ensure compliance with HIPAA, FDCPA, and company policies



Meet or exceed individual and team collection goals



Qualifications



Minimum 2–3 years of experience in medical collections (required)



Strong knowledge of the medical billing and collections cycle



Experience working with insurance payers, denials, and appeals



Excellent communication and negotiation skills



Strong attention to detail and organizational skills



Ability to work independently and manage multiple accounts



Assess all billing cycle for quality assurance. 



What We Offer



Competitive pay based on experience



Stable work environment



Opportunity for growth within the organization



Supportive and professional team.

nt.
