title: US CPA Firm Senior Operations Associate
description:
The CPA Dude | U.S. CPA Firm



Operations Associate – Tax Operations is a core member of the tax operations team at The CPA Dude, a fast-growing U.S. CPA firm serving high-net-worth individuals and businesses with complex tax needs. This role supports the execution of tax workflows, client operations, and revenue processes, ensuring filings are completed accurately, deadlines are met, and clients receive a consistently high level of service.



This position is ideal for an operations-driven professional who thrives in structured environments, enjoys coordinating across teams, and takes ownership of processes from onboarding through billing and collection.



Required Experience: 1-2 years of professional experience in related accounting or tax field

Preferred Experience: 1 year at a US tax company or CPA Firm.



Working Hours: 10AM CST - 6PM CST

Location: Remote

Compensation: $2500 USD Salary a Month







Key Responsibilities



Tax & Client Operations



Manage client onboarding workflows and maintain accurate client records throughout the engagement lifecycle

Perform pre-review checks on tax returns to ensure completeness, identify missing documentation, and flag discrepancies prior to submission

Prepare and file tax extensions and support e-filing across individual and business returns

Organize, label, and maintain digital client files to ensure accessibility and audit readiness

Create, roll forward, and maintain workpapers with a focus on accuracy and process improvement

Coordinate directly with clients via
 and phone to request documents, clarify information, and resolve operational issues

Collaborate with tax preparers, bookkeepers, and internal teams to keep workflows on track and deadlines met

Manage calendars, task rosters, and follow-ups to support timely delivery of services

Escalate risks, delays, or client issues to management with clear documentation

Billing, Collections & Revenue Support



Support billing processes by tracking engagement status and ensuring invoices are issued accurately and on time

Monitor accounts receivable and follow up on outstanding invoices in a professional, client-focused manner

Communicate with clients regarding billing questions, payment status, and collection follow-ups

Coordinate with leadership to resolve billing discrepancies and collection issues

Identify upsell opportunities within existing accounts and escalate to leadership (bonus eligible)

Operations Standards



Serve as a liaison between clients, contractors, and internal teams to ensure timely and accurate service delivery

Maintain same-business-day response standards and contribute to a fast, accountable operations culture

Communicate clearly, professionally, and confidently in all written and verbal interactions





Results

1. Ensure high client satisfaction and retention through exceptional client service

2. Drive revenue growth through identifying and communicating upsell opportunities

3. Maintain accurate and complete client files for efficient tax preparation

4. Ensure timely filing of all client tax documents and extensions

5. Foster positive client relationships as a trusted advisor

6. Demonstrate a measurable impact on client retention rates

7. Successfully onboard new clients with a smooth transition process

8. Contribute to the firm's growth through process improvement and efficiency

9. Maintain a high level of client responsiveness (same day or within 24 hours)

10. Support our tax advisors in delivering comprehensive tax planning services

 or

title: Virtual Operations Lead | Pillar
description:
Please read the job description all the way to the bottom. Instructions on how to proceed are included there.



Operations Lead

Company: Pillar Health Solutions

Location: Remote

Rate: $8 - $12/hour

Overview



Pillar Health Solutions is a B2B startup that partners with medical practices to deliver high-impact dietary and exercise counseling services to their patients. We’re on a mission to elevate preventive care and wellness through operational excellence and human-centered support.

We’re hiring our first Operations Lead—a strategic doer who’s ready to roll up their sleeves and build from the ground up. In the early stages, this role will be hands-on: managing day-to-day operations, creating SOPs, supporting client delivery, and refining internal processes. As the business scales, this person will transition into a leadership role, building and managing a remote team of CSRs, Project Managers, and Admins to support our growing client base.

This is a rare opportunity to shape the operational backbone of a healthcare startup from day one.



Key Responsibilities

???? Program Execution & Client Support

Oversee the delivery of dietary and exercise counseling programs to partner clinics

Serve as the primary point of contact for medical clients, ensuring smooth onboarding, service delivery, and ongoing support

Translate clinical goals into operational workflows that are scalable and patient-centered

???? SOP Development & Process Building

Create and refine SOPs for service delivery, client onboarding, reporting, and internal coordination

Identify gaps and inefficiencies, and implement improvements that support quality, compliance, and scalability

Document best practices and build operational playbooks for future hires

???? Wearing Multiple Hats

Contribute to marketing strategy and planning, including the creation of high-quality marketing materials

Build internal processes from zero, laying the groundwork for scalable operations across departments

Collaborate cross-functionally to support evolving business needs beyond core operations

???? Team Building & Leadership (Future Phase)

Once business demand increases, recruit and onboard remote support staff (CSRs, Admins, Project Managers)

Train and manage the team to uphold service standards and client satisfaction

Foster a culture of accountability, empathy, and continuous improvement

?? Operational Oversight

Create and monitor KPIs such as client satisfaction, task completion, turnaround time, and engagement metrics

Ensure compliance with healthcare standards and client-specific requirements

Support billing, scheduling, and reporting functions as needed.



Qualifications

3+ years of experience in operations, client success, or program management—ideally in a healthcare or wellness setting

Proven ability to build systems from scratch and thrive in a startup environment

Strong communication skills - verbal and written

Highly organized, proactive, and adaptable to shifting priorities

Experience managing remote teams or cross-functional projects is a plus



Why Join Pillar Health Solutions?

This isn’t just a job—it’s your opportunity to architect something transformative. As our first hire, you won’t just witness the evolution of a company—you’ll lead it. You’ll lay the foundation for how medical practices deliver wellness support, shaping our operations from the ground up and driving the growth that follows. From building the systems to building the team, your work will directly empower better care, better outcomes, and a better standard for what B2B healthcare can be.



If you are interested in moving forward, please record a short Loom video (3–5 minutes) highlighting how your experience aligns with the key responsibilities in the attached job description.



Then
 the following to 

1. Your updated resume

2. Your Loom video link

3. Subject: Virtual Operations Lead | Pillar

title: Audit Manager at TaxAce - US Accounting Clients - CPA Required
description:
About Us

At TaxAce, we provide expert financial services including Tax Preparation, Bookkeeping, Payroll, Agent Service of Process, Tax Resolution, Tax Planning, and CFO Services for businesses and entrepreneurs.



We’re guided by five core values:

• Integrity – Transparent guidance for informed decisions

• Communication – Clear, timely support that builds trust

• Accountability – Goal-focused with measurable results

• Respect – Personalized service with professionalism

• Education – Ongoing learning to stay ahead of tax changes



Our mission is to deliver reliable, high-quality financial support that empowers clients to grow with confidence.



Who You Are

You’re a highly experienced Certified Public Accountant (CPA) with a strong background in audit and US accounting standards. You thrive in a leadership role, confidently managing audit engagements, reviewing financial statements, and ensuring compliance with US GAAP.



You are detail-oriented, analytical, and comfortable working with US-based clients. You take ownership of engagements, lead teams effectively, and maintain strong communication with both clients and auditors.



Key Responsibilities

• Lead and manage audit engagements for US-based accounting clients

• Prepare, review, and approve financial statements and audit workpapers

• Serve as primary point of contact during external audits, including ownership of PBC schedules and auditor coordination

• Ensure compliance with US GAAP and applicable accounting standards

• Oversee month-end and year-end close processes

• Perform risk assessments and analytical reviews

• Design and document internal controls

• Prepare and review audit schedules independently

• Lead and mentor audit tea
mbers

• Manage multiple engagements while maintaining high-quality standards



Qualifications

• Bachelor’s Degree in Accountancy

• Active Philippine CPA license (required)

• 8+ years of total accounting experience

• Minimum 4 years in an external audit firm preferred

OR significant experience serving as primary company lead during Big 4 external audits

• At least 3 years in a managerial or senior supervisory role

• Experience handling US-based clients strongly preferred

• Experience preparing and reviewing audit workpapers and financial statements

• Experience leading engagements or audit teams



Technical Requirements

• Strong knowledge of US GAAP

• Strong understanding of ASC 606 revenue recognition

• Experience designing and documenting internal controls

• Experience performing risk assessments and analytical reviews

• Advanced reconciliation and financial statement review skills

• Ability to lead month-end and year-end close

• Ability to independently prepare and review audit schedules



Systems Requirements

• QuickBooks Online (mandatory)

• Advanced Excel skills (required)



Compensation & Benefits

• Competitive salary (based on experience)

• Flexible work hours

• Professional development support (CE credits, licensing fees, etc.)

• Performance bonuses



How to Apply

Submit your resume, cover letter, and proof of CPA license to 
 or

title: Youtube and Shorts Video Editor
description:
Hi,



I am looking for an editor for this channel: 



It’s an educational channel focused on content strategy, social media, and advertising. The videos are insight-driven, not flashy-for-the-sake-of-it, so pacing, clarity, and storytelling matter more than over-editing.



I’m looking for a reliable editor to handle:

Long-form YouTube videos (10–15 minutes)

Short-form cuts for YouTube Shorts and social platforms



What I’m looking for:

- Strong sense of pacing and structure

- Ability to turn talking-head footage into engaging edits

- Clean subtitles and short-form optimisation

- Consistency and reliability over “crazy effects”

- Experience editing YouTube content (please show examples)

- Motion graphics skills



Nice to have:

- Understanding of content strategy or marketing

- Ability to suggest improvements to hooks or pacing



This is ongoing work, not a one-off project, and there’s room to grow with the channel if we’re a good fit. I'm looking for someone that is excited to learn and grow. Experience is important but I value the right attitude more and am willing to help you get the skills you don't yet have.



To apply, please send:

- Examples of YouTube videos you’ve edited (long-form & shorts)

- Your availability per week



If it looks like a good fit, I’ll invite you to book a short call.

title: Editor for TikTok Shop Videos
description:
Part-time Capcut / TikTok Editor with potential for more



Hiring for part-time work for a Capcut / TikTok editor



You will be making TikTok videos using Capcut.  The editing process is fairly simple and straightforward.  Anyone who is proficient in video editing should have no problem with the basic tasks such as:



Cutting dead space in talking head videos

Adding overlay images on screen in the videos

Minor effects such as dynamic zoom, cropping, etc.



Producing b-roll content from voiceover and footage provided, having the ability to digest what is being said and pair up the audio with corresponding footage



Please review a few examples of my content to ensure you are familiar and comfortable with the editing style:



Basic talking head - here you are mostly editing dead space and piecing clips together, adding minor effects like crop and zoom to make the frames look more dynamic and seamless.







Talking head with overlays - same as before, but adding images provided to you on the screen to support what is being said in the video.









You will be working hand in hand with me on an extremely viral social media page, and there is room for bonuses if deadlines are met and the content performs well!



Requirements:

Attention to detail

STRONG English

Strong internet connection

Previous experience with Capcut / TikTok / Instagram

Good working with a team

Ability to learn and take constructive feedback

title: Herrmann - Executive Project Manager
description:
About Us

Herrmann Digital is one of the world’s premier paid media agencies. David Herrmann has intentionally kept the agency small and is now looking for an experienced individual to support him directly, primarily across client communications and Slack.



What You’ll Do

• Shadow David for one month virtually and learn the business, clients, and workflows

• Read all incoming Slack and
 messages and send David concise updates twice per day, prioritizing what is most time sensitive

• Draft proposed responses for David to review and approve or provide edits on



What We’re Looking For

• 5 to 10+ years of experience in paid media, with working knowledge of paid social advertising

• Comfortable navigating Meta, TikTok, Pinterest, and Snapchat Ads Manager

• Extremely organized and efficient

• Strong written communication skills

• Working knowledge of AI tools, specifically Gemini

• Experience building or maintaining project management systems is a plus

• Ability to handle high message volume without missing details



Role Details

• Full time, 6 month contractor role with potential to convert to full time

• 50 hours per week

• Pay: $12 to $16 per hour, based on experience

• Location: Remote

• Working hours aligned with Los Angeles time, 7a to 6p PT



How to Apply

:

:

• Resume or CV as a PDF, one page maximum

• Two to three paragraphs in the body of the
 explaining why you’re interested and why David should hire you

• Your current location

 subject line must be:

title: Junior Land Acquisitions Manager
description:
We are expanding our acquisitions team and are looking for a hungry, sales-driven Junior Acquisitions Manager who wants to earn more than typical hourly or salaried roles through performance-based real estate sales.



This role offers clear room for growth. As performance improves, there are opportunities to earn higher commissions, handle higher-value deals, and grow into senior acquisition or leadership roles.



You will be speaking directly with U.S. property owners, running structured conversations, and negotiating purchase terms using proven systems and guidance. This position is ideal for someone who is confident on the phone, coachable, and motivated by results rather than guaranteed pay.



What You’ll Be Doing

We are an Australian-based hospitality group operating two growing brands: Lunch in a Box, a healthy corporate catering and franchise business, and Pestle and Mortar, a hospitality consultancy specialising in café, restaurant and franchise development.

We are seeking a skilled and results-driven SEO & Digital Growth Specialist based in the Philippines to manage and optimise our online presence. This role is focused on generating qualified enquiries, increasing brand visibility, and driving measurable growth across both businesses.

What We Are Looking For

title: Tax Advisory Associate (US Taxes)
description:
We are looking for someone with one of the following:



- US Tax Planning or Tax Strategy Experience 

- US CPA Firm experience as an associate with 3+ years of experience



Role



Tax Advisory Associate will be helping with our Tax Advisory Department help meet clients, schedule workflow for tax planning, run tax projections and compile tax plans. This position is great for entry or senior level tax preparers and associates looking to get a feel for providing value to clients on a strategic level.





REQUIREMENTS AND RESULTS







This role is somewhat of a hybrid role between a tax preparer and a junior level tax strategist. We understand such roles are uncommon - most focus on preparation or planning; however, we are willing to put in the training to make sure you have the knowledge and support to succeed. 







This role will be the main liaison between the tax advisory and compliance teams. 







Systems and Process Skills 



Set up Locators in Proconnect for new clients 

Run
tax projections minimum in the software based on i) actual docs provided by client, ii) hypothetical planning scenarios, and iii) and/or

Run 50-100 quarterly tax estimates or extension calculations minimum.

Analyze the difference between potential planning scenarios 

Have a basic understanding of bookkeeping on Quickbooks

Analyze a client’s P&L/BS for clarity and accuracy 





Technical Tax Skills & Knowledge 



Have a basic understanding of tax preparation and tax returns 

What returns/forms may need to filed 

Understand the filing scope of the client and what docs may be relevant for a tax return 

A desire to learn tax planning is crucial for this role 

Review entity structure and create an Organizational Chart

Learn the tax strategies offered to clients in their respective Tax Plan 

Understand the step-by-step implementation for each strategy

Understand Cost Segregation studies and own the process

Get estimates based on data needed from the client 

Act as the intermediary between us and our cost segregation partners 





Communication Skills & Organization 



Sit on strategy calls (approximately
) and document the items discussed 

Draft up to-do’s after the call 

Assist clients in tax strategy implementation

Provide step-by-step instructions and guidance 

Respond to client tax planning questions in a timely manner - ideally same day

24 business hours response time (3 days or less)

Research Skills - we live in a world powered by internet and AI, must have the ability to research items on their own before reaching out for help 

Chase clients and make sure they understand and implement the strategies discussed

Send looms (recorded videos) to help guide the client 

Schedule calls with client to make sure they are getting the number of calls needed 





CORE VALUES

Our core values are the heart and soul of this incredible company. The right person for this role will appreciate each of these values, personally subscribe to them, and understand why each is critical to having a great business. 







Communication 

Respond to others how you would want to be responded to. You wouldn’t want to wait a day for a response, nor do others. Having kind candor and giving the not so great news is expected and needed. Using your voice is important and we want you to voice your opinion. 

We use Slack – it is the go to for any communications

We value over-communication (more context the better)

We value speed in communication (be prompt in responding or provide context as to why you may be slow to respond)

Weekly Tea
etings

Ownership

Deadlines are always met and you are able to own all your relationships internally and externally. Your work product is something you and the client are proud of. If a client had to rate your service on a scale of 1-10, would they give you a 10? 

Work smarter not harder

We are growing fast and in order to achieve our mission, this role will require a lot of hard work until we build into a greater balance. However we are looking for an addition who can get us there and by working smarter by leveraging better technology, process, and out of the box thinking.





Software You'll Use:



ProConnect (Intuit) – tax return and extension prep

TaxDome – CRM and secure client communication

QuickBooks Online – for coordinating with bookkeepers

Google Workspace – Docs, Sheets, Drive, Gmail (we don't use Microsoft Office)

Go High Level





AVAILABILITY



8-6 PM for any US time zone (preference for PST but flexible), can be flexible for the right candidates

Able to work additional hours on weeknights and weekends. In addition, there will be peak busy season hours. 



Busy season hours: 10 AM to 10 PM CST/PST/EST with weekend work





REPORTS TO - Lead Tax Advisor (Supervisor)LOCATION - Fully Remote!





BENEFITS

PTO - 15 days

Sick Leave/Holidays

No BS corporate culture - we're modern, laid back, and straight to the point

Professional development opportunities and continuous learning

Collaborative team culture with awesome co-workers

Opportunity to grow with a fast-expanding firm

Digital-first approach with cutting-edge tax technology

Work alongside tax professionals focused on innovative tax strategies

Entrepreneurial environment that rewards initiative and fresh ideas









Hiring Process



Apply and record a Loom/Video introducing yourself and explaining why you are a good fit for this position.





 that to : 





Prescreen interview (30 minutes)

Technical test (take-home)

Panel/culture interview (60 minutes)

title: Tax Manager (US Taxes)
description:
We are looking for someone with one of the following:

- Philippines CPA with US CPA Firm experience as an tax associate or senior tax associate

- US CPA Firm experience as an associate with 5+ years of experience

- Philippines large CPA Firm experience with some US tax experience



Role

Tax Manager at The CPA Dude, a fast-growing tax firm serving high-net-worth individuals and businesses with complex tax profiles. In this role, you will be the backbone of our tax operations, ensuring smooth client management, document handling, and supporting the tax preparation process. As a critical member of our team, you'll help deliver tax transformations with comprehensive care, embodying our mission to become the Nike of tax firms.



Responsibilities

Prepare complex tax returns

Manage client onboarding processes and maintain ongoing client relationships with a focus on client success

Review tax returns to identify missing documents, flag discrepancies, and ensure completeness before submission

Organize, label, and track client files for team access and review with meticulous attention to detail

Create and roll forward workpapers, evaluating them for accuracy and improvement

Communicate directly with clients via
 and phone calls to clarify information or request documents

Proactively engage with clients to maintain relationships and identify retention risks

Collaborate with bookkeepers, assistants, and tax preparers to gather necessary information

Escalate issues appropriately to management when needed

Command presence with strong verbal and written communication skills

Respond to client inquiries within the same business day (our fast response culture)

Liaise between clients, contractors, and internal teams to ensure timely delivery of services



Results

Ensure high client satisfaction and retention through exceptional client service

Maintain accurate and complete client files for efficient tax preparation

Ensure timely filing of all client tax documents and extensions

Foster positive client relationships as a trusted advisor

Demonstrate a measurable impact on client retention rates

Successfully onboard new clients with a smooth transition process

Contribute to the firm's growth through process improvement and efficiency

Maintain a high level of client responsiveness (same day or within 24 hours)

Support our tax advisors in delivering comprehensive tax planning services



Requirements



1. 1-3 years of experience in U.S. tax operations and/or public accounting

2. Strong understanding of U.S. tax return structures (individual and business)

3. Experience with document management and preparation for tax filing

4. Proficiency with Google Workspace (Docs, Sheets, Drive, Gmail, pivot tables, filters, formulas)

5. Experience with U.S. tax software (e.g., ProConnect, QuickBooks Online, TaxDome)

6. Strong attention to detail and organizational skills

7. Excellent client-facing and call handling abilities - must be comfortable with video and phone calls

8. Critical thinking skills to determine what's missing or needs fixing

9. Research-first mindset – ability to leverage AI, internet tools, or tax guides before asking for help

10. Strong written and spoken English communication skills

11. Ability to work remotely with a high degree of autonomy

12. Killer project management and follow-up skills

13. Ability to adapt to new systems and technologies quickly

14. Comfortable working with 4 hours overlap in US hours

15. Ability to manage multiple tasks and prioritize workload while maintaining calm

16. A dedicated and secure workspace, free of distractions



Location

Remote position with dedicated and secure workspace required, free of distractions.



Compensation



Transparent compensation structure based on experience and performance



Get paid what you're worth - we reward based on performance, not billable hours



Bonus structure for identifying and closing upsell opportunities

Competitive salary with a clear growth path



$2000 a month 



Benefits



1. 100% remote work environment with the infrastructure to work from anywhere in the world

2. No BS corporate culture - we're modern, laid back, and straight to the point

3. Professional development opportunities and continuous learning

4. Collaborative team culture with awesome co-workers

5. Opportunity to grow with a fast-expanding firm

6. Digital-first approach with cutting-edge tax technology

7. Work alongside tax professionals focused on innovative tax strategies

8. Entrepreneurial environment that rewards initiative and fresh ideas



Core Values



1. Communication: Honest, kind candor with prompt responses. We value over-communication—more context is always better.

2. Ownership: Taking full responsibility for work and relationships. Deadlines are non-negotiable, and quality work is expected.

3. Work Smarter, Not Harder: Leveraging better technology, refining processes, and bringing fresh, creative thinking.



About Us



Our mission is to deliver tax transformations with comprehensive care by becoming the Nike of tax firms. The CPA Dude was created based on all the procedures that the founder didn't like about public accounting and made a firm based on output and not billable hours.



We are a modern, laid-back, and straight-to-the-point tax firm. While our name is approachable, our work demands precision and expertise. We offer tax compliance but are truly focused on consulting with Tax Advisory Services (TAS).



We serve high-net-worth individuals and businesses with complex tax profiles, specializing in tax planning and structuring for real estate investors, business owners, content creators, day traders, tech professionals, and high-earning 1099 contractors. Our focus is on maximizing tax planning strategies that make the biggest impact, including:



1. Entity & compensation optimization

2. Real estate industry strategies (Asset sales, Depreciation, 1031, Real estate professional, etc.)

3. Workhorse strategies (Augusta, Accountable plan, travel optimization, etc.)

4. Retirement optimization

5. And much more "nerdy tax stuff"



We're not just a tax firm—we're a forward-thinking team that values autonomy, clear communication, constant improvement, and mutual respect. We give our clients the chance to showcase real tax savings when we file their returns.



Software You'll Use:



ProConnect (Intuit) – tax return and extension prep

TaxDome – CRM and secure client communication

QuickBooks Online – for coordinating with bookkeepers

Google Workspace – Docs, Sheets, Drive, Gmail (we don't use Microsoft Office)

Go High Level



Working Hours

Regular hours: 8 Hours with 4 hours overlap in US time

Busy season hours: 10 AM to 10 PM PST with weekend work



Hiring Process

Apply and record a Loom introducing yourself and explaining why you are a good fit for this position.



 that to : 



Prescreen interview (30 minutes)

Technical test (take-home)

Panel/culture interview (60 minutes)

title: Real estate bookkeeper STESSA
description:
Update: I am looking for a detail-oriented and US TAX knowledgeable BOOKKEEPER/accountant to manage the bookkeeping for my US based real estate investment portfolio. this mostly consist of categorizing transactions correctly, according to US tax law, so I need you to be familiar with how to categorize different scenarios, such as expenses from rentals versus expenses from flips as well as expenses from rehabs that are either sold or later rented! this is the most IMPORTANT part of the job. If you do not know this, please do NOT apply!. I do NOT do Realtor type work- no MLS, no showings, none of that!



The Current Project:

I have a mix of rental properties and several distressed properties that I have rehabbed and sold. My books currently need a significant "cleanup" and reorganization.

• Phase 1 (Full-Time): I need someone dedicated for the first 4+weeks to audit my backlogged receipts, reconcile bank statements, and ensure every transaction in Stessa is accurately categorized.

• Phase 2 (Part-Time): Once the cleanup is complete, this will transition into an ongoing part-time role (approx. 5–10 hours/week) to maintain the accounts, manage receipts, and prepare monthly reports.

Key Requirements:

• Stessa Mastery: Deep familiarity with the platform’s categorization and property tagging.

• Rehab/Flip Accounting: Understanding how to "capitalize" all costs (materials, labor, and interest) for properties that were never placed in service.

I am looking for a partner who takes ownership and can flag discrepancies before they become issues.

Here, every win counts.

Every improvement gets noticed.

And growth isn’t just talk — it’s paid.

If you want a place where you can level up your skills, income, and career — and be surrounded by A-players who push you to be better — this is it.

title: CRM & Automation Systems Specialist (HoneyBook + Excel)
description:
CRM & Systems Automation Specialist (HoneyBook + Excel) – Luxury Photo Booth Company



We are a growing luxury photo booth company based in Orange County, California. We specialize in weddings, corporate events, and milestone celebrations.



We are looking for a highly skilled systems builder to completely streamline our backend operations.



This role is focused strictly on building and automating our system — not handling daily admin tasks.



?



Objective



We want a fully streamlined, self-sufficient system where:



• All leads flow cleanly through HoneyBook

• Our pipeline clearly reflects every stage of the booking process

• Contracts and payments are automated

• Revenue tracking is visible in a clean Excel dashboard

• Our backend is organized and scalable



The goal is clarity, automation, and zero confusion.



?



Scope of Work



1. HoneyBook System Build

 • Design a complete inquiry-to-booking workflow

 • Create automated
 sequences

 • Automate contracts and payment schedules

 • Build tagging and pipeline structure

 • Set up automated follow-ups

 • Ensure the pipeline clearly reflects:

Inquiry ? Proposal Sent ? Booked ? Lost ? Completed



We want the system to run smoothly once a lead enters.



?



2. Excel Dashboard Creation



Create a master Excel dashboard that tracks:

 • Lead source

 • Event type

 • Event date

 • Package selected

 • Revenue

 • Deposit status

 • Remaining balance

 • Booking status

 • Monthly revenue totals

 • Close rate



It must be clean, organized, and easy to read.



?



3. File Structure Organization



Create a standardized Google Drive structure for:

 • Contracts

 • Invoices

 • Event folders by year

 • Overlay design files

 • Client communication records



Everything must be clearly organized and repeatable.



?



4. Documentation



Provide documentation explaining:

 • How the system works

 • How to maintain it

 • How to update or scale it



We want a system we can either manage internally or have another assistant operate later.



?



Ideal Candidate

 • Expert in HoneyBook automation

 • Strong Excel/dashboard skills

 • Experience building CRM systems

 • Detail-oriented and process-driven

 • Strong English communication



This is a system-building role, not data entry.



?



Timeline



3–4 weeks to build

1–2 weeks for testing and adjustments



?



To Apply



Start your proposal with: “Streamlined System.”



Please include:

 1. Examples of HoneyBook systems you’ve built

 2. Example dashboards (screenshots or descriptions)

 3. Your approach to building automated CRM systems

 4. Estimated timeline

 5. Your rate (hourly or fixed)



We are looking for long-term quality, not the cheapest option.

title: AI Workflow Automation & Executive Assistant
description:
# AI & Workflow Operations Manager



Full-Time | Remote / Hybrid



## About Us



We are a fast-growing B2B company selling high-ticket wellness and medical equipment to clinics, med-spas, wellness centers, and healthcare operators across North America.



We operate at a fast pace and are building AI-driven internal systems to scale efficiently.



This role combines workflow automation, executive support, financial coordination, and operational execution.



---



## Role Overview



We are hiring a full-time Workflow Automation & Executive Assistant to support leadership and help build internal systems.



This is not a basic assistant role. You will:



* Automate workflows using AI tools

* Help manage financial tracking and reporting

* Support marketing execution

* Coordinate fulfillment and customer support

* Manage calendars and internal operations



Training will be provided.



---



## Work Structure



* Fully remote

* Full-time position

* 9-10 hours per day required

* Flexible availability required based on business needs



You must be responsive, organized, and comfortable working independently.



---



## Core Responsibilities



### 1. Workflow Automation & AI Systems



* Build and maintain automated workflows using AI tools

* Improve operational efficiency through automation

* Connect systems such as CRM, payment platforms, and internal dashboards

* Maintain and optimize GoHighLevel workflows

* Reduce repetitive manual tasks across departments



---



### 2. Financial Coordination



* Track revenue, expenses, and basic financial metrics

* Assist with reporting and internal financial organization

* Help reconcile transactions and organize payment records

* Coordinate with accounting when needed



---



### 3. Marketing & Sales Support



* Assist with campaign setup and execution

* Manage CRM updates and pipeline organization in GoHighLevel

* Support follow-up sequences and lead tracking

* Coordinate between marketing and sales team



---



### 4. Fulfillment & Customer Support



* Coordinate order fulfillment and logistics tracking

* Respond to customer inquiries

* Ensure smooth onboarding for new customers

* Manage post-sale follow-up processes



---



### 5. Executive Assistance



* Manage calendars and scheduling

* Organize internal documentation and SOPs

* Prepare reports and summaries

* Handle operational coordination tasks



---



## Requirements



No formal experience required.



We are hiring for:



* Strong organizational ability

* High attention to detail

* Logical and systems-based thinking

* Comfort using software and learning new tools quickly

* Strong written communication skills

* High level of ownership and accountability



Training will be provided in:



* Workflow automation tools

* AI productivity systems

* GoHighLevel

* Financial tracking systems

* Internal operations processes



---



## Ideal Traits



* Tech-savvy and curious

* Process-oriented

* Proactive and solution-driven

* Comfortable working in a fast-moving environment



---

We are looking for someone who wants to grow long-term and build real operational leverage through automation.

You're the right person if:

You can switch tone instantly — from punchy ad copy to conversational

Tools we use:

ChatGPT / Claude, Meta Ads Library, Apify, Google Docs, Notion.

How many followers your own account has. Whether you've worked at an agency. If your content is good and you move fast, that's what matters.

Applications reviewed on a rolling basis. If you're a fit you'll hear back within 48 hours.

title: Technical Admin – Assisting The Project Managers
description:
We are looking for a highly technical, detail-oriented Technical Admin to join our team on a part-time basis (approximately 20 hours per week), with the opportunity to grow into a full-time role.



This is a behind-the-scenes technical role focused on setting up, configuring, and connecting the tools and platforms that power our clients' WordPress websites. If you love diving into integrations, troubleshooting broken connections, and making sure everything works seamlessly — this role is for you.



Responsibilities



Automation & Integrations

- Set up and configure Zapier accounts and build Zaps to automate workflows between platforms

- Connect and authorize third-party tools, APIs, and services



CRM & Platform Configuration

- Configure accounts and settings within GoHighLevel (GHL) and similar platforms

- Set up pipelines, automations, and account-level settings for clients



WordPress Technical Setup

- Connect, activate, and authorize WordPress plugin licenses

- Troubleshoot plugin conflicts, configuration issues, and integration errors

- Ensure WordPress sites are properly set up and fully functional before going live



Analytics & Search Tools

- Configure Google Search Console for client websites

- Set up and connect Google Analytics accounts and verify tracking is working correctly



General Technical Admin

- Perform all technical administrative tasks required to get client websites configured and live

- Identify when something isn't connected correctly, diagnose the issue, and resolve it

- Document processes and configurations for team reference



Requirements

- Strong technical aptitude — you must be able to figure things out, not just follow instructions

- Proven experience with Zapier, WordPress, and Google tools (Search Console, Analytics)

- Experience with GoHighLevel (GHL) or similar CRM/marketing platforms is a strong plus

- Comfortable working with plugin licenses, API keys, and third-party integrations

- Excellent troubleshooting skills — you can identify what's broken and fix it

- Self-motivated, detail-oriented, and able to work independently

- Strong communication skills and ability to ask the right questions when stuck



Benefits & Growth

- Remote, flexible work environment

- Part-time to start (~20 hours/week) with a clear path to full-time

- Hands-on experience with cutting-edge automation and WordPress workflows

- Opportunity to grow with an expanding team

title: Golf Directory Data Researcher (PGA of America – One-Time Project)
description:
We are building a structured database of golf industry decision-makers using the PGA of America member directory.



You will work state by state and extract qualified leadership contacts from each golf facility.



This is primarily a structured copy-and-paste research task using the PGA directory.



In addition to hourly pay, you will receive a performance bonus for every facility from your list that becomes a paying customer.



? Your Responsibilities



For each assigned state:



Step 1 – Private Facilities



Filter the PGA directory by state



Search for:



“Country Club”



“Golf Club”



Extract all qualified leadership contacts (see title rules below)



Step 2 – Premium Public Facilities



Use ChatGPT to generate:



“Top public golf courses in [STATE]”



“Best public golf courses in [STATE]”



Identify higher-end public facilities



Search those facilities in the PGA directory



Extract qualified leadership contacts



???? For Each Facility, Extract:



First Name



Last Name



Title



Facility Name



Each state will have its own tab in a Google Sheet.



You do NOT need to include the state column.



???? Contact Selection Rules (Very Important)



For each facility, include:



Director of Golf



Head Golf Professional



General Manager



If multiple of these exist, include all of them.



Do NOT include:



Assistant Professionals



Associate Professionals



Teaching Professionals



Interns



Only senior leadership.



No duplicates.



Accuracy is extremely important.



???? Performance Bonus Details



You will receive:



$50 USD for each golf facility that becomes a paying customer, provided:



The facility was sourced by you



The facility appears on your submitted list



The customer payment is successfully received



There is no limit to the number of bonuses you can earn.



? Speed Expectations



Target:

40–60 verified entries per hour.



Accuracy matters more than speed.



???? Deliverable



A clean Google Sheet with:



One tab per assigned state



No duplicate facilities



Proper capitalization



No incomplete names



Clean formatting



Data will be spot-checked for quality.



???? Application Process



To apply, please answer:



Have you worked with structured directories before?



How many accurate entries can you complete per hour?



Are you comfortable using ChatGPT to identify top public courses?



Are you willing to complete a small paid test (1–2 hours)?



We will start with one state as a paid test before assigning additional states.

title: Recruiter / Hiring Coordinator – (Remote, PH)
description:
Schedule: Mon–Fri 9:00am–6:00pm U.S. Central Time (Texas)

Location: Remote (Philippines) — stable internet + quiet work setup required



About us

Buddy Moving is a Texas moving company. We hire Movers and Drivers weekly, and we move fast. This role owns our recruiting pipeline end-to-end (from first contact to onboarding completion).



This is NOT cold sales. You are calling applicants who already applied (warm leads).



What you’ll do (core responsibilities)

1) Speed-to-lead calling + phone screening

• Call new applicants quickly (goal: within 5–15 minutes when possible)

• Run a structured 10–15 minute phone screen and score candidates

• Log call outcomes, notes, and next steps in JazzHR



2) Schedule + run video interviews

• Book video interviews daily based on phone screen results

• Conduct clear, professional interviews (strong spoken English required)

• Reduce no-shows using reminders and confirmations



3) Trial Day handoff + post-trial closeout

• Move qualified candidates to Trial Day (Operations runs the actual Trial Day)

• After “Passed Trial Day,” run a 30-minute “Final Details” call (pay, schedule, expectations, start date)

• Ensure candidates understand everything before onboarding



4) Onboarding follow-through

• Send onboarding steps, track completion, and follow up until done

• Keep start dates and paperwork organized and documented



5) Reporting + process improvement

• Daily/weekly hiring update: leads, contacted, interviews, show-rate, trial outcomes, hires

• Flag issues early (low lead flow, low show rate, pay mismatch, etc.) and suggest improvements



Tools you’ll use

JazzHR (ATS), Google Workspace, Slack, Zoom/Google Meet, and a VoIP/US dialer.



We provide

• A calling tool/US number (no out-of-pocket calling costs)

• Scripts, scorecards, and training — you won’t build the process from scratch

• Clear stages + expectations + ongoing support



Requirements (must-have)

• 2+ years in recruiting/staffing/high-volume hiring coordination (hourly roles preferred)

• Confident spoken English (phone and video) — clear, friendly, structured

• Comfortable doing frequent outbound calls daily

• Extremely organized: ATS stages, calendars, follow-ups, notes

• Can reliably work the CST schedule (night shift PH) long-term

• Stable internet, backup plan, headset, and quiet interview space



Nice-to-have

• Experience hiring for field roles (drivers, movers, warehouse, home services, logistics, construction)

• Experience with ATS tools (JazzHR, Workable, Breezy, Lever, etc.)

• Experience improving show-rates and reducing time-to-hire



To apply, reply with answers to these 5 questions:

1) Confirm you can work Mon–Fri 9am–6pm CST (night shift PH): YES/NO

2) What recruiting roles have you hired for (and approx. how many per month)?

3) What ATS have you used?

4) Are you comfortable doing frequent outbound calls daily? YES/NO

5) Internet speed + backup plan?



(Optional but strongly preferred) Send a 60–90 second Loom/Drive intro video: who you are + why you’re a fit.

title: Expert Customer Acquisition
description:
Seeking experienced closers for a high-commission role closing U.S. customers from company-provided lead lists for our health services.



Compensation



1.5$/Hour



$10,000 per 150 closed sales.



If 150 closes are not achieved with our extensive lead list, compensation will be structured at $65 per verified sale + performance bonus. 



You can reach your milestones using your preferred means. As a sales promoter, confidence, creativity, and charisma is expected to close these numbers briefly and successfully conclude the project. 



Understand the questions of the person you are communicating with in order to close them. They are already an interested party as per the leads list we will provide you. 



This is a commission-only contract role. No hourly pay.



Role Expectations



Target volume: You should optimize this to get higher commissions



Messaging outreach (DMs) permitted, but you must be fully capable of closing over the phone



You will be provided with a large, pre-qualified lead list



Dialer can be provided, or you may use your own



Your primary responsibility is simple: close.

The product is high-demand and positioned to convert. Your job is execution.



What We Provide



High-volume lead lists



Structured sales opportunity



Health service product details provided upon engagement



Clear, performance-based compensation structure



Benefits



• Full CRM access in a structured, performance-driven system

• Complimentary internal sales training

• Access to our private team communication group

• Two weekly performance and strategy meetings

• Direct collaboration with active, high-producing tea
mbers

• Ongoing support and real-time feedback

• Full commission payout structure

• Opportunity to help clients access meaningful healthcare solutions

• Professional integration into a serious, growth-focused team environment







What We Expect



Proven high-volume B2C closing experience



Comfort with aggressive daily call targets



Strong objection handling and closing ability



Consistency and discipline



Ability to operate in a performance-only environment



Application Requirement



Apply with documented success stories, including:



Sales volume achieved



Conversion metrics



Relevant industries



Commission-based experience



We are looking for closers, not learners.

title: Video Architect & Graphic Designer for High-end Creative Agency
description:
The Agency:



Leedia Creates is a U.S.-based boutique agency building visual authority for founders and entrepreneurs. Our style is "Quiet Luxury"—editorial, minimalist, and high-clarity. We don't follow trends; we engineer prestige.





The Role:



Part-time (20 hours/week). You are a creative partner responsible for the visual DNA of our flagship projects. You will work directly under the Creative Director and collaborate with our Ops Manager/SMM.





Key Responsibilities:



• Cinematic Editing: Turn High-End 4K footage into editorial short-form and long-form assets. Master of pacing, silence, and cinematic color grading.

• Graphic Design: Create refined social media graphics, carousels, and thumbnails that match a minimalist, high-end aesthetic.

• Creative Direction: Proactively tell the Director exactly what B-roll or specific shots are needed to make the final edit world-class.

• Reporting: Submit a weekly Friday report summarizing completed assets and the "Shot Request" list for the following week.





Required Skills:



• Mastery of Adobe Premiere Pro, After Effects, and professional Design tools (Photoshop/Canva).

• Expert eye for Typography and Color Theory—knowing how to make a brand look "expensive."

• Proactive communicator who follows SOPs and thrives in a structured team.

How to Apply:

1. Link your portfolio (must show clean, modern video and design work).

2. Include the word "ARCHITECT" in your subject line.

3. The Test: Briefly describe one design or editing detail that instantly makes a brand look more premium.

title: Property Management Bookkeeper
description:
Role Overview



We are actively hiring experienced Trust Accounting Specialists with hands-on AppFolio or Rentvine experience to join our U.S. property management accounting team.



This is a full-time, long-term remote role supporting property management companies with daily trust accounting, bank reconciliations, and financial operations.

Important: Only apply if you have real AppFolio or Rentvine experience and can demonstrate strong written communication skills.



Ideal Start Date: Immediately

Hours of Work: Hourly, 40 hours/week

Compensation: $10 - $11.75/hr

Status: Full-time position

Location: Remote



WHO WE’RE LOOKING FOR

We are looking for A-players, ready to jump into a thriving, entrepreneurially-driven company that has become the leader in our industry. We value people who are honest, coachable, invested, and willing to give their best to their clients and team. We appreciate growth mindsets, courage, candor, gratitude, and the entrepreneurial spirit that define our fully remote team of professionals. We seek new tea
mbers who are all in for the next steps of company growth!



Mission of the Role

The objective of this position is to deliver the great experience (owning the outcome, ease of doing business, and extraordinary service) to our clients through quality assurance reviews, client relationship and account management that delivers accurate, timely, and efficient full-service accounting, while also maintaining an awareness of the unique needs and profit-growing/stewardship opportunities of each individual client.

Job Purpose



The Trust Accounting Specialist is responsible for managing the day-to-day trust accounting processes for property management companies with Trust Accounts. In addition to Trust Accounting expertise, this role requires strong written and verbal communication skills to effectively support client interactions, internal collaboration, and process documentation.



Job Duties and Responsibilities:



Ownership of functions

-Communication

-Inbox management 

-Weekly update
 to client

-Evaluate and implement routine client communication as needed, even if not on the original instructions

-Notify the AE of client dissatisfaction, unmet deadlines, higher-level issues



Accounting requests to include: 

-Vendor credits

-Transferring funds

-General receipts & deposits

-Tenant charges

-Tenant deposits

-Tenant credits

-Owner adjustments

-Ownership changes

-Owner cancellations

-To include transferring deposits to new ownership/management

-To include Lease Only payouts

-HAP payments

-Late fees, eviction notices, NSF processing

-Security deposits

-Both the basic AppFolio flow, and any unique client constraints or policies



A/P cycle

-Approve bills (if the VA enters the bills)

-Management fee posting & payout

-Vendor payments (with any unique client constraints)

-Send physical check files to client

-Issue or request stop payments as directed



Owner accounting

-Owner statement review & sending

-Owner disbursements

-Banking

-Bank deposit followup

-Bank reconciliation troubleshooting & review

-Initiating bank transfers

-With AE approval, enter corrective JEs

-Review issued checks past 90 days



Other projects

-Negative & positive FDR review

-Assist with 1099s and other AE-assigned projects as requested

-Ad hoc reporting (with established process)

-Review management fees for new move-ins

-Review fee settings on vacant properties

-Manage recurring JEs/recurring bills



Administrative expectations:

-Participate in setting and meeting SMART goals on a monthly and quarterly basis

-Attend weekly company meetings 

-Participate in company initiatives 



Required Qualifications: 

-Background in Accounting or proven understanding of basic accounting principles

-Experience with Appfolio 

-Intermediate proficiency in Microsoft Excel and Google Sheets

-Good command of written communication

-Excellent problem-solving skills

-Detail-oriented

-Able to understand new concepts with written and hands-on support



Preferred Qualifications:

-Experience in Google Suite products 

-Understanding of property management accounting

-AppFolio 

-Rentvine 



Working Conditions:

-The job of Trust Accounting Specialist is performed in a work-from-home environment

-Expectation of set working hours of overlap with Mountain, Central, or Eastern Standard Time 

-Virtual communication is routine, so must have reliable internet connection and use of a webcam



To apply, please submit your application through the link below:

title: Tax Associate (US Taxes - Candidates with 3+ years at CPA Firm Experience Only)
description:
We are looking for someone with 3 years+ experience at a US CPA Firm 





Role

Tax Senior Associate at The CPA Dude, a fast-growing tax firm serving high-net-worth individuals and businesses with complex tax profiles. In this role, you will be the backbone of our tax operations, ensuring smooth client management, document handling, and supporting the tax preparation process. As a critical member of our team, you'll help deliver tax transformations with comprehensive care, embodying our mission to become the Nike of tax firms.



Responsibilities

Prepare complex tax returns

Manage client onboarding processes and maintain ongoing client relationships with a focus on client success

Review tax returns to identify missing documents, flag discrepancies, and ensure completeness before submission

Organize, label, and track client files for team access and review with meticulous attention to detail

Create and roll forward workpapers, evaluating them for accuracy and improvement

Communicate directly with clients via
 and phone calls to clarify information or request documents

Proactively engage with clients to maintain relationships and identify retention risks

Collaborate with bookkeepers, assistants, and tax preparers to gather necessary information

Escalate issues appropriately to management when needed

Command presence with strong verbal and written communication skills

Respond to client inquiries within the same business day (our fast response culture)

Liaise between clients, contractors, and internal teams to ensure timely delivery of services



Results

Ensure high client satisfaction and retention through exceptional client service

Maintain accurate and complete client files for efficient tax preparation

Ensure timely filing of all client tax documents and extensions

Foster positive client relationships as a trusted advisor

Demonstrate a measurable impact on client retention rates

Successfully onboard new clients with a smooth transition process

Contribute to the firm's growth through process improvement and efficiency

Maintain a high level of client responsiveness (same day or within 24 hours)

Support our tax advisors in delivering comprehensive tax planning services



Requirements



1. 3 years of experience in U.S. tax operations and/or public accounting

2. Strong understanding of U.S. tax return structures (individual and business)

3. Experience with document management and preparation for tax filing

4. Proficiency with Google Workspace (Docs, Sheets, Drive, Gmail, pivot tables, filters, formulas)

5. Experience with U.S. tax software (e.g., ProConnect, QuickBooks Online, TaxDome)

6. Strong attention to detail and organizational skills

7. Excellent client-facing and call handling abilities - must be comfortable with video and phone calls

8. Critical thinking skills to determine what's missing or needs fixing

9. Research-first mindset – ability to leverage AI, internet tools, or tax guides before asking for help

10. Strong written and spoken English communication skills

11. Ability to work remotely with a high degree of autonomy

12. Killer project management and follow-up skills

13. Ability to adapt to new systems and technologies quickly

14. Comfortable working with 4 hours overlap in US hours

15. Ability to manage multiple tasks and prioritize workload while maintaining calm

16. A dedicated and secure workspace, free of distractions



Location

Remote position with dedicated and secure workspace required, free of distractions.



Compensation



Transparent compensation structure based on experience and performance



Get paid what you're worth - we reward based on performance, not billable hours



Bonus structure for identifying and closing upsell opportunities

Competitive salary with a clear growth path



$6-$10 USD per hour



Benefits



1. 100% remote work environment with the infrastructure to work from anywhere in the world

2. No BS corporate culture - we're modern, laid back, and straight to the point

3. Professional development opportunities and continuous learning

4. Collaborative team culture with awesome co-workers

5. Opportunity to grow with a fast-expanding firm

6. Digital-first approach with cutting-edge tax technology

7. Work alongside tax professionals focused on innovative tax strategies

8. Entrepreneurial environment that rewards initiative and fresh ideas



Core Values



1. Communication: Honest, kind candor with prompt responses. We value over-communication—more context is always better.

2. Ownership: Taking full responsibility for work and relationships. Deadlines are non-negotiable, and quality work is expected.

3. Work Smarter, Not Harder: Leveraging better technology, refining processes, and bringing fresh, creative thinking.



About Us



Our mission is to deliver tax transformations with comprehensive care by becoming the Nike of tax firms. The CPA Dude was created based on all the procedures that the founder didn't like about public accounting and made a firm based on output and not billable hours.



We are a modern, laid-back, and straight-to-the-point tax firm. While our name is approachable, our work demands precision and expertise. We offer tax compliance but are truly focused on consulting with Tax Advisory Services (TAS).



We serve high-net-worth individuals and businesses with complex tax profiles, specializing in tax planning and structuring for real estate investors, business owners, content creators, day traders, tech professionals, and high-earning 1099 contractors. Our focus is on maximizing tax planning strategies that make the biggest impact, including:



1. Entity & compensation optimization

2. Real estate industry strategies (Asset sales, Depreciation, 1031, 3.Real estate professional, etc.)

3. Workhorse strategies (Augusta, Accountable plan, travel optimization, etc.)

4. Retirement optimization

5. And much more "nerdy tax stuff"



We're not just a tax firm—we're a forward-thinking team that values autonomy, clear communication, constant improvement, and mutual respect. We give our clients the chance to showcase real tax savings when we file their returns.



Software You'll Use:



ProConnect (Intuit) – tax return and extension prep

TaxDome – CRM and secure client communication

QuickBooks Online – for coordinating with bookkeepers

Google Workspace – Docs, Sheets, Drive, Gmail (we don't use Microsoft Office)

Go High Level



Working Hours

Regular hours: 8 Hours with 4 hours overlap in US time

Busy season hours: 10 AM to 10 PM CST with weekend work



Hiring Process

Apply and record a Loom introducing yourself and explaining why you are a good fit for this position.





 that to 







Prescreen interview (30 minutes)

Technical test (take-home)

Panel/culture interview (60 minutes)

8. Critical thinking skills to determine what's missing or needs fixing

9. Research-first mindset – ability to leverage AI, internet tools, or tax guides before asking for help

10. Strong written and spoken English communication skills

11. Ability to work remotely with a high degree of autonomy

12. Killer project management and follow-up skills

13. Ability to adapt to new systems and technologies quickly

14. Comfortable working with 4 hours overlap in US hours

15. Ability to manage multiple tasks and prioritize workload while maintaining calm

16. A dedicated and secure workspace, free of distractions



Location

Remote position with dedicated and secure workspace required, free of distractions.



Compensation



Transparent compensation structure based on experience and performance



Get paid what you're worth - we reward based on performance, not billable hours



Bonus structure for identifying and closing upsell opportunities

Competitive salary with a clear growth path



$6-$10 USD per hour



Benefits



1. 100% remote work environment with the infrastructure to work from anywhere in the world

2. No BS corporate culture - we're modern, laid back, and straight to the point

3. Professional development opportunities and continuous learning

4. Collaborative team culture with awesome co-workers

5. Opportunity to grow with a fast-expanding firm

6. Digital-first approach with cutting-edge tax technology

7. Work alongside tax professionals focused on innovative tax strategies

8. Entrepreneurial environment that rewards initiative and fresh ideas



Core Values



1. Communication: Honest, kind candor with prompt responses. We value over-communication—more context is always better.

2. Ownership: Taking full responsibility for work and relationships. Deadlines are non-negotiable, and quality work is expected.

3. Work Smarter, Not Harder: Leveraging better technology, refining processes, and bringing fresh, creative thinking.



About Us



Our mission is to deliver tax transformations with comprehensive care by becoming the Nike of tax firms. The CPA Dude was created based on all the procedures that the founder didn't like about public accounting and made a firm based on output and not billable hours.



We are a modern, laid-back, and straight-to-the-point tax firm. While our name is approachable, our work demands precision and expertise. We offer tax compliance but are truly focused on consulting with Tax Advisory Services (TAS).



We serve high-net-worth individuals and businesses with complex tax profiles, specializing in tax planning and structuring for real estate investors, business owners, content creators, day traders, tech professionals, and high-earning 1099 contractors. Our focus is on maximizing tax planning strategies that make the biggest impact, including:



1. Entity & compensation optimization

2. Real estate industry strategies (Asset sales, Depreciation, 1031, 3.Real estate professional, etc.)

3. Workhorse strategies (Augusta, Accountable plan, travel optimization, etc.)

4. Retirement optimization

5. And much more "nerdy tax stuff"



We're not just a tax firm—we're a forward-thinking team that values autonomy, clear communication, constant improvement, and mutual respect. We give our clients the chance to showcase real tax savings when we file their returns.



Software You'll Use:



ProConnect (Intuit) – tax return and extension prep

TaxDome – CRM and secure client communication

QuickBooks Online – for coordinating with bookkeepers

Google Workspace – Docs, Sheets, Drive, Gmail (we don't use Microsoft Office)

Go High Level



Working Hours

Regular hours: 8 Hours with 4 hours overlap in US time

Busy season hours: 10 AM to 10 PM CST with weekend work



Hiring Process

Apply and record a Loom introducing yourself and explaining why you are a good fit for this position.



 that to : 



Prescreen interview (30 minutes)

Technical test (take-home)

Panel/culture interview (60 minutes)

title: High-Precision Operations Specialist (Buildium & Google Sheets)
description:
About the Role



We are seeking a "Zero-Error" Operator to manage property management workflows and financial data. This is not a "general VA" position. You will be responsible for recording financial data, managing vendor databases, and maintaining complex tracking sheets. If you require "on-the-job training" for basic software navigation, this is not the role for you.



We hire based on Technical Precision and Reliability. We do not tolerate "tantrums" or excuses; we value solutions and accuracy.



Note: If your references cannot be verified, if you cannot work the required EST hours, or if you fail to follow this multi-step process, your application will be discarded.



Required Technical Skills



    Buildium Mastery: You must know how to navigate ledgers, record expenses to correct GL accounts, create vendors, and edit property owner profiles.



    Google Sheets Expert: You must be able to build and troubleshoot formulas (e.g., IF/THEN, VLOOKUP, SUMIFS, and conditional formatting).



    Data Hygiene: Strict adherence to naming conventions (e.g., Dashes-Only MM-DD-YY).

 during shift hours.

/Zoom for daily syncs or urgent troubleshooting. This is a condition of employment.



    High-Speed Internet: Minimum 50 Mbps stable connection (proof required).



    Search-First Mindset: You rely on "Historical Precedent." You look at how tasks were done previously before asking a question.



    Assessment: You must be willing to undergo a live, 90-minute Technical Assessment via screen-share.



How to Apply (Read Carefully)



We do not review applications through the OnlineJobs.ph portal. To be considered, you must follow these steps exactly:



Step 1: The

Send an
 to

title: Shopify Checkout Optimization & Conversion Specialist 5+ year Experience
description:
We are a USA-based Shopify eCommerce company operating under full US compliance and using Shopify Payments as our primary payment gateway. Our store receives strong, high-intent traffic and customers are actively reaching the checkout stage, however a significant percentage of users are not completing their checkout. We are looking for a highly experienced Shopify Checkout Optimization and Conversion Rate Optimization expert who can deeply analyze this issue, identify the root causes, and implement proven solutions that improve checkout completion and payment success rates.



This role is strictly for professionals with a minimum of five years of hands-on experience working with Shopify stores, specifically with checkout behavior, payment flow optimization, and conversion rate improvement. We are not looking for beginners, trainees, or general Shopify assistants. Only candidates with real-world experience fixing checkout abandonment issues on live Shopify stores should apply.



The selected expert will be responsible for auditing our Shopify checkout funnel, analyzing Shopify Analytics and payment failure data, identifying technical or user experience friction points, and determining why customers who reach checkout do not complete payment. This includes reviewing Shopify Payments behavior, card declines, address and ZIP code validation issues, mobile checkout usability, express payment adoption, and any other factors that may be impacting conversion at the final step. The expert must be capable of testing the checkout flow under real-world conditions, including mobile devices, different browsers, and different payment methods, and then implementing solutions directly within Shopify where required.



We expect the candidate to have deep knowledge of Shopify checkout behavior, Shopify Payments, Shop Pay, Apple Pay, Google Pay, PayPal, and overall US buyer payment expectations. Strong experience in conversion rate optimization is essential, including improving checkout trust, reducing friction, and increasing express checkout usage. The expert should be able to provide clear explanations, data-backed insights, and measurable improvements rather than assumptions or generic advice.



This role requires someone who can work independently, communicate clearly, and take ownership of the problem from diagnosis through execution. We value transparency, accountability, and results. Prior experience working with US-based 
 stores and
 traffic is highly preferred. Experience with Google Analytics or GA4, checkout testing, and CRO experimentation will be considered an advantage.



We are only considering candidates with at least five years of proven Shopify experience and a strong track record of improving checkout conversion rates. Please do not apply if you do not meet this requirement. When applying, candidates should be prepared to explain similar checkout issues they have resolved in the past and the results they achieved.



This is a serious role for a serious expert. If you have the required experience and are confident in your ability to diagnose and fix checkout completion issues on a live Shopify store, we would like to hear from you.



Shopify

This ensures the candidate has deep, hands-on experience with Shopify stores, checkout behavior, themes, payments, and real production environments.



Conversion Rate Optimization (CRO)

This targets experts who specialize in improving checkout completion, reducing abandonment, and fixing funnel drop-offs using data, UX, and testing.

title: Body, Movement & Energy Healing (PRC Licensed RPT or Certified Practitioner) - Curriculum Reviewer
description:
AccrediPro is an internationally accredited online certification platform with 5K+ enrolled students.



We are looking for licensed or certified professionals in bodywork, movement therapy, and energy healing to serve as Curriculum Reviewers on our already-certified courses in the following areas:

Craniosacral

Dance Therapy

Breathwork

Reflexology

Reiki Healing

Energy Healing

Spiritual Healing

EFT Tapping



WHAT IS A CURRICULUM REVIEWER?

Our courses are already certified and running. We are adding credentialed professionals as Curriculum Advisors to strengthen course authority.



As a Curriculum Reviewer you will:

Be listed by name and credentials on course materials (e.g. "Curriculum reviewed by [Your Name], RPT" or "Reiki Master Teacher")

Have full access to the curriculum of every course you are listed on

Be included as a reviewing professional when AccrediPro submits courses to accreditation bodies (current partners include CMA, CTAA, IPHM, IHTCP, IIOHT, among others — AccrediPro actively pursues new accreditation partnerships on an ongoing basis)



COMPENSATION:

Annual fee based on your qualifications and the number of courses you cover. The broader your specialization across the areas listed above, the higher your compensation. Fee is paid upon finalized agreement only.



REQUIREMENTS:

Active PRC license as RPT (Registered Physical Therapist) OR verifiable certification in one or more of the following: Craniosacral Therapy, Reiki (Master level preferred), EFT, Reflexology, Pranic Healing, Dance/Movement Therapy, Breathwork

PRC licenses will be verified via

title: YouTube Operator (AI heavy role) / Everything Provided
description:
We run multiple high-volume YouTube channels and operate like a production line.

This role is not about creativity or storytelling — it’s about execution, organization, and consistency.



If you enjoy building systems, following clear processes, working with AI tools, and keeping multiple projects moving on time, this role is for you.



If your main goal is creative writing or storytelling freedom, this will not be a good fit.



YOUR ROLE



You are the operational core of our YouTube production.



You take approved ideas, transform them into production-ready assets using our AI workflows, and coordinate editors and designers to ensure every video is completed on schedule.



Think operator, not creator.



KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

1. AI Script Assembly (Daily)



Pull approved topics from our Trello board



Generate scripts using our Prompt Guide with Claude AI



Assemble script sections into Google Docs



No original writing required — precise execution of our system



2. Voiceover Production



Generate voiceovers using our TTS tools



Follow exact Voice IDs and settings listed in 
 (Pinned Messages)



Review all audio files for errors or glitches before sending to editors



3. Production Management (Trello & 
)



Assign scripts and voiceovers to editors and thumbnail designers



Ensure designers know which script version to follow



Own the deadlines



Communicate daily with editors on 
 and follow up if tasks are late



4. Quality Control & Uploading



Review submitted videos using our internal checklist



Approve and upload passing videos using YouTube templates



Request revisions clearly when standards aren’t met



REQUIREMENTS



Extreme Organization

You will manage up to 6 channels. No missed files, no forgotten tags, no confusion.



Tech-Savvy & Fast Learner

Comfortable with Trello, 
, Google Drive, and AI tools.



Reliable, Fast Internet

Large video uploads are part of the job.



High Availability During Shift

Editors depend on you to unblock production quickly.



HOW TO APPLY (READ CAREFULLY)



We only review applications that follow these steps exactly.



Record a 60-second Loom video (screen + voice)



Show how you organize your files, tasks, or daily workflow



Speak clearly so we can assess English level and mic quality



In the same Loom video, show your internet speed test



Visit speedtest.net and display your results



Application Subject Line:

YOUTUBE OPERATOR – [Your Favorite Color]



Applications that miss any of the steps above will be archived without review.

The ideal candidate must be proficient in DisputeFox and understand both automated and manual dispute strategies, Metro 2 compliance analysis, and escalation through regulatory channels.Full dispute workflow management inside DisputeFox

Credit report auditing and strategy development Drafting factual, procedural, and compliance-based disputes

15 USC 1681 (FCRA)

15 USC 1666 / 1605 / 1637

Regulation Z (1026)

Section 609 requests

Metro 2 compliance auditing and violation identification

Third-party bureau freezes and unfreezes including:

LexisNexis

Innovis

CoreLogic

Teletrack

Handling complex cases:

Charge-offs

Repossessions

Paid collections

Bankruptcy reporting errors

Demand letters

Pre-charge-off intervention



2+ years verifiable experience in credit repair backend operations

3B Sweep methodology understanding

title: Digital Operations & Technical Growth Manager
description:
Digital Operations & Technical Growth Manager

Part-Time | Remote



Availability Requirement

This role requires availability during standard Eastern Standard Time (EST) working hours. Candidates must be available for real-time collaboration between 9:00 AM and 5:00 PM EST, Monday through Friday.



We are looking for a technical operator who can sit between design, marketing, and development and ensure everything runs smoothly. This is not a junior assistant role. This is a systems-minded digital operator role.



Core Responsibilities

1. Website Operations & Publishing

·       Publish and QA Framer sites built by our design team

·       Implement on-page SEO best practices

·       Manage redirects, domains, and DNS setup

·       Maintain client websites including Framer and light Shopify updates

·       Coordinate with external Shopify developers when needed



 Note: You are not designing or building full sites from scratch. You are implementing, optimizing, and maintaining.

2. Technical SEO Implementation

·       Implement technical SEO audits

·       Optimize metadata, schema, and site structure

·       Manage sitemap submissions and indexing

·       Monitor Google Search Console performance

4. Internal Digital Infrastructure

·       Manage client password vaults

·       Maintain internal
 accounts

·       Assist with Google Workspace setup

·       Help organize and systematize digital workflows

5. Sitemapping & Web Planning

·       Build sitemap structures for new websites

·       Assist in wireframe planning focused on structure, not visual design

·       Ensure SEO structure is embedded from the beginning

What We Are Looking For

·       3 to 7 years of digital marketing or web operations experience

·       Strong understanding of SEO fundamentals

·       Experience with Shopify and Framer preferred

·       Comfortable with DNS, redirects, indexing, and hosting concepts

 Bonus Experience:
