title: Experienced Freelance Photo Editor
description:
Job Title: Freelance Photo Editor (Commission-Based) – Real Estate, Weddings, Lifestyle, Corporate & More



Location: Remote / Work from Anywhere 



Compensation: Commission-based (percentage per project or per edited batch – details discussed based on volume, complexity, and quality). Potential for high earnings with consistent output and strong performance. No fixed hourly/salary; rewards scale with results and client satisfaction.



About the Role

We are seeking a highly skilled, reliable freelance Photo Editor to join our growing network on a commission basis. This is a performance-driven opportunity ideal for editors who excel at delivering polished, client-ready images quickly and consistently. You’ll work directly with photographers, agencies, and brands across multiple genres, turning raw shots into standout visuals that drive sales, engagement, and wow factor.



Key Responsibilities

•  Perform professional-level photo editing and retouching on high-volume and high-end projects

•  Handle diverse photography types, including:

	•  Real estate (HDR merging, perspective correction, color balancing, virtual staging, object removal)

	•  Weddings & events (skin retouching, lighting fixes, emotional color grading, batch processing under tight deadlines)

	•  Lifestyle & street (creative enhancements, mood storytelling, artistic adjustments)

	•  Corporate/headshots/product (clean branding, consistency, professional polish)

	•  And other commercial/editorial styles as needed

•  Apply advanced techniques in Adobe Photoshop, Lightroom (or equivalent tools) for non-destructive workflows, masking, frequency separation, compositing, and more

•  Occasionally incorporate graphic design elements (e.g., custom overlays, social media graphics, branded templates, marketing assets) to add extra value

•  Deliver files promptly, meet quality standards, and communicate effectively with photographers/clients

•  Maintain organization with file naming, backups, and feedback integration



Requirements

•  Proven proficiency in professional photo editing (portfolio required with before/after examples)

•  Demonstrated experience editing photos in real estate, weddings, lifestyle, street, corporate, and similar genres – please highlight relevant work in your application

•  Solid graphic design skills (bonus: experience creating marketing materials, overlays, or integrated designs)

•  Mastery of Adobe Photoshop and Lightroom (additional tools like Capture One welcome)

•  Strong eye for detail, color accuracy, composition, and client-style matching

•  Ability to handle high-volume batches efficiently while maintaining top quality

•  Reliable, self-motivated, and comfortable in a commission-based freelance setup (earnings tied to output and excellence)

•  Excellent communication and deadline adherence



What We Offer

•  Flexible, remote freelance work – set your own schedule and volume

•  Commission structure that rewards speed, quality, and consistency (higher % for top performers/repeat clients)

•  Ongoing projects with potential for steady, long-term collaboration

•  Opportunity to build your portfolio and network in diverse photography niches

•  Direct feedback and growth support to help you earn more over time



How to Apply

Send your:

•  Resume or brief bio

•  Portfolio link (Behance, website, Google Drive with before/after samples – essential for real estate/wedding work)

•  Examples of your best edits in the listed genres



We review applications on a rolling basis and will reach out for test edits or a quick call if your work aligns. Looking forward to seeing your magic!

title: Experienced Freelance Video Editor
description:
Job Title: Freelance Video Editor (High-Volume) – Color Grading, Storytelling & S-Log3 Expertise



Location: Remote / Work from Anywhere 



Compensation: Commission-based (percentage per project, per video, or per batch – scalable with volume, quality, and speed). High earning potential for consistent, high-output performers handling large workloads. Earnings tied directly to results and client satisfaction—no fixed salary/hourly.



About the Role

We are building a reliable team of skilled freelance video editors capable of thriving in a fast-paced, high-volume environment. You’ll transform raw footage into engaging, polished videos for social media, real estate tours, weddings, corporate promos, lifestyle content, and more. This is ideal for hardworking editors who love grinding through batches while delivering cinematic quality every time.



Key Responsibilities

•  Edit high-volume video projects efficiently (e.g., multiple shorts/reels per day or long-form batches under tight deadlines)

•  Assemble raw footage into compelling narratives with strong storytelling and visual pacing

•  Perform professional color grading and correction to achieve cinematic looks

•  Handle S-Log3 (Sony Log) footage expertly: exposure recovery, dynamic range management, LUT application, and creative grading

•  Create clean, accurate subtitles, captions, and on-screen text (timed, styled, and optimized for platforms like YouTube, Instagram, TikTok)

•  Use industry-standard tools for cutting, transitions, effects, audio syncing/mixing, and final exports

•  Collaborate closely with creators/photographers/directors to match vision, incorporate feedback quickly, and iterate

•  Maintain organized workflows, backups, and file delivery standards



Requirements

•  Proven experience in high-volume video editing (e.g., daily/weekly output of shorts, reels, or batch projects without sacrificing quality)

•  Strong proficiency with Adobe Creative Suite (especially Premiere Pro, After Effects) and DaVinci Resolve (must be comfortable in both for editing and advanced grading)

•  Expert-level color grading skills, with demonstrated ability to elevate footage creatively and technically

•  Solid experience in storytelling and visual capture—crafting emotional flow, rhythm, and engagement that hooks viewers

•  Hands-on experience working with S-Log3 footage (Sony’s log profile for high dynamic range—recovery, normalization, and cinematic grading required)

•  Proficient in creating subtitles and captions (manual timing, styling, accessibility, and platform optimization)

•  Extremely hardworking and dedicated—self-motivated, reliable under pressure, and committed to fast turnarounds and quality

•  Portfolio required: Show before/after examples, especially with S-Log3 graded work, high-volume projects, color-graded pieces, and captioned videos



What We Offer

•  Fully remote, flexible freelance work—choose your volume and schedule (but expect consistent projects for top performers)

•  Commission structure that rewards speed, quality, and reliability (higher rates/% for proven high-output editors)

•  Steady stream of ongoing work across genres (real estate, weddings, corporate, social content, etc.)

•  Opportunity to grow earnings through performance and build long-term partnerships

•  Direct feedback to help refine your craft and increase your take-home



How to Apply

 your:

•  Resume or brief bio highlighting high-volume experience

•  Portfolio link (Vimeo, YouTube, Google Drive, etc.) with before/after clips, S-Log3 graded examples, captioned videos, and storytelling pieces



We review applications rolling and may request a quick test edit (e.g., grading a short S-Log3 clip or adding captions to a sample). If you’re a dedicated editor who thrives on volume and delivers cinematic results, we want to hear from you!

title: Website design
description:
We are a growing U.S.based marketing and printing company building high-converting lead generation websites. We are looking for someone who understands not just web design   but conversion strategy. This role is for someone who can analyze a website, improve call-to-action (CTA) placement, optimize user flow, and increase form submissions and phone calls. We are not looking for just a designer — we are looking for someone who understands how websites generate leads.

You must have experience working with Squarespace and understand how to structure landing pages for conversions. You should know how to place strong CTAs, structure a homepage properly, optimize for mobile responsiveness, and improve overall user experience. Knowledge of SEO basics such as H1 tags, meta descriptions, URL structure, and keyword placement is required. You should also understand conversion rate optimization (CRO) fundamentals and be able to explain why certain layout decisions improve results.

Responsibilities include reviewing and improving existing websites, optimizing CTA placement and lead capture forms, improving homepage layout for higher conversions, building and editing Squarespace pages, ensuring the mobile version is fully optimized, and increasing form submissions and booking requests.

The ideal candidate has built business websites that generate leads, understands user psychology and buyer behavior, can clearly explain strategy behind design decisions, communicates professionally, and is ready to start immediately. We are looking for someone long-term who can help us scale and continuously improve website performance.

To apply, please send 2–3 websites you built that generate leads, explain how you improve conversions on a homepage, and confirm you can start right away.

We are ready to hire immediately.

title: Logistics coordinator
description:
A Dispatcher, or Communications Dispatcher, answers and responds to any emergency or non-emergency calls to provide assistance or important information. Their main duties include logging each call, providing answers to questions by retrieving information from the necessary departments and supervising the field units’ routes to prioritize and organize their schedules.



Objectives of this role



Serve as an intermediary between callers and units in the field to ensure that needed services and products are delivered

Develop delivery or driving routes using mapping software along with weather and traffic information

Assuage the distress of customers or members of the public during conflicts or crises

Maintain up-to-date call logs or dispatching software to track ingoing and outgoing information

Responsibilities



Liaise with major contracted customers

Oversee vehicle scheduling and routes, dispatch vehicles, and provide timely information to drivers

Report all scheduling and driver complaints to the appropriate location manager

Provide solutions for drop-off and pickup problems

Assist with the supervision of day-to-day operations

Required skills and qualifications



Strong communication and interpersonal skills

High fluency with computers and current software

Ability to remain calm and deliver clear instructions under pressure

Preferred skills and qualifications



Ability to multitask effectively

Excellent decision-making skills

title: Appointment Setter (Part-Time > Full-Time Opportunity)
description:
$10/hr + $5 Per Show + $1,200–$2,000/mo OTE (part-time)

Square 1 Group | Remote | Growth Role



Square 1 Group is a systems and marketing company helping service providers build predictable client acquisition.

We’re hiring a confident, coachable, reliable communicator to join us part-time as an Appointment Setter.

This role is ideal for someone who wants to break into sales, develop real skills, and eventually grow into a full-time role as they hit KPIs.



What You’ll Be Doing



You’ll be the first point of contact for warm leads who have already requested info from us.

Your job is to call warm leads, have real conversations, follow a proven script, book them for a 15-minute call with an advisor (closer), and get them excited enough to actually show up.

You are not selling anything on the call. Your only goal is to build rapport and schedule the appointment.



Compensation



Starting pay is $10/hr (part-time).

You earn a $5 bonus for every appointment that shows up.

You only get the bonus when the prospect attends the meeting you booked.

No show means no bonus.

OTE ranges from $1,200–$2,000 per month with part-time hours. Higher earnings and more hours become available once KPIs are consistently hit.



Who Succeeds in This Role



You speak clearly and confidently.

You are comfortable on the phone.

You want a long-term role that can grow into something bigger.

You take feedback seriously.

You are reliable, consistent, and professional.

You can work US hours.

You’re hungry enough to follow instructions and improve quickly.



What Counts as a Paid Appointment



You earn the $5 bonus only when

• you set the appointment

• the lead attends the meeting live

• Advisor meets with them on the call



Growth Opportunities



If you consistently hit metrics, you’ll have opportunities to move into

full-time appointment setting,

higher bonus tiers,

additional responsibilities in sales or operations, and

junior closer training

We promote based on performance, not seniority.



How to Apply (Follow These Instructions Exactly)



We only review applications that follow all steps.



Step 1: Send an
 to 



Subject line: MANGO – [Your Name]



Step 2: Attach a one to two minute Loom video introducing yourself.

Tell us why you want the role, your availability, and give an example of how you’ve handled a difficult conversation.

We want to hear your natural tone. If you sound good, you get an interview.



Step 3: Attach your resume.



Final Note



If you’re reliable, enthusiastic, coachable, and looking for a real shot at a career in sales, we want to hear from you.

If following simple instructions is difficult for you, this isn’t the right fit.

title: YouTube Video Editor

We run a fast-growing YouTube channel and need a creative, fast, and reliable editor who can make videos that people can’t click away from.

title: YouTube Video Editor — Long-Form History Channel
description:
ABOUT THE CHANNEL

We run a successful YouTube channel focused on history and finance. Our videos are long-form (1.5–2 hours), narrated by AI voice, and use a clean, professional style. We are launching a second channel and need a reliable video editor to build with us from the start.



This is a long-term position. We upload 2–3 videos per week to start, growing to 5 per week over time.



WHAT YOU WILL DO



• Edit long-form YouTube videos (1.5 to 2 hours each)

• Add background music (we will provide the tracks)

• Add text on screen where needed (we will give you the script)

• Source and add stock images and video clips that match the narration (we will guide you on style)

• Export in 1080p or 4K, ready to upload to YouTube

• Submit each video within 3 days of receiving the files



WHAT WE PROVIDE



• AI-narrated audio file (the voiceover is already done)

• Full script so you know exactly what is being said

• Style guide with examples of what the video should look like

• Music tracks



WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR



• Experience editing long YouTube videos (please share examples)

• Comfortable working with stock footage sites like Storyblocks, Pexels, or Pixabay

• Reliable internet connection and able to handle large video files

• Good communication — responds within 24 hours

• Able to meet deadlines consistently

• Experience with Adobe Premiere Pro or DaVinci Resolve preferred

• Experience with history or educational content is a plus, but not required



PAY

$15–$20 per finished video depending on experience.



At 3 videos per week, this is $45–$60 per week to start.

At 5 videos per week (after the channel grows), this is $75–$100 per week.



Payment is made weekly via Wise or PayPal.



HOW TO APPLY

Please send:



1. A short message telling us about your experience editing YouTube videos

2. 2–3 links to YouTube videos you have edited (your own channel or client work)

3. The software you use to edit

4. Your rate per video



We will reply to all applications within 3 business days.



IMPORTANT

This is a long-term position. We are not looking for someone to do one or two videos. If you do good work, you will have steady work with us for a long time. We treat our team well and pay on time, every time.



We look forward to hearing from you.

title: SEO Assistant
description:
We move fast. We publish a lot. Precision is non-negotiable.



We’re hiring a fast, detail-obsessed SEO Assistant to support content publishing, on-page optimization, and technical cleanup across client websites.



Nothing goes live sloppily. 



Nothing ranks by a
.



You are the last set of eyes before SEO work is published.

You are speed + accuracy.



What You’ll Do

You will execute and publish across:

• SEO service pages (proper headers, internal links, meta titles/descriptions, formatting clean)

• Blog posts (optimized structure, meta titles/descriptions, correct categories, tags)

• On-page updates (title tags, alt text, internal linking, anchor text consistency)

• Google Business Profile posts and updates

• Schema edits for sites with hundreds of pages

• Basic technical cleanup in WordPress



You will check:

• No broken links

• No duplicate H1s

• No missing metadata

• No indexing errors

• No placeholder copy

• Pages and posts always have keywords, meta descriptions, etc

• No formatting inconsistencies

• Correct schema across page sites

If it’s not perfect, it doesn’t publish.

If something is unclear, you ask before it goes live.



What This Role Requires

• Speed without sacrificing accuracy

• Extreme attention to detail

• Strong written English with the ability to edit

• Comfort in WordPress

• Understanding of header structure (H1–H6)

• Basic knowledge of schema and on-page SEO

• Ability to follow and improve publishing checklists

• High ownership and personal accountability

• Calm execution under deadlines

This is not a strategy role.

This is not a creative writing role.

This is an execution and precision role.



Standards

SEO work compounds. Small mistakes multiply.

A missing internal link.

A duplicated header.

An incorrect canonical.

A wrong city name.

These things matter.

You must care about the details most people overlook.



Compensation & Benefits

• Quarterly profit-sharing bonuses

• Three weeks of paid vacation

• The week between Christmas and New Year’s off

• All major U.S. holidays off

At Whoosh, autonomy comes with high standards.

If you want to be the reason our SEO work publishes clean, optimized, and technically sound, we want to talk.

title: U.S. Mortgage Processor (Remote Night Shift)
description:
As a Mortgage Loan Processor, you will be responsible for managing and processing mortgage loan files from initial opening through closing. You’ll work closely with loan officers, underwriters, title companies, and clients to ensure all required documentation is complete, accurate, and compliant with lending guidelines.

________________________________________

Key Responsibilities:

• Communicate professionally with clients via phone and
.

• Manage pipeline of mortgage loan files, ensuring all deadlines are met.

• Review initial loan applications for completeness and accuracy.

• Order and review third-party documentation (credit reports, title, appraisal, VOE, homeowners’ insurance, etc.).

• Communicate with borrowers and loan officers to obtain required conditions.

• Submit complete loan files to underwriting and follow up on conditions.

• Coordinate with underwriters, title companies, and closing agents to facilitate smooth closings.

• Maintain compliance with lending, investor, and regulatory guidelines (FHA, VA, Conventional, USDA and Non-QM).

• Update loan status and maintain detailed notes in the loan origination system (LOS) & CRM.

• Proactively identify potential issues and resolve them before closing (income, bank statements, LOX, etc).

________________________________________

Qualifications:

• 2+ years of experience in mortgage loan processing with full-cycle processing knowledge.

• Strong understanding of Conventional, FHA, VA, USDA and Non-QM guidelines.

• Familiarity with loan origination systems (e.g., Encompass, Arrive, Byte).

• Excellent communication, time management, and organizational skills.

• Strong attention to detail and ability to manage multiple files simultaneously.

• Ability to work independently and as part of a team in a high-volume environment.

________________________________________

Preferred Qualifications:

• Knowledge of compliance regulations (TRID, RESPA, HMDA).

• Experience working with retail or wholesale channels.

• Excellent written and spoken English communication skills (C1 Advanced or higher)

• Availability to work during U.S. business hours (night shift)

• A stable work-from-home setup, including high-speed internet, a reliable computer, and a quiet work environment

• Experience using AUS systems like DU and LP



Compensation:

• Starting Base salary: $1,150 - $1,500/month*

• Step-Up Increase: Eligible for a salary increase after successful completion of a 90-day introductory period, based on performance and training milestones

• Performance-Based Bonuses: Opportunity to earn monthly tied to file volume, accuracy, and turnaround times



If you're dependable, self-motivated, and ready to contribute to a dynamic mortgage team, we want to hear from you!



*** To Apply:



- Complete the following questionnaire: 
/to/Qit8ufEQ

- Reply via online jobs with a 1-2 minute video covering your U.S. Mortgage Processing experience and provide the best number to reach you via WhatsApp.



(Applicants must have a minimum of 1 year of experience in the mortgage industry. Applications that do not meet this requirement will not be considered. Please ensure you follow the application instructions carefully.)

This is a long-term position — we are looking for someone who wants to grow with the project



To Apply:

Please send the following:



Your resume or portfolio with links to past projects

A brief description of a multi-tenant or SaaS project you've built

Your availability and timezone

Your expected hourly rate



We are looking for someone who takes pride in their work and communicates proactively. If you disappear when there's a problem, this isn't the right fit. If you ask good questions and flag issues early, we want to hear from you.

title: Full-Stack Software Engineer
description:
**Full-Stack Software Engineer – Cybersecurity LMS/Training Platform**

**Full-Time | Remote | Async-Friendly**



**About CyberJab**



I'm Brandon, the founder of CyberJab, a Seattle, US based company. Primarily providing expert cybersecurity consulting to a wide range of industries we are also have a project in stealth; a cybersecurity training platform built for people learning security based on real world experiences. What makes us different: students train on real infrastructure. We have a live cyber range with real VMs, a shared SIEM, and even real attackers hitting our honeypots.



I'm bootstrapping this and building it lean. That means you'll have real ownership over what you build, your work will matter from day one, and you won't be stuck in a bloated process. It also means we move fast and expect good judgment.



**What You'll Be Working On**



The core platform is live and built in a MVP capacity. Your job is to help me grow it. That means:



- Building new features across the full stack (Django backend, Nuxt.js frontend)

- Improving the learning experience – dashboards, labs, progress tracking, content delivery

- Helping integrate infrastructure automation into the platform

- Maintaining code quality and jumping in on bugs when needed

- Occasionally contributing to our admin tools and internal tooling



This is fast-paced. We ship frequently, priorities shift, and I'll need someone who can adapt without hand-holding.



---



**Tech Stack**



- **Backend:** Python / Django / Django REST Framework

- **Frontend:** Nuxt.js 3 (Vue.js) / TypeScript / Tailwind CSS

- **Database:** PostgreSQL

- **Infrastructure:** AWS (hosting) + Azure (cyber range)

- **Other:** Stripe, JWT auth, Pinia, REST APIs, TinaCMS



---



**What I'm Looking For**



I care more about the right person than hitting a specific title. You might be mid-level with strong instincts or senior with deep Django/Vue experience – either works if you're sharp and self-directed.



You're a great fit if you:



- Have 3+ years of hands-on experience with Django and Vue.js (or Nuxt)

- Can work independently – you don't need someone checking in on you daily

- Communicate clearly and proactively in writing (we're async-first)

- Take ownership of your work and flag problems early

- Are comfortable picking up new tools and figuring things out

- Use AI coding tools (Claude Code, GitHub Copilot, etc.) to move faster – but you understand the code you ship



**Nice to have:**

- Experience with cloud infrastructure (Azure or AWS)

- Interest in cybersecurity (you don't need to be a hacker, just curious)

- Experience building SaaS or subscription-based products

- Familiarity with Stripe integrations

- UI/UX Design experience



---



**What AI Tools Look Like Here**



I'm fully supportive of using AI coding assistants – they're part of modern development. What I care about is that you understand what you're shipping and can defend your decisions. Blindly copy-pasting without understanding it isn't acceptable.



---



**Working Arrangement**



- **Hours:** Full-time (40 hrs/week)

- **Schedule:** Async-friendly – I don't require you online at specific hours, but I need reliable daily communication and reasonable turnaround on messages. We won't have daily stand-ups but I still expect you to accommodate to PST time zone for occasional meetings.

- **Timezone:** Flexible – I work with async tools (Teams, Slack, Linear, GitHub) so overlap isn't required, but some overlap helps

- **Communication:** English proficiency is important – clear written communication is a must



---



**Compensation**



$1,000 – $2,000/month USD depending on experience. Paid monthly. As the platform or individual grows, compensation can grow with it.



---



**How to Apply**



Send me a message with:

1. A brief intro about yourself and your background

2. Examples of Django + Vue/Nuxt or similar projects you've worked on (GitHub, portfolio, or description)

3. One thing you'd want to know about the platform or the role



No cover letter templates please – I read every application personally and I can tell.

You will operate as a technical implementation specialist, responsible for building workflows, tags, pipelines, triggers, waits, and messaging sequences — while ensuring safety, documentation, and scalability.

Clear entry conditions

Exit logic

Loop prevention safeguards

 / WhatsApp steps

Conditional logic

 domains

title: HIPAA/FERPA Compliance Architect — AI Platform Build (Fixed Fee, Healthcare/EdTech)
description:
Flo Omni LLC is an AI automation agency based in Alabama. We are currently scoping a project to build a multi-tenant, enterprise-grade AI companion platform for a behavioral health and higher education consulting firm. The platform will serve universities, social work programs, and mental health organizations.



We are looking for an experienced compliance-focused technical architect to serve as our co-lead on this project. This is a fixed-fee contract engagement, not hourly.



What You'll Do:

Review our proposed system architecture and identify compliance gaps related to HIPAA and FERPA

Advise on infrastructure setup (AWS Bedrock, data isolation, encryption, audit logging)

Ensure the platfor
ets ADA accessibility standards from an architectural standpoint

Produce a written compliance architecture document as a deliverable during our scoping phase

Remain available for technical Q&A during the Phase 1 build (60–90 days)

Review final build against compliance requirements before delivery



You Must Have:



Demonstrated experience building or auditing HIPAA-compliant SaaS or AI applications — please include reference projects in your proposal

Familiarity with FERPA requirements for educational platforms

Experience with AWS Bedrock, or equivalent HIPAA-eligible cloud infrastructure

Experience with multi-tenant application architecture and SSO/credential-based access systems

Strong written communication — you will be producing documentation, not just giving verbal advice



Nice to Have:



Experience with LMS integrations (Canvas, Blackboard)

Background in behavioral health or higher education technology

Familiarity with Anthropic Claude API



Project Scope & Fee:

This engagement covers two phases:



Scoping Phase (2–3 weeks): Architecture review, compliance documentation — Fixed fee: $800

Phase 1 Build Support (60–90 days): Ongoing advisory, build review, final compliance sign-off — Fixed fee: $4,000



Total fixed fee for full engagement: $4,800

If you are interested, please submit:



A brief overview of your relevant experience

1–2 reference projects where you served in a compliance architecture role (HIPAA required)

Your availability to begin within the next 2–3 weeks

title: Recruiter and HR coordinator
description:
Recruiter and HR coordinator

Remote | Full-time | Fluent English Required

Salary based on Experience $800-$1200 + performance bonuses



TopFoxx is a fast growing, women owned fashion startup reinventing the sunglasses industry with solution oriented designs and bold branding. Since 2016 we have grown from a bootstrapped e commerce brand to a global business serving hundreds of thousands of customers with an engaged community of influencers and creators.

 We are not here to follow trends. We create them. Our sunglasses are tangle free, floatable, foldable, and sustainably made and we are just getting started.

This is a full stack recruiting role that requires strong communication, organizational, and evaluation skills. You will partner closely with our HR Manager and department heads to attract A player talent, refine our hiring systems, and help build a high performing remote team.

We are looking for a recruiter who hires only high quality candidates and knows how to evaluate talent through structured interviews, scorecards, and skills assessments. You must be able to ask the right questions, identify real ownership, and move strong candidates through the pipeline quickly.

This is not a passive resume screening role. You will be expected to build structured hiring systems, define role scorecards and KPIs, and partner with hiring managers to evaluate real performance, not just resumes.

In addition to recruiting, you will help build the structure that supports new hires once they join, including onboarding coordination, documentation, role scorecards, KPIs, and recruiting related SOPs.

 You will help operationalize our culture within the hiring and onboarding process by turning TopFoxx values into clear hiring criteria, interview questions, and measurable success expectations for new hires.

Your success will be measured by the speed, organization, and quality of hires, the clarity of recruiting documentation and trackers, the quality and usability of role scorecards and KPIs, and how well the recruiting and onboarding process is systematized and repeatable.



Key Responsibilities

Primary Focus. Full Cycle Recruiting and Talent Pipeline

 • Manage the end to end recruitment process across multiple roles and departments

 • Write clear, role specific job descriptions aligned with TopFoxx standards

 • Post and manage job ads across global hiring platforms

 • Proactively source candidates and build organized talent pipelines

 • Design and maintain structured interview processes for each role

 • Create candidate scorecards and evaluation frameworks for objective hiring decisions

 • Build skills assessments and role based tests that measure real job performance

 • Conduct initial interviews focused on ownership, communication, execution, and culture fit

 • Coordinate interview scheduling and maintain fast response times with candidates

 • Maintain accurate recruitment trackers, dashboards, and hiring documentation

 • Continuously improve and systematize the recruiting workflow so it is repeatable and scalable

 • Build and maintain recruiting SOPs, templates, and interview playbooks so hiring can be executed consistently

 • Help define recruiting KPIs such as time to hire, pipeline conversion rates, and interview response speed

 • Create role scorecards that define what success looks like in the first 30 60 90 days and beyond

 • Define measurable KPIs for each role based on real outputs such as revenue, conversion rates, response times, task completion speed, or other performance metrics relevant to the function

 • Partner with hiring managers to ensure every open role has clear success metrics before sourcing begins

 • Ensure every role has clear culture alignment criteria so hiring decisions reinforce TopFoxx values

Your role is to make hiring fast, organized, data driven, and consistently high quality.



Onboarding Coordination and Recruiting Operations Support

• Coordinate onboarding logistics for new hires including document collection and first week scheduling

 • Prepare and organize onboarding materials, training guides, and role checklists

 • Ensure new hires receive tools, access, and information on time

 • Maintain organized digital employee records and candidate documentation

 • Support interview scheduling and onboarding calendars

 • Assist with basic HR documentation related to new hires

 • Help maintain shared HR folders, hiring playbooks, and recruiting SOPs

 • Support culture alignment by ensuring every candidate and new hire understands TopFoxx expectations and values

 • Track onboarding progress against 30 60 90 day hiring milestones and flag delays

 • Create and maintain onboarding checklists so every new hire has a consistent experience

 • Help document initial performance KPIs for new hires so expectations are clear from day one

 • Support quarterly performance review preparation for new hires by organizing scorecards, KPIs, and documentation as needed

 • Partner with hiring managers to ensure new hires understand performance standards, communication expectations, and accountability from day one

This is coordination and documentation support. You are not responsible for owning company wide performance management.





What We Are Looking For

• Minimum 2 years of full cycle recruiting experience in startups, e commerce, or digital teams

 • Strong ability to evaluate candidates using structured interviews and assessments

 • Experience creating scorecards, interview frameworks, and hiring workflows

 • Experience creating role scorecards and defining measurable success metrics for hires

 • Ability to translate job responsibilities into clear, trackable KPIs

 • Comfort organizing performance documentation for onboarding and review cycles

 • Excellent written English for job posts, outreach, and candidate communication

 • Highly organized with strong documentation and follow through

 • Comfortable using Google Drive, spreadsheets, and hiring trackers

 • Ability to manage multiple open roles in a fast paced environment

 • Proactive, detail oriented, and able to keep pipelines moving without constant supervision

 • Passion for building strong teams and hiring high ownership individuals

 • Experience maintaining recruiting trackers, documentation, or onboarding workflows is a strong plus

 • Comfort creating SOPs, checklists, and templates to improve hiring consistency

 • Strong judgment in evaluating culture fit, ownership, and accountability during the hiring process



What You Get

• Fully remote role with a global team

 • Growth path into Talent and People Operations with ownership of onboarding systems, recruiting operations, and performance documentation for new hires

 • Direct collaboration with HR Manager and leadership

 • Free TopFoxx sunglasses

 • Paid time off



This is not a passive resume screening role. We are looking for someone who can build recruiting systems, define what success looks like for each hire, ensure strong culture alignment in hiring, keep documentation extremely organized, and ensure new hires start successfully through structured onboarding coordination and clear performance expectations.



Thank you for your time and good luck on your job search!

title: Senior Level Meta Media Buyer
description:
Meta Ads Media Buyer 
 & Instagram) Senior Level Long Term



Company: Candor Marketing

Compensation: Based on experience plus performance bonuses

Start Date: ASAP



About Candor Marketing

Candor Marketing is a growing U.S. based digital marketing agency that helps service businesses generate leads and build authority through content and paid advertising.



We are looking for a high level Meta Ads Media Buyer who can take ownership of ad accounts, think strategically, and improve performance without needing constant direction.



This is a long term role for someone who wants stability and growth with an agency over the next several years.



Who This Role Is For

You deeply understand Meta Ads and do more than boost posts.

You understand funnels, buyer psychology, and conversion strategy.

You can build, launch, optimize, and scale campaigns on your own.

You check accounts daily and actively look for ways to improve performance.

You bring ideas, tests, and recommendations without being asked.

You think like a strategist, not just someone who manages ads.



We are looking for someone who can take ownership so our team does not have to manage the ads day to day.



Responsibilities



Campaign Strategy and Setup

Build and structure Meta campaigns from scratch

Create and manage the following campaign types:

Lead generation campaigns

DM campaigns (Messenger and Instagram)

Follow and engagement campaigns

Traffic and conversion campaigns

Landing page campaigns

Cold audiences

Warm audiences

Retargeting campaigns

Top of funnel, middle of funnel, bottom of funnel



Set up and manage:

Meta Pixel

Conversion tracking and events

Custom audiences

Lookalike audiences

Conversions API when needed



Funnel and Conversion Optimization

Understand and optimize landing pages, lead forms, VSL funnels, and appointment funnels

Identify drop off points and recommend improvements

Work with our team to improve offers, hooks, messaging, and creative direction



Daily Optimization and Account Management

Check all active ad accounts daily

Monitor CPL, CPA, CTR, CPM, frequency, and conversion rates

Pause underperforming ads quickly

Adjust budgets and scale winning campaigns

Continuously test new audiences, creatives, angles, and campaign structures



Audits and Performance Improvement

Perform full ad account audits when needed

Identify structure issues, tracking problems, funnel bottlenecks, and scaling opportunities

Provide clear recommendations to improve performance

Continuously look for ways to increase lead volume, improve lead quality, and lower costs



Reporting and Communication

Provide weekly performance summaries

Share key wins, losses, tests being run, and next optimization steps

Communicate proactively and clearly without needing to be asked for updates



Required Experience

At least 3 years of professional Meta Ads experience

Proven results generating leads for service based businesses

Experience with DM campaigns, lead forms, and landing page conversion campaigns

Strong understanding of retargeting and full funnel strategy

Experience managing multiple ad accounts



Preferred Experience

Agency experience

Experience with GoHighLevel, ClickFunnels, or similar platforms

Experience setting up and troubleshooting Pixels and Conversions API

Ability to review ad creative and suggest improvements



What Success Looks Like

Ad accounts are checked and optimized daily

Campaigns are structured correctly without constant direction

Cost per lead improves over time

New tests and ideas are launched regularly

Our team does not need to manage or babysit the ads



Work Expectations

Full time availability preferred

Partial overlap with U.S. working hours

Reliable internet and communication

Long term mindset



Compensation

Competitive monthly salary based on experience

Performance bonuses based on results

Opportunity for long term growth and increased responsibility



How to Apply

Please include the following:



Your years of experience running Meta Ads and the types of campaigns you manage

Screenshots or case studies showing results such as CPL, CPA, or ROAS

A short Loom video (2 to 3 minutes) explaining a campaign you built, how you structured it, and how you optimized it

The word Candor at the top of your application so we know you read this



We are looking for a serious, high level media buyer who takes ownership, thinks strategically, and wants a long term role with a growing agency.

title: Outbound Specialist (Apollo + LinkedIn)
description:

No
. No spam. No blasting.



Your mission: start real conversations with decision-makers and book qualified meetings — while keeping LinkedIn accounts safe and compliant.



What You’ll Do



> Build ICP-based prospect lists using LinkedIn Sales Navigator, 
, and Findymail

> Strategic profile views

> Light engagement (content interactions)

> No pricing conversations upfront

> Qualify interest before booking meetings

What We’re NOT Doing

Requirements

title: AI Orchestration Engineer Virtual Assistant (n8n)
description:
Job Title: AI Orchestration Engineer (n8n)



We are an independent media company with major film festival recognition and awards such as HBO Best Short Film and an Oscar-qualifying short. We produce screenings, talks, and live conversation events with our in-house writer-director.



We’re looking for a dedicated AI Orchestration Engineer who can build and maintain reliable n8n workflows that automate outreach operations. This role is for someone who is skilled, eager to learn, and wants real hands-on experience building AI orchestration systems in a fast-changing space. Our workflows are already designed. Your job is to implement them cleanly, help launch the MVP, and then support improvements as we scale.





RESPONSIBILITIES



- Build and maintain n8n workflows (n8n Cloud)



- Integrate web search and data extraction for lead discovery



- Capture evidence snippets and source URLs used for personalization



- Generate outreach
s using a fixed template and produce 3 to 5 subject line options



- Write complete approval review packs into Google Sheets (approval queue)



- Implement validation gates, dedupe, logging, and error handling so workflows do not silently fail



- Automate sending via Gmail API in a safe test mode and production mode



- Support debugging and quick fixes during launch and early stabilization



- Document workflows clearly so systems are maintainable





REQUIREMENTS



- Speak and write in fluent English (required)



- Strong n8n experience (required)



- Strong API integration experience (REST APIs)



- Strong Google Sheets automation experience (read, write, update rows reliably)



- Experience with
 sending automation (Gmail API preferred)



- High attention to detail and strong debugging skills



- Able to follow strict rules and not improvise when requirements are defined



- Available to communicate between 10:00 AM and 6:00 PM New York time



- Must be willing to sign an NDA before receiving full system details and assets





COMPENSATION & BENEFITS



- Salary: $4 USD/hr starting rate, with potential raises and performance bonuses tied to MVP performance and future expansion



- Remote work year-round



- Part-time role with potential for long-term work as we expand automation systems over time



- Hands-on learning and growth building real AI orchestration workflows





HIRING PROCESS (READ CAREFULLY)



- There will be an 80-minute Zoom interview and video will be required.



- 20 minutes: conversation



- 60 minutes: live screenshare build test (pass/fail)



Note: We will explain the test at the start of the live portion. You do not need to prepare anything in advance. The purpose is to evaluate your real-time problem solving and workflow building ability.



If you cannot complete the live test within 60 minutes, you will not be considered.



To apply for this position,



Send an
 to: 



Change the subject line to: LastName Please Find Your [Insert the magic word here]



At the top of your
 write 2 to 4 sentences on why you would like this position and why you’re a good fit. Do not write more than that or else your application will not be considered.

2. Who is your favorite film director of all time? (first and last name only)

Note: If you meet most of the criteria but not all, and you believe you can pass the live build test and do the work reliably, you should still apply. We prioritize candidates who can execute, learn quickly, and grow professionally.

title: Media Buyer Specialist (Meta-Focused)
description:
We are seeking an experienced Media Buyer Specialist to manage, optimize, and scale paid advertising campaigns primarily on
 & Instagram, with some exposure to Google Ads considered a plus.



This role requires more than basic campaign setup. You will be responsible for building content-driven, full-funnel advertising systems that warm cold audiences, pre-frame prospects, and support sales teams with higher-quality leads and shorter sales cycles.



You will work closely with creative, funnel, and sales teams to ensure paid traffic is structured correctly from first touch through conversion and follow-up.



Key Responsibilities:

Your primary duties will revolve around planning, launching, and optimizing paid media systems across Meta (and occasionally Google), including:

1. Paid Social Campaign Strategy & Execution

- Build and manage full-funnel Meta ad campaigns across:

- Cold traffic acquisition

- Audience warming via video and engagement-based campaigns

- High-intent retargeting for leads, calls, or purchases

- Structure campaigns using appropriate objectives (Engagement, Video Views, Leads, Conversions) based on the user’s stage of awareness.

- Implement logical sequencing so prospects see the right message at the right time, rather than being pushed directly to an offer cold.



2. Audience Development & Retargeting Systems

- Create and manage advanced custom audiences, including:

- Video view audiences (time-based and percentage-based)

- Social engagement audiences (ads, posts, profiles, pages)

- Website, lead, and CRM-based audiences

Build layered retargeting systems that:

- Increase familiarity and trust before conversion

- Address objections and common questions through content

- Support sales teams by improving show rates and close rates

- Manage exclusions and audience overlap to maintain efficiency at scale.



3. Creative Deployment & Testing

- Launch and manage multiple creative variations per campaign, including:

- Short-form vertical video (Reels-first mindset)

- Multiple hooks, angles, and messaging themes per offer

- Continuously test, rotate, and scale creatives based on performance data.

- Collaborate with content teams to ensure ads are aligned with audience psychology, buying intent, and funnel stage.



4. Performance Optimization & Scaling

Monitor and optimize key performance indicators, including:

- CPM, CPC, CTR

- Video hold rates and engagement

- Cost per lead, cost per booked call, and conversion rates

- Scale budgets responsibly while maintaining account stability and performance.

- Optimize campaigns based on downstream results (lead quality, sales feedback), not just surface-level metrics.



5. Tracking, Attribution & Account Health

- Ensure proper implementation and maintenance of:

- Meta Pixel

- Conversions API

- Custom events and conversion tracking

- Troubleshoot tracking discrepancies in collaboration with funnel or CRM teams.

- Maintain ad account hygiene, compliance awareness, and platform best practices.

- (Optional) Assist with Google Ads (Search or YouTube) campaigns when needed.



Required Skills & Qualifications:

- Proven hands-on experience managing Meta Ads for lead generation or sales-driven businesses.

- Strong understanding of:

- Audience psychology and buying behavior

- Content-based warming and pre-framing

- Retargeting systems and frequency management

- Ability to think strategically across the entire funnel, not just individual campaigns.

- Experience working with sales teams or lead-based businesses.

- Strong organizational, analytical, and communication skills.

- Nice-to-Have (Not Required)

- Experience advertising for:

- High-ticket services

- Home service businesses (including contractors)

- Agencies or consultants

- Info products or education-based offers

- Ecommerce

- Familiarity with CRM-driven funnels (e.g., call funnels, applications, booked calls).

- GoHighLevel expertise (for understanding integrations and managing sales pipelines and ad performance)

- Google Ads experience (Search or YouTube).



To Apply:

Please submit:

- Your resume or portfolio

- A brief description of your experience managing Meta ad campaigns, including:

- Types of offers you’ve advertised

- How you structure cold, warm, and retargeting traffic

- How you evaluate lead quality and performance beyond basic metrics



We are looking for a media buyer who understands how paid traffic supports sales, not just how to launch ads.

title: Cold Caller — US Medical Office Outreach
description:
We're hiring a cold caller to reach out to small doctor's offices across the US and introduce them to DocDraft (
) — a tool that helps medical staff write letters and forms faster using AI.



What is DocDraft?

DocDraft is a website where doctors and their staff can quickly create medical documents like:

- Prior authorization letters (asking insurance to approve treatments)

- Referral letters (sending patients to specialists)

- Appeal letters (fighting insurance denials)

- Work/school excuse notes

- Disability and FMLA forms

- Handicap placard applications for all 50 US states



Instead of spending 20-30 minutes writing each letter by hand, staff just type a few notes and DocDraft creates a professional letter in seconds. It saves medical offices 2+ hours every day.



Pricing (so you know what you're offering):

- Free plan: 5 documents/month (great for trying it out)

- Pro plan: $49/month per practice — unlimited documents, voice dictation, PDF with letterhead

- Enterprise: $149/month — up to 10 providers, fax delivery, custom features



DocDraft is HIPAA-safe — no patient information is sent to AI.



Your Job:

- Call small private doctor's offices in the US (family medicine, internal medicine, eye doctors, specialists)

- Ask to speak with the office manager or medical assistant

- Introduce DocDraft and explain how it saves time on paperwork

- Offer them a free trial (5 documents/month, no credit card needed)

- If interested, help them sign up or schedule a quick demo call

- Log every call in a simple spreadsheet we provide

- Goal: 80-100 calls per day



What We're Looking For:

- Clear, professional English speaking voice

- Experience making phone calls to US businesses

- Friendly and confident on the phone — not pushy, just helpful

- Reliable internet connection and quiet workspace

- Available to work during US business hours



Nice to Have (not required):

- Experience in healthcare or medical offices

- Previous cold calling or sales experience

- Understanding of medical paperwork (prior authorizations, referrals, insurance)



What We Provide:

- Full training and call script

- Lists of offices to call

- US phone number for calling

- Weekly feedback and coaching



Pay & Schedule:

- $3.00/hour

- Paid weekly via SafePay

- Start with a 3-day paid trial

- Full-time (40 hours/week)

- Work during US business hours (we're flexible on which time zone)



We're a small healthcare technology company looking for someone reliable and enthusiastic. If you've ever worked in a call center or done outbound calling, this is a great fit!

title: Government Procurement Specialist – SAM.gov & Federal Bidding Expert
description:
We are a U.S.-based company focused on securing government contracts through 
 and other federal/state procurement portals. We are seeking a detail-oriented Contract Procurement Expert to help us identify opportunities, manage our bid pipeline, and assist in the preparation of winning proposals.



The ideal candidate has a deep understanding of the U.S. federal acquisition process and is comfortable navigating complex government databases.



CORE RESPONSIBILITIES:



Opportunity Sourcing: Monitor 
, GSA eBuy, and other agency-specific portals for relevant RFPs, RFQs, and IFBs.



Market Research: Conduct competitive analysis and research past award data to inform our pricing and bidding strategy.



Pipeline Management: Maintain a bid calendar, tracking deadlines and mandatory pre-bid meetings.



Proposal Coordination: Assist in drafting capability statements, gathering technical documentation, and ensuring all "Representations and Certifications" are up to date.



Compliance: Review solicitations to ensure our company meets all "responsive and responsible" criteria before we spend time bidding.



Outreach: (Optional) Assist in contacting Contracting Officers (COs) for clarifications or to request debriefs on unsuccessful bids.



REQUIREMENTS:



Direct Experience: Minimum 2+ years of experience working with U.S. Federal Government contracts (FAR knowledge is a huge plus).



Technical Literacy: Proficiency with 
, NAICS codes, and the DSBS (Dynamic Small Business Search).



English Proficiency: Exceptional written English skills for proposal drafting and professional correspondence.



Detail-Oriented: You must be able to read 50+ page solicitation documents and catch the small compliance requirements that others miss.



Independence: Ability to work autonomously in a remote environment.



HOW TO APPLY (Read Carefully):

To ensure you have a high attention to detail, please follow these instructions exactly:



Change the subject line of your application to: "SAM Expert – [Your Full Name] – [Your Favorite Hobby]"



In your cover letter, briefly describe one specific government contract or bid you assisted with in the past.



List which procurement portals you are most familiar with (e.g., 
, Unison, GSA, etc.).



Include a link to your OnlineJobs.ph profile.



Note: Applications that do not follow the subject line format will be automatically disqualified.

We pay out monthly bonuses to editors that create winning ads, your salary can reach up to 3k$/month depending on the quality and volume of your videos.



We want to hire editors that want to work really hard and get high bonuses. We don't want people that just do the bare minimum. If you just want a comfortable and easy job, we don't think our company is for you. If you are highly ambitious, and want to earn higher pay and ascend into higher roles, please apply and we will help you reach your goals :)



To apply, please answer the following questions in your application:



1. Have you worked with Meta ads before? If not, please don't apply. If yes, please include your portfolio of this work.

2. How many short ads videos (ai ugc) can you produce in a day? Rough estimate is fine.

3. Are you committed to working a full-time shift, and hold no other job at the time of application?

4. Are you prepared to do a trial task to qualify yourself, if we find your application suitable?

title: Tax Administrator (US 1040, Extensions, Sending Vouchers)
description:
Role



Tax Administrator at The CPA Dude, a fast-growing tax firm serving high-net-worth individuals and businesses with complex tax profiles. In this role, you will be the backbone of our tax operations, ensuring smooth client management, document handling, and supporting the tax preparation process. As a critical member of our team, you'll help deliver tax transformations with comprehensive care, embodying our mission to become the Nike of tax firms.



Responsibilities



1. Manage client onboarding processes and maintain ongoing client relationships with a focus on client success

2. Review tax returns to identify missing documents, flag discrepancies, and ensure completeness before submission

3. Prepare and file tax extensions and handle e-filing requirements across various return types

4. Organize, label, and track client files for team access and review with meticulous attention to detail

5. Create and roll forward workpapers, evaluating them for accuracy and improvement

6. Communicate directly with clients via
 and phone calls to clarify information or request documents

7. Proactively engage with clients to maintain relationships and identify retention risks

8. Collaborate with bookkeepers, assistants, and tax preparers to gather necessary information

9. Manage calendars and roster, including scheduling meetings and follow-ups

10. Identify upsell opportunities within existing accounts, earning bonuses for successful identifications

11. Escalate issues appropriately to management when needed

12. Command presence with strong verbal and written communication skills

13. Respond to client inquiries within the same business day (our fast response culture)

14. Liaise between clients, contractors, and internal teams to ensure timely delivery of services



Results



1. Ensure high client satisfaction and retention through exceptional client service

2. Drive revenue growth through identifying and communicating upsell opportunities

3. Maintain accurate and complete client files for efficient tax preparation

4. Ensure timely filing of all client tax documents and extensions

5. Foster positive client relationships as a trusted advisor

6. Demonstrate a measurable impact on client retention rates

7. Successfully onboard new clients with a smooth transition process

8. Contribute to the firm's growth through process improvement and efficiency

9. Maintain a high level of client responsiveness (same day or within 24 hours)

10. Support our tax advisors in delivering comprehensive tax planning services



Requirements



1. 1-3 years of experience in U.S. tax operations and/or public accounting (India or equivalent)

2. Strong understanding of U.S. tax return structures (individual and business)

3. Experience with document management and preparation for tax filing

4. Proficiency with Google Workspace (Docs, Sheets, Drive, Gmail, pivot tables, filters, formulas)

5. Experience with U.S. tax software (e.g., ProConnect, QuickBooks Online, TaxDome)

6. Strong attention to detail and organizational skills

7. Excellent client-facing and call handling abilities - must be comfortable with video and phone calls

8. Critical thinking skills to determine what's missing or needs fixing

9. Research-first mindset – ability to leverage AI, internet tools, or tax guides before asking for help

10. Strong written and spoken English communication skills

11. Ability to work remotely with a high degree of autonomy

12. Killer project management and follow-up skills

13. Ability to adapt to new systems and technologies quickly

14. Comfortable working 10 AM to 6 PM CST normally (10 AM to 10 PM CST busy season hours)

15. Ability to manage multiple tasks and prioritize workload while maintaining calm

16 .A dedicated and secure workspace, free of distractions



Location

Remote position with dedicated and secure workspace required, free of distractions.



Compensation



Transparent compensation structure based on experience and performance



Get paid what you're worth - we reward based on performance, not billable hours



Bonus structure for identifying and closing upsell opportunities

Competitive salary with a clear growth path



$6-$10 USD per hour



Benefits



1. 100% remote work environment with the infrastructure to work from anywhere in the world

2. No BS corporate culture - we're modern, laid back, and straight to the point

3. Professional development opportunities and continuous learning

4. Collaborative team culture with awesome co-workers

5. Opportunity to grow with a fast-expanding firm

6. Digital-first approach with cutting-edge tax technology

7. Work alongside tax professionals focused on innovative tax strategies

8. Entrepreneurial environment that rewards initiative and fresh ideas



Core Values



1. Communication: Honest, kind candor with prompt responses. We value over-communication—more context is always better.

2. Ownership: Taking full responsibility for work and relationships. Deadlines are non-negotiable, and quality work is expected.

3. Work Smarter, Not Harder: Leveraging better technology, refining processes, and bringing fresh, creative thinking.



About Us



Our mission is to deliver tax transformations with comprehensive care by becoming the Nike of tax firms. The CPA Dude was created based on all the procedures that the founder didn't like about public accounting and made a firm based on output and not billable hours.



We are a modern, laid back, and straight-to-the-point tax firm. While our name is approachable, our work demands precision and expertise. We offer tax compliance but are truly focused on consulting with Tax Advisory Services (TAS).



We serve high-net-worth individuals and businesses with complex tax profiles, specializing in tax planning and structuring for real estate investors, business owners, content creators, day traders, tech professionals, and high-earning 1099 contractors. Our focus is on maximizing tax planning strategies that make the biggest impact, including:



1. Entity & compensation optimization

2. Real estate industry strategies (Asset sales, Depreciation, 1031, 3.Real estate professional, etc.)

4. Workhorse strategies (Augusta, Accountable plan, travel optimization, etc.)

5. Retirement optimization

6. And much more "nerdy tax stuff"



We're not just a tax firm—we're a forward-thinking team that values autonomy, clear communication, constant improvement, and mutual respect. We give our clients the chance to showcase real tax savings when we file their returns.



Software You'll Use: 



ProConnect (Intuit) – tax return and extension prep

TaxDome – CRM and secure client communication

QuickBooks Online – for coordinating with bookkeepers

Google Workspace – Docs, Sheets, Drive, Gmail (we don't use Microsoft Office)

Go High Level



Working Hours

Regular hours: 10 AM to 6 PM CST

Busy season hours: 10 AM to 10 PM CST with weekend work



Hiring Process

Apply and record a Loom introducing yourself and explaining why you are a good fit for this position. 



 that to : 



Prescreen interview (30 minutes)

Technical test (take-home)

Panel/culture interview (60 minutes)

title: Appointment Setter
description:
Company Overview

Childcare Business Mastery helps childcare business owners increase enrollment, improve operations, and build systems that create freedom and profit. We generate leads through content, events, and marketing campaigns—and we need a strong appointment setter to turn those leads into booked calls.



Role Summary

The Appointment Setter is responsible for contacting warm and cold leads, starting conversations via text/DM/email/phone, qualifying prospects, and booking appointments for discovery calls. This role is all about speed, consistency, follow-up, and strong communication.



You are not “selling” on the phone like a closer—your job is to get qualified people to show up to booked calls.



Key Responsibilities :

-Respond to inbound leads from IG/FB, Linkedin DMs

-Send outbound messages to lead lists (DM) to start conversations

-Qualify leads using a script (center size, enrollment needs, timeline, decision maker, ability to invest)

-Book discovery calls directly on the calendar and confirm details

-Reduce no-shows by sending confirmations, reminders, and same-day check-ins

-Follow up consistently with unresponsive leads (multi-touch follow-up system)

-Update spreadsheet daily with accurate notes and statuses

-Tag/label leads appropriately (hot, warm, nurture, not qualified)

-Support event follow-up (after webinars/challenges/trainings) to convert attendees into calls

-Track and report weekly metrics (conversations started, booked calls, show-up rate, pipeline)

-Maintain professional, brand-aligned messaging tone and customer experience



Requirements 

-1+ year experience in appointment setting, sales support, customer success, or lead conversion

-Strong written communication (you can sound human, confident, and clear in DMs)

-Comfortable with outbound outreach and handling objections respectfully

-Organized and consistent with follow-ups (no leads left behind)

-Tech-comfortable: Google Sheets, Calendly, IG/FB, Linkedin messaging, 

-Able to work independently, hit daily activity targets, and stay accountable

-Reliable internet + quiet workspace



Preferred 

-Experience with coaching/consulting businesses or service-based offers

-Experience with tools like ManyChat, Slack, Trello



Performance Metrics (How Success Is Measured)

-#of new conversations started per day/week

-#of calls booked per week

-Qualification rate (booked calls that are a good fit)

-Show-up rate

-Response time to new leads

-Follow-up completion rate



Schedule 

-Remote role

-Part-time

-Pay: Hourly





What You’ll Get

-Scripts, training, and proven follow-up systems

-Clear targets and weekly feedback

-Opportunity to grow into team lead / sales coordinator roles

-Fun, high-performance culture with a mission-driven brand

title: Customer Support Experts Needed
description:
We are now hiring Customer Support Experts to assist our customers over the phone.

This is a full-time position only with long-term potential



Customers will call us and ask for assistance with various tasks, such as:



Checking their
 accounts

Purchasing items they need

Signing up for services

Logging into or managing their accounts

Checking or signing up for credit score reports

Conducting general online searches



The tasks we handle are all things that can be done online.



PAY & EARNING STRUCTURE



Base rate starts at $4.50 per hour.

Agents usually work 10 hours per day including the paid breaks, and we allow more hours if someone wants to earn more.

During busy times, we also pay time-and-a-half overtime when we need additional coverage.

Good performers can earn a monthly bonus between $60 and $150.

There is a $50 monthly attendance bonus for consistent on-time performance.

Every 6 months, we evaluate performance and agents can receive up to an extra $0.50 per hour added to their rate if they are doing well.



With base hours plus bonuses and performance increases, a strong performer can earn up to around $1,100 per month.



This is the roadmap of our hiring process:



- You will take a quiz that typically takes about an hour to complete.

- If you pass the quiz, you will be invited to take two live mock calls or skill tests. The first one usually takes around 20 minutes, and the second one is longer, typically about an hour.

- Once you pass, you will then proceed with orientation and training.



Please note that our quizzes and skill tests can be challenging for beginners and require sharpness, speed and excellent attention to details. If you believe you possess these skills, feel free to apply.



You need to have fluent English as well as having very good internet connection and a quiet place to work.

Please apply only if you are fully available for a full-time position.

Please do not apply if you are not based in the Philippines.



When You Apply*



Please answer the following questions:



1. How many hours are you available daily, and on which days of the week?

2. How soon are you ready to start?



Lastly, please include a link to a Vocaroo audio recording (minimum 45 seconds) where you briefly introduce yourself. Tell us a bit about your background, relevant experience, and one hobby you genuinely enjoy.



Thanks,

Aron

title: Accountant/Executive Assistant to Principal
description:
Accountant / Executive Assistant to Principal (Accounting & Finance Focus)



***About the Role



We are a fast-growing Australian-based accounting and financial services group seeking a highly capable Accountant / Executive Assistant to support the Principal across a diverse portfolio of businesses, including bookkeeping, tax, finance, real estate, and talent operations.



This is a high-trust, high-impact role suited to someone with a strong accounting foundation who can confidently manage financial data, oversee internal processes, and support executive-level decision-making across multiple entities.



The successful candidate will serve as a key right-hand support to the Principal, ensuring both financial accuracy and operational efficiency at group level.



***Key Responsibilities



1. Accounting & Finance Support (Primary Focus)



Bank reconciliations across group entities

Accounts Payable and Accounts Receivable management, including invoice processing and debtor follow-up

Payroll support, including superannuation processing and compliance coordination

End-of-Month closing support, including:

Billable revenue tracking

Gross profit (GP) calculations

Expense allocation and review

Group performance consolidation across multiple entities

Inter-company cross charges and internal allocations

Quarterly compliance support (BAS, IAS, and related reporting preparation)

Billing support – invoice preparation, tracking, and follow-up

Expense registration, monitoring, and cost oversight

Annual and periodic administration, including insurance renewals, workers compensation coordination, and compliance calendar management





2. Executive & Operational Support



Inbox and
 management – prioritising correspondence, drafting responses, and identifying critical matters

Calendar and schedule coordination – managing meetings, deadlines, and ensuring effective time allocation

Ad-hoc executive support – follow-ups, research, stakeholder coordination, and internal communications

title: Grassroots Marketing Specialist (Remote)
description:

SteelSafe Storage is a growing U.S.-based self-storage company. We’re hiring a hands-on marketing person who loves grassroots and creative marketing and can execute consistently.

, light calls/texts when needed). You are creative and can produce clean assets in Canva. You think in terms of results and 
ntum, not “branding talk.”



Why this role

title: Operations Team Lead (Remote)
description:
Operations Team Lead(Remote) for SteelSafe Self Storage



Pay: $7/hour (full-time)

Schedule: 8:00 AM–6:00 PM EST (Mon–Fri), 1 hour lunch

Work Location: Remote (Philippines)





At SteelSafe we get things get finished.

Leads don’t sit.

Follow-ups don’t disappear.

Customer problems don’t get “noted” and forgotten.



If you’re the type of manager who needs constant reminders or gives status updates without results, this won’t be a fit.



If you like building a strong team, coaching people to improve, and running a clean system where nothing falls through the cracks, keep reading.



What you’ll be doing

-You’ll manage a team of remote CSRs in the Philippines and help us build a reliable sales and service engine.

-You will also take calls. Our volume is manageable (usually around 15 calls per CSR per day). We expect you to lead by example, not just by telling people what to do.



What you’ll own (non-negotiables)

-You will make sure no rentals are missed. Every day you will check every lead source and make sure every opportunity has a real outcome.

-You will review website form submissions and confirm whether they rented. If they did not rent, you will call them, log them properly in CallPotential, and document the result and next step.

-You will review CallPotential leads and reservations daily, make sure the status is correct (Lead vs Reservation), verify outcomes, and follow up to close.

-You will review inbound sales calls and make sure non-renters are called back with a real attempt to convert, and you will document what happened.

-Every lead must end the day as one of three things: rented, didn’t rent (with the reason), or a scheduled follow-up with a specific date and time.

-You will run a real call review and coaching system. This is not “we’ll review calls when we have time.”

-The expectation is that you review sales calls daily (or meet a minimum standard if call volume spikes), and you review at least five service calls per day looking for service recovery issues.

-When calls are weak—missed close, wrong information, tone problems, or a bad customer experience—you will send short, clear coaching feedback, coach the CSR directly, and make sure the correction shows up within the next 24–48 hours.

-You will also save coaching examples into a simple training library so the whole team improves over time.

-You will handle escalations and service recovery.

-If someone is upset, did not rent because of the experience, or has a sensitive issue, you will personally follow up, fix the issue, and turn it into a win when possible.

-You will make sure escalations are actually resolved, not just “handled.”

-You will set the standard, train people, enforce quality, and hold the line. That includes hiring and training when needed, assigning tasks and expectations clearly, correcting problems quickly when performance slips, and keeping the team professional and consistent.

-A non-negotiable part of this job is “close-the-loop” control.

-You will review each CSR’s daily update. We do not accept status-only updates.

-Every item must have a result or a next step.

-Anything labeled “pending customer response” must have a follow-up plan and a scheduled date.

-If something is not confirmed complete, it must be assigned a next action with an owner and a due time.

-No dropped balls. No silent failures.



Reporting (daily + weekly)

-Each day you will post a simple daily report so leadership has clarity and the team stays sharp.

-That daily report must include: forms reviewed, leads and reservations reviewed, new rentals closed, open follow-ups, calls listened to, calls flagged, the patterns you are seeing, which CSRs missed closes, what coaching was given, unhappy customers identified and recovered, anything left open, and tomorrow’s focus.

-Each week you will produce a scorecard showing leads vs rentals and conversion percent by source (website, CallPotential, inbound calls), performance by CSR (calls, rentals, conversion percent), top wins, and the top focus areas for next week.





You’re a great fit if…

You take ownership and solve problems instead of passing them around.

You’re a real coach who is clear and helpful, but firm when needed.

You like numbers and performance tracking.

Your spoken and written English is excellent, and you’re confident on the phone.

You can lead with high standards without being toxic.



Small business reality

Random urgent things will come up sometimes. We want someone who stays calm, proposes options, makes decisions, and follows through.

This is not an executive assistant role, but it is a role for someone who solves problems.



How to apply (required)

Please send your resume, and let us know what ownership means to you!
