title: Amazon Private Label and PPC Specialist
description:
About the role

We are an Australian owned business with a UK based private label brand on Amazon.

You will be managing a UK marketplace private label brand for an Australian client.

We are looking for an experienced Amazon specialist in the Philippines to manage our advertising campaigns, support A plus content, and stay on top of performance every week. You will work closely with our creative team to brief and improve images and video so the brand stays competitive and profitable.



Key responsibilities

1. Campaign and ad management

Set up, manage, and optimise Sponsored Products, Sponsored Brands, and Sponsored Display campaigns.

Monitor Amazon Ads and Ad Console several times per week within your agreed hours.

Adjust bids, budgets, and targeting to reach ACOS and TACOS targets.

Manage keyword research, search term reports, and negative keywords.

Run regular tests on creatives, headlines, and placements.

2. Private label brand management

Work only on our private label listings, not arbitrage or wholesale.

Review competitor listings, pricing, and offers on the UK marketplace.

Suggest changes to offers, pricing, and promotions based on data.

Coordinate with the team on review strategy and listing quality.

3. A plus content and listings

Review current listings and A plus content for clarity, keyword coverage, and conversion.

Brief the creative team on images, infographics, comparison charts, and brand story modules.

Check uploads on Amazon once the creative team delivers the assets.

Suggest ongoing improvements based on performance data.

4. Creative and video ads

Plan what image and video assets are needed for ads and product detail pages.

Provide clear briefs to designers and video editors with examples and references.

Review final assets before upload and confirm they meet Amazon guidelines.

Monitor performance of video ads and propose changes when needed.

5. Reporting and optimisation

Prepare a short weekly performance summary with key numbers, including ACOS, TACOS, ad spend, sales, best and worst performers, and search terms.

Flag any issues early, including sudden drops in performance or policy warnings.

Keep simple dashboards or spreadsheets up to date.



Skills and experience

Strong experience managing Amazon Ads for private label brands, with at least one year of hands on experience in Amazon PPC and Ad Console.

Confident in managing Sponsored Products, Sponsored Brands, and Sponsored Display.

Confident in keyword research and search term analysis.

Experience with bid and budget optimisation and negative keyword strategy.

Good understanding of listing optimisation, including titles, bullet points, images, and A plus content.

Experience working with a creative team and giving clear, structured briefs.

Strong Excel or Google Sheets skills for basic reports and analysis.

Experience with tools such as Helium 10, Jungle Scout, Data Dive, or similar.

Strong English reading and writing skills, with a focus on UK marketplace wording.

Personal qualities

Proactive and organised, always aware of campaign performance.

Detail focused, especially with numbers, bids, and budgets.

Comfortable working independently with light supervision.

Clear and direct communicator, able to explain needs and findings to the creative and leadership team.

Strong sense of ownership for results and ad spend.



Hours and working pattern

Approximately 3 to 5 hours per week to start.

Flexible schedule, as long as agreed weekly tasks and reporting are completed on time.

Potential for more hours as the brand grows and results improve.

Benefits

Work from home, long term role for the right person.

Stable client based in Australia with growth plans in the UK marketplace.

Opportunity to grow hours and responsibilities over time.

title: Accountant (Multi-Entity)
description:
Role Purpose

To manage the daily accounting function across multiple TBD entities, ensuring invoices are processed, payments are collected, accounts are reconciled, and financial statements are prepared accurately and on time.

The Arrangement

This is a results-based engagement, not an hours-based one. The work needs to be completed each morning once Xero has updated overnight. As long as the work is done and I can see results, the exact timing within the morning window is flexible.

•Service window: 8:00am - 10:00am AEST (approximate)

•Flexibility within that window based on workload

•What matters: work is complete, accurate, and I can see the results

•No micromanagement of hours if outcomes are delivered



Primary Values



Highest Standards : Every figure is correct. Every reconciliation balances. Every statement is accurate. No sloppy work, no assumptions, no 'it's probably right'.



Ownership: You own the numbers. If something doesn't balance, you find out why. If a payment is missing, you chase it. You don't wait to be told there's a problem.



Deliver Results:  The work gets done every morning. Reports are ready when needed. Queries are resolved, not parked. Outcomes matter more than hours logged.





1 Accounts Receivable Generate and send all client invoices across multiple entities via Xero. Ensure accuracy of amounts, services, and client details. Chase overdue payments.

2 Accounts Payable Process supplier invoices, verify against purchase orders or approvals, schedule payments, and maintain accurate creditor records.

3 Debt Collection Actively chase outstanding debts. Request and follow up on statements. Resolve queries promptly. Escalate aged debt as per agreed thresholds.

4 Bank Reconciliation Reconcile all bank accounts daily once Xero updates. Identify and resolve discrepancies. No unmatched transactions left unaddressed.

5 Multi-Entity Management Manage accounts across Australian and UAE entities. Maintain clean separation between entities. Ensure intercompany transactions are properly recorded.

6 Statement Requests Request statements from suppliers and debtors as needed. Confirm balances. Identify and resolve any discrepancies between records.

7 Query Resolution Respond to and resolve queries from clients, suppliers, and internal stakeholders. Don't let queries sit. Own them until resolved.

8 Financial Statements Prepare monthly Profit & Loss and Balance Sheet for each entity. Ensure statements are accurate, complete, and delivered by agreed deadlines.

9 Month-End Close Complete month-end close procedures. Ensure all transactions are posted, accruals are recorded, and accounts are ready for reporting.



Requirements

Essential

•Strong Xero experience (this is non-negotiable)

•Experience managing accounts for multiple entities

•Ability to prepare financial statements (P&L, Balance Sheet)

•Experience with accounts receivable, accounts payable, and bank reconciliation

•Comfortable chasing payments and resolving queries professionally

•Reliable internet and quiet workspace

•Available within the 8:00am - 10:00am AEST service window

Desirable

•Accounting qualification (CPA, CA, or equivalent)

•Experience with Australian accounting standards (UAE experience a plus)

•Experience in a services or professional services business

What Success Looks Like

•Bank accounts reconciled daily, no unexplained items

•Invoices sent on time and accurately

•Debts chased proactively, not aged silently

•Queries resolved, not parked

•Financial statements ready when needed, accurate and complete

•I can see results each morning without having to ask

•Problems flagged early, not discovered later

The Non-Negotiables

•Accuracy is everything. If you're not sure, check. If you can't check, ask.

•Don't let things age silently. If a debt is overdue, chase it. If a query is unresolved, resolve it.

•Own your numbers. If something doesn't balance, it's your job to find out why.

•Communicate proactively. If there's a problem, I should hear it from you first.

•Results matter more than hours. Get the work done right, and the flexibility works both ways.

title: Quantitative Research Consultant
description:
About the Role



We’re looking for a Quantitative Research Consultant who loves working with data and sees analysis as both a science and a creative process. You’ll play a key role in transforming raw data into clear, actionable insights that help clients make confident, strategic decisions.



This role is ideal for someone who enjoys spotting patterns, uncovering trends, and turning numbers into stories that actually mean something to stakeholders.



Working in a fast-paced, client-focused environment, you’ll contribute to the quantitative side of research projects from design through to insight and recommendation.



Key Responsibilities



Support survey design and questionnaire scripting

Clean, process, and analyse quantitative data

Produce data tables and outputs using research software

Conduct statistical analysis to identify insights, trends, and patterns

Translate quantitative findings into clear, actionable insights

Prepare accurate, client-ready reports and presentations

Integrate quantitative findings with qualitative insights when required

Analyse research data to develop strategic recommendations for clients



Qualifications & Experience

Tertiary qualification in a related field

(e.g. Statistics, Economics, Business, Marketing, Data Analytics)

At least 1 year of experience in market research or a data-focused role

Strong analytical and quantitative skills, including statistical analysis

Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Excel, with working knowledge of Word and PowerPoint

Experience with research or survey platforms (e.g. Q Research Software or similar)

Familiarity with online survey tools such as SurveyMonkey

Experience with data processing, databases, and large datasets

Experience using statistical software (preferably SPSS)

Experience scripting and working with online data collection tools



Why Join This Role

Work with international clients across diverse industries

Be part of a collaborative, insight-driven team

Opportunity to grow your analytical and consulting skillset

Remote-friendly, performance-focused culture

title: Virtual Assistant – Operations & Data Support
description:
Note: This is not a basic admin role.

Remote | Long-Term Role | Growth Opportunity



We are seeking a highly capable Virtual Assistant to support business operations across data analysis, supplier performance, communication management, and internal systems.



We are looking for someone who can grow into a trusted operational support partner — someone who enjoys understanding how a business works and contributing to smarter decisions.



About The Role:

You will support leadership by helping analyse performance across:

 • Sales data

 • Product performance

 • Supplier outcomes

 • Margins

 • Warehouse movement

 • Operational metrics



Your work will help turn raw data into clear insights that support business decisions.



Key Responsibilities

???? Data Analysis & Excel

You will:

 • Review sales performance

 • Analyse supplier performance

 • Identify strong vs underperforming product lines

 • Highlight slow-moving inventory

 • Review operational cost metrics



Strong Excel capability is essential.



You should be comfortable:

 • Organising data

 • Identifying trends

 • Presenting insights clearly



Your output must be structured and decision-ready.



???? Systems & Sales Platform Support



You will be trained on internal systems including:

 • Sales software

 • POS platforms



Once trained, you will help:

 • Monitor supplier performance

 • Track product trends

 • Identify margin strengths or risks

 • Suggest improvements based on data patterns



????
 & Communication Support



You will assist with:

 • Reviewing incoming
s

 • Responding to routine communications

 • Managing FYIs and notifications



You must be confident communicating professionally with:

 • Australian suppliers

 • External partners



Strong written and spoken English is essential.



???? Agreement & Document Review Support



You may assist with initial review of:

 • Supplier agreements

 • Branding/design agreements

 • Private label agreements



Your role will be to:

 • Identify anything unusual

 • Flag items needing escalation



Complex legal review remains with professionals.



???? Commercial Awareness



You will gradually develop understanding of:

 • Cost structures

 • Supplier pricing

 • Basic accounting principles



This will help improve the quality of your analysis.



Who We’re Looking For



This role suits someone who:



?? Has strong Excel skills

?? Thinks logically and practically

?? Notices patterns in data

?? Communicates clearly and professionally

?? Is confident speaking with international clients

?? Is willing to learn systems step-by-step

?? Can work independently once trained



We value:

???? Common sense

???? Reliability

???? Attention to detail

???? Willingness to grow



You do not need to know everything from day one — but you must be willing to learn.



You will move from task-based work to operational support.



If you are analytical, proactive, and ready to grow into a broader operational role — we’d love to hear from you.



How to Apply:

1. Submit your resume/CV



2. Include a short video introduction explaining:

- Your experience related to our job posting

- Why you are a good fit for this role

- Your Excel and communication strengths

title: Affiliate Marketing and Digital Products VA (Full Time | PH Remote | US Hours)
description:
Affiliate Marketing and Digital Products VA (Full Time | PH Remote | US Hours)



ROLE SNAPSHOT:



- Compensation: $1,000 USD/ month + benefits

- Experience: VA/ Ops/ Admin/ EA (1-3 years)

- Time Zone Alignment: 9am–5pm Pacific Standard Time (Los Angeles). Please only apply if this is sustainable for you.

- Reports To: COO

- Role Type: Full-Time, Remote



ABOUT THE COMPANY

The Lovers Passport is a travel content creator page on a mission to make bucketlist adventures easy through detailed guides and content.



ABOUT THE ROLE

The Lovers Passport Generalist and Affiliate Assistant is highly organized, revenue-aware, and thrives in a fast-moving creator-led business. You are responsible for managing and optimizing all affiliate operations and digital product systems across The Lovers Passport.



This role blends operations, coordination, and execution. You’ll ensure affiliate links are accurate and optimized, digital products are organized and selling smoothly, and nothing slips through the cracks behind the scenes. You are not just “checking boxes” as your work directly impacts revenue, trust, and scalability.



You’ll serve as the internal owner of affiliate workflows and digital product operations, making sure systems are clean, updated, and running efficiently so the content and brand can scale without chaos.



Results

Affiliate systems are accurate, organized, and consistently optimized. Links work, tracking is clean, commissions are captured, and opportunities are not missed.



Digital products are well-managed and conversion-ready. Travel guides, ebooks, and downloads are up to date, properly delivered, and easy for customers to access without issues.



Revenue-driving assets never fall through the cracks. Affiliate links, landing pages, product files, and automations are reviewed regularly and maintained with care.



Affiliate income, top-performing products, and trends are tracked and reported so decisions are data-informed.



You reduce friction across the business. Creators, editors, and leadership don’t have to worry about broken links, outdated files, or missing tracking; you handle it before it becomes a problem.



You bring order to the backend. Systems feel clean, repeatable, and scalable instead of messy or reactive.



Your work directly supports growth. Better tracking, better organization, and better execution lead to higher affiliate revenue and stronger digital product sales.



Day-to-Day Duties

Affiliate Management

-Own all affiliate systems across TLP (ShopMy, LTK, Travel Payouts, Stay 22, Amazon, direct brand portals, etc.)

-Post daily M-F on ShopMy and LTK 

-Write Bi-Weekly newsletters to integrate affiliates into Passport Pals 

-Ensure affiliate links are accurate, updated, and properly tracked

-Organize affiliate links for easy access by the content team

-Monitor affiliate performance and flag top-performing products and opportunities

-Troubleshoot broken links, missing commissions, or tracking issues

-Assist with onboarding new affiliate partners and programs as needed

-Coordinate with Growth Team to Assign Creators to film/record certain voiceovers or content to promote affiliate products 



Digital Product Operations

-Create new and manage all existing digital products including travel guides, ebooks, and downloadable resources

-Ensure product files are current, properly formatted, and correctly delivered after purchase

-Maintain product libraries and backend organization

-Assist with pricing updates, product launches, and product refreshes

-Coordinate updates to sales pages, checkout flows, and
 delivery systems

-Write copy relating to digital product promotion



Systems & Organization

-Maintain clean systems across Google Drive, product folders, and internal dashboards

-Support automations and integrations (Flodesk, ManyChat, Zapier, checkout tools)

-Document processes for affiliate management and digital products to ensure repeatability

-Identify inefficiencies and suggest system improvements proactively



Reporting & Insights

-Track affiliate revenue and digital product performance on a regular basis

-Share clear summaries with leadership on wins, trends, and opportunities

-Surface issues early with proposed solutions



Tools You’ll Use

Affiliate Platforms: LTK, ShopMy, Amazon Associates, Stay 22, Travel Payouts, brand affiliate dashboards

Digital Products &
: Flodesk, ManyChat, Rexby

Project Management: Asana

Organization & Assets: Google Drive, Google Sheets, Pixieset

Design & Files: Canva

Automations: Zapier (as needed)



TRAITS & BEHAVIORS THAT MAKE YOU SUCCESSFUL HERE:



- Total ownership of deadlines and results

- Self motivator and able to work efficiently and independently

- Proactive problem prevention

- Calm, steady, and organized under moving priorities

- Direct, clear communicator

- Forward thinking. Does not wait until the last minute to complete tasks.

- Detail-oriented (catches the missing link before anyone clicks it)

- Coachable and fast-learning

- Takes pride in accuracy

- Asks for clarity before something breaks

- Closes loops without being chased

- Loves making things cleaner, simpler, and more efficient

- Suggests ways to improve systems instead of just following systems

- Willing to make mistakes and learn from them



WORKING ENVIRONMENT & EXPECTATIONS:



- Remote team, ongoing slack communication, semi-regular meetings

- Daily Slack check-ins

- Must be available for internal meetings when scheduled

- Occasional evening/weekend flexibility during launches (with advance notice)

- High standards, fast-moving environment

- High speed, reliable internet connection (20mbps or higher)

- Backup internet or data hotspot

- Webcam/ microphone for zoom needed

- Computer in working order with no issues (8GB RAM minimum preferred)

- Willing to work during US Pacific Time Hours (9am-5pm)



COMPENSATION & START:



- Compensation: $1,000 USD per month via PayPal once per month, converted to PHP at prevailing exchange rate



- Additional Compensation: 13th month pay after 6 months of continuous full-time employment (prorated), paid in December. For example, if you start in February 2026, you would be eligible for 11/12th of 1 month salary paid in December 2026. In 2027, you would be eligible for the full 12 months.



- Hours: ~40 Hours/ Week



- Start Date: Ideally within 1-2 weeks of offer or sooner



- Holidays/ Paid Time Off: PH Public Holidays Off (paid), 1 Paid Birthday Leave Day (paid), 5 Sick Days Per Calendar Year (Non-cumulative, paid, no doctor’s note required), 5 Paid Vacation Days (2+ weeks advance notice, paid. Not eligible in November.)





HOW TO APPLY

Do NOT click apply on Online Jobs



Please apply via
 to 



Please include the following in the same
:



Send resume to 
 your resume file as “Firstname_Lastname_Resume.pdf” and please start your
 with “Dear Dani,”



Include a short Loom video (under 5 minutes) answering:

-Why are you interested in this role?

-What tools have you used in past affiliate management/ project management VA roles?

-What was the last book or podcast you listened to?

-Tell us about you (do you have a family/ kids/ what are your hobbies)



At the end of your loom video, say the phrase “I have very strong attention to detail.” so we know you completed the instructions



Attach examples of your work (if you have them). Examples include (but are not limited to): screenshots or copy you’ve written, sample Google Sheet dashboards you’ve created, ClickUp/Asana project screenshots, affiliate projects, etc.



Use this exact subject line “Affiliate Assistant Application - YOUR NAME - 2026”

title: Optometrist
description:
Remote Optometrist to complete charts Job Title: Remote Optometrist



Job Summary:

We are seeking a dedicated and licensed Remote Optometrist to provide virtual eye care services to patients across various locations. The role involves performing comprehensive eye exams, diagnosing vision problems, and offering advice on eyewear, contact lenses, and general eye health—all through telemedicine.



Key Responsibilities:



Conduct Virtual Eye Exams: Use telemedicine platforms to assess patients' eye health, gather medical history, and perform vision tests.



Diagnose and Treat Eye Conditions: Identify common vision issues such as nearsightedness, farsightedness, astigmatism, and presbyopia, and provide solutions.



Prescribe Eyewear & Contact Lenses: Based on exam results, issue prescriptions for glasses or contact lenses.



Monitor Patient Progress: Follow up with patients, track their vision health, and adjust prescriptions when necessary.



Provide Advice on Eye Care: Offer guidance on maintaining eye health, managing digital eye strain, and preventing common eye diseases.



Patient Education: Educate patients on how to use their prescribed eyewear properly, the importance of regular eye exams, and how to take care of their vision.



Document Patient Information: Keep accurate records of consultations, prescriptions, and any recommendations made for future care.



Collaborate with Other Healthcare Providers: Work closely with general healthcare providers and ophthalmologists when necessary for complex cases.



Required Qualifications:



Doctor of Optometry (O.D.) degree from an accredited optometry school.



State license to practice optometry (for U.S.-based positions; other country licenses may be required depending on location).



Proven experience in providing eye exams and diagnosing visual impairments.



Comfortable with using telemedicine platforms for virtual consultations.



Excellent communication skills, with the ability to explain eye care concepts clearly and concisely.



Proficient in using optical diagnostic tools (e.g., autorefractor, slit lamp, etc.), even in a remote setting.



Preferred Qualifications:



Experience with remote or telehealth optometry services.



Knowledge of eye health trends and the latest in virtual care technologies.



Familiarity with prescribing digital solutions for common eye strain or other digital-related visual issues.



Work Environment:



This is a remote position, so candidates must have access to high-speed internet and a quiet, professional workspace.



Must be available for consultations during business hours or as required.



Benefits:



Competitive salary with performance-based bonuses.



Flexible working hours.



Continuing education and training in telemedicine and remote eye care.

title: Medical Patient Scheduler
description:
## Job Title: Nurse Home Visit Scheduler / Adult Foster Care (AFC) Scheduling Coordinator



## Company



**OMNISTARR** – Healthcare Staffing Agency (Massachusetts)



## Location



**Massachusetts (Remote/Hybrid as applicable)**





## Employment Type



Full-time (or Part-time, depending on business need)



---



## Position Summary



OMNISTARR is seeking a highly organized and patient-focused **Nurse Home Visit Scheduler** to coordinate and schedule **in-home nursing visits** for members enrolled in Massachusetts **Adult Foster Care (AFC)** programs. In this role, you will contact the **caregiver and/or member**, confirm availability, and **schedule required nursing visits in the system** while ensuring timely completion and compliance with MassHealth program expectations (including required visit cadence and admission timelines). ([Massachusetts Government][1])



This position is ideal for someone who is confident on the phone, detail-oriented, comfortable working with sensitive health information, and experienced with scheduling in a fast-paced healthcare environment.



---



## Key Responsibilities



### Scheduling & Coordination



* Schedule **RN/LPN in-home visits** for AFC members across Massachusetts, coordinating directly with **caregivers** to identify appropriate dates/times and confirm the visit location.

* Ensure **required nursing visits** are scheduled on time—commonly **every other month onsite** (or more frequently if clinically necessary), coordinated to alternate with care management visits so members receive a monthly touchpoint as applicable. ([Massachusetts Government][1])

* Coordinate **admission/initial visit scheduling**, helping ensure nursing participation is completed within required timeframes when applicable. ([Massachusetts Government][1])

* Communicate scheduled visit details to field nurses (address, caregiver contact, member notes needed for the visit, special instructions such as parking/access, pets, language needs).



### Caregiver/Member Communication



* Call caregivers/members professionally and compassionately to:



  * confirm availability and best contact method

  * verify address and visit readiness (home access, safety considerations)

  * provide appointment reminders and reduce no-shows

* Handle cancellations/reschedules quickly while maintaining compliance with visit requirements.

* Escalate urgent concerns reported by caregivers/members (e.g., clinical changes, safety issues, missed medications) to the clinical team per OMNISTARR protocol.



### Documentation & System Updates



* Enter and maintain accurate scheduling information in the designated scheduling platform/system (appointments, reschedules, notes, confirmations).

* Maintain clean, audit-ready scheduling records that align with program and internal documentation expectations (including supporting workflows tied to required visits). ([Massachusetts Government][2])

* Support visit tracking and operational reporting (scheduled vs. completed visits, missed visits, nurse coverage needs, upcoming due visits).



### Collaboration & Coverage Management



* Coordinate with OMNISTARR nursing staff and AFC agency partners to manage territories, nurse availability, and coverage gaps.

* Support the multidisciplinary nature of AFC services by communicating effectively with clinical staff and care management partners as needed. ([Massachusetts Government][3])

* Assist with schedule optimization to reduce travel burden and improve consistency for members/caregivers.



### Compliance & Confidentiality



* Handle Protected Health Information (PHI) in accordance with **HIPAA** and OMNISTARR policies.

* Follow MassHealth/AFC guidance and internal SOPs when scheduling, documenting, and communicating member-related information. ([Massachusetts Government][4])



---



## Required Qualifications



* High school diploma or equivalent (Associate’s degree preferred).

* 1+ year experience in **healthcare scheduling**, coordination, call center patient scheduling, home health operations, or similar role.

* Strong phone communication skills and professional etiquette (comfortable calling caregivers daily).

* Strong attention to detail and ability to manage high volume scheduling with accuracy.

* Comfort using scheduling software, EHR/EMR systems, Microsoft Office/Google Workspace.

* Ability to maintain confidentiality and work with sensitive health-related information.



---



## Preferred Qualifications



* Experience supporting **home health**, **community-based services**, **long-term services and supports (LTSS)**, or **MassHealth** populations.

* Familiarity with Massachusetts **Adult Foster Care (AFC)** or related programs. ([Massachusetts Government][4])

* Bilingual skills (Spanish, Portuguese, Haitian Creole, etc.) strongly preferred.

* Experience coordinating field staff schedules across multiple territories.



---



## Key Skills & Competencies



* Excellent organization, time management, and follow-through

* Calm, empathetic communication style with caregivers and families

* Problem-solving mindset (last-minute changes, coverage gaps, urgent reschedules)

* Ability to prioritize due/overdue visits and manage competing deadlines

* Team-oriented and dependable



---



## About OMNISTARR



**OMNISTARR is a healthcare staffing agency** that supports Massachusetts healthcare providers by recruiting and placing qualified clinicians—including nurses who conduct **in-home visits** for Adult Foster Care agencies across the state. OMNISTARR partners with care teams to help ensure members receive timely nursing oversight in the community. ([Home Care Alliance of Massachusetts][5])



**Adult Foster Care (AFC)** is a MassHealth-funded program in Massachusetts that supports eligible adults who live with a caregiver in a qualified home setting and receive assistance with daily living needs, along with clinical oversight and care management. ([Massachusetts Government][4])



---

title: AI Workflow Automation Specialist
description:
What You'll Be Doing



Design, build, and deploy complex n8n workflows to automate business processes end to end

Integrate AI tools and LLMs (OpenAI, Claude, Gemini, etc.) into n8n workflows for intelligent automation

Connect n8n to CRMs, databases, APIs, webhooks, and third-party platforms

Build AI agents capable of handling multi-step decision making and task execution

Automate lead management, follow-up sequences, data processing, and internal operations

Integrate with platforms including Zoho CRM, Google Workspace, Meta, Shopify, and communication tools

Set up error handling, retry logic, and monitoring for production workflows

Document all workflows clearly so they can be maintained and handed off

Troubleshoot and optimize existing automations for reliability and performance



What We're Looking For



Proven hands-on experience building complex workflows in n8n — not just simple two-step automations

Strong understanding of APIs, webhooks, JSON, and HTTP requests

Experience integrating AI/LLM tools into real business workflows

Ability to build AI agents with memory, conditional logic, and multi-step reasoning

Comfortable working with self-hosted n8n environments

Strong problem-solving skills — you can look at a business process and figure out how to automate it

Excellent written English and ability to communicate progress clearly

title: Senior Risk & Compliance Consultant (Fintech & Crypto)
description:
We need an expert who bridges the gap between Web2 Traditional Finance (Fiat Rails) and Web3 On-chain Compliance.

Your core mission is not just to be a "blocker," but to "design safe mechanisms that enable business velocity." You will ensure we pass the rigorous onboarding requirements of our banking partners (e.g., Cybrid's AML program review) while managing the operational risks of a high-volume payment platform.



Key Responsibilities

Compliance Program Build-out

Draft BSA/AML Policies from Scratch: Create internal compliance policy documents (CIP, AML, OFAC) that meet US banking standards. This is a prerequisite for going live with partners like Cybrid.

Define KYC/KYB Standards: Design tiered identity verification workflows for our dual-track business (B2B Agency + B2C Palau ID). Define limits and requirements for Tier 1 vs. Tier 2 users.

Regulatory Strategy: Assess licensing requirements (MTL/MSB/MiCA) for US, Canada, and EU markets, providing a strategic roadmap for the next 12-24 months.

Operational Risk & Fraud Prevention

ACH Risk Management: specifically for ACH Pull scenarios. Design logic to mitigate NSF (Insufficient Funds) and Unauthorized Returns (e.g., balance checks via Plaid, settlement holding periods).

On-Chain Risk Integration: Configure on-chain analysis tools (e.g., GoPlus, Chainalysis, Elliptic) to define blocking rules for high-risk wallet addresses.

Transaction Monitoring: Set up velocity limits and alert rules for suspicious activities; handle Suspicious Activity Reports (SARs) if necessary.

Partner Enablement

Due Diligence (DD): Represent the company in handling compliance inquiries from upstream banking partners and infrastructure providers (Cybrid, Hex Trust), assisting in completing complex DD questionnaires.

Vendor Assessment: Evaluate the compliance robustness of new payment rails (e.g., European SEPA, Asian local payouts).



Requirements

Experience: 5+ years of risk/compliance experience in Fintech or Crypto Exchanges. Must have hands-on experience with US Banking Rails (ACH/Wire).

Expertise:

Deep knowledge of FinCEN, OFAC sanctions, and AML workflows.

Strong understanding of the "FBO Account" model and the legal boundaries of a "Money Transmitter."

Understanding of stablecoin (USDC) minting and burning flows.

Tool Stack: Familiarity with industry-standard tools like Persona (Identity), Plaid (Bank Auth), and Chainalysis/TRM Labs (Crypto AML).

Mindset: Ability to balance "Compliance Requirements" with "User Experience." We don't need a bureaucrat; we need a builder who offers solutions.



Bonus Points

Certified Anti-Money Laundering Specialist (CAMS) certification.

Experience helping startups successfully onboard with Zero Hash, Cybrid, Circle, or Stripe.

Knowledge of RNS.ID (Palau Digital Residency) or similar sovereign identity projects.

Familiarity with India TDS tax regulations or Philippines cross-border remittance laws.

title: Data Protection Officer (DPO)
description:
As the DPO, you will be responsible for ensuring our company’s compliance with data protection regulations, implementing robust data protection policies and procedures, and safeguarding the privacy and protection of the data of our employees, customers, and stakeholders.

This is a critical role that requires a deep understanding of data privacy laws, excellent communication skills, and the ability to collaborate effectively across various departments.



 Responsibilities:



1. Data Protection and Privacy Policies:



• Develop, implement, and maintain data protection policies and controls to ensure regulatory compliance.

• Conduct audits to monitor compliance and collaborate with legal teams to address data protection issues.

• Ensure compliance for third-party vendors and update policies as necessary.



2. Privacy Impact Assessments and Data Mapping:



• Conduct Data Protection Impact Assessments (DPIAs) for new projects and perform data mapping to identify privacy risks.

• Develop and implement mitigation strategies and regularly update DPIAs and data mapping exercises.

• Monitor emerging technologies for privacy impacts.



3. Data Subject Rights and Consent Management:



• Manage processes for data subject requests (e.g., access, erasure) and obtain and manage consent for data processing.

• Ensure compliance with consent requirements and periodically review processes.



4. Training and Awareness:



• Provide regular training on data protection and regulatory requirements.

• Develop specialized training for high-risk data processing and integrate data protection into onboarding.



5. Security I
 Management and Breach Response:



• Develop and maintain an i
 response plan and coordinate with teams to manage breaches.

• Conduct post-i
 reviews and implement prevention measures.



6. Vendor Management:



• Implement a vendor management program to assess and monitor data protection practices.

• Review and negotiate data processing agreements and conduct regular compliance audits.



7. Regulatory Compliance and Reporting:



• Maintain an inventory of data protection laws and serve as the contact for regulatory authorities.

• Prepare reports on data protection activities and i
.



8. Privacy by Design and Data Governance:



• Integrate privacy by design principles into product development and implement data governance frameworks.

• Monitor and recommend improvements for data governance compliance.



9. General Recommendation:



• Recommend strategies to management for enhancing overall data protection practices, addressing compliance gaps, and improving privacy and security measures across the organization.



Qualifications and Skills:



• Bachelor’s degree (or equivalent) in computer science or related field such as information security, data protection, law, or a related discipline.

• Proficiency with software for preparing reports and presentations

• Proven experience as a Data Protection Officer or in a similar role, preferably in a technology or data-driven organization.

• In-depth knowledge of global data protection laws and regulations, such as GDPR, CCPA, and other regional frameworks.

• Familiarity with privacy-by-design principles and practical implementation strategies.

• Strong understanding of data security, encryption, anonymization techniques, and data lifecycle management.

• Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to assess and manage privacy risks effectively.

• Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills to collaborate with cross-functional teams and stakeholders at all levels.

• Professional certifications such as Certified Information Privacy Professional (CIPP) or Certified Data Protection Officer (CDPO) are highly desirable.

• Knowledge of emerging technologies, such as artificial intelligence, machine learning, and cloud computing, and their implications for data protection is a plus.



Data Protection Officer and play a vital role in ensuring the privacy and security of sensitive data while driving compliance with global data protection regulations.

Apply your expertise in data privacy and make a meaningful impact on our company’s commitment to protecting data and maintaining the trust of our employees, customers and partners.
